Jobdesc: The Data Scientist role is to collaborate with the existing team of data scientists, data engineers, analysts and internal stakeholders to bring scientific, mathematical rigour and enhance statistical methods to identify opportunities that will drive new business initiatives and growth. Working with cross-functional teams within Technology Transformation Group (TTG), agency partners and external vendors, the person is expected to also implement, integrate and deploy developed algorithms / models from development to production into the current analytics system to avail deeper insights into our visitors to drive STB's strategic objectives and growth for Singapore’s tourism industry.
Jobres:
Main Responsibilities:

1. Project Management

a) Project manage and work closely with vendors and internal stakeholders to deliver on data science related implementations ensuring that deliverables and objectives are met within agreed scope and timelines.

b) Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, devops engineers, product managers, and business analysts and business stakeholders, to integrate and deploy models into current analytics platforms and production systems.

2. Application of Advanced Analytics and Data Science to Support Strategic Business Objectives

a) Work with large, complex datasets and solve non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as required (e.g., multi-objective optimisation, bayesian optimsation and inference, etc..) to address business use cases and aid in decision making.

b) Prepare, process, cleanse and verify the integrity of data collected for analysis. Apply data mining techniques, perform statistical analysis and build prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale.

c) Apply advanced machine learning techniques and models (e.g., LLMs, Autoencoders, GANs) to create machine learning-based tools or processes (e.g., recommendation engine(s), synthetic data generation, performance tracking through A/B testing, forecasting and predictive capabilities) to improve the current analytics capabilities.

d) Support and work closely with operational and strategic planning teams through the development of analytical capabilities and tools so that they are able to translate data into actionable insights.

3. Data Collection and Management

a) Collaborate with current team to review the existing data collection methods and make improvements to the current data collection strategy.

b) Enhance data collection procedures to identify and include suitable data for building analytic models relevant for industry transformation.

c) Analyse and assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources (e.g., datasets received from stakeholders, and annotation/ labelling of new training inputs).

d) Work with data and agency partners to assemble large, complex datasets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements.

e) Provide inputs to the design and development of an integrated data model to allow analysis across multiple structured and unstructured datasets.
Jobreq:
• Degree from a recognised university in a quantitative discipline: Data Science, Applied Mathematics & Statistics or Computer Science.

  • At least 3-5 years of relevant experience working in developing ML / AI mathematical models and successfully deploying at least 1 medium to large scale ML system.

  • Proven track record in managing internal and external stakeholders and delivering on objectives according to project timelines.

  • Good presentation and communication skills with ability to express complex ideas, data / concepts and outcomes of analysis clearly to business audiences.

  • Strong analytical skills with a good eye for detail and possess an aptitude/experience in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.

  • Ability to integrate and synthesise research and data across multiple sources to derive meaningful conclusions.

  • Possess extensive working experience solving analytical problems, including skills in statistical data analysis such as linear models, regression, multivariate analysis, stochastic models and sampling methods.

  • Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., k-NN, Bayesian Networks, SVM, Decision Forests etc.), machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and numerical methods (e.g., multi-objective optimisation, bayesian optimsation etc.)

  • Experience in using Qliksense and AWS services (e.g., SageMaker, Athena, RDS, ECR, ECS, EMR, Lambda, Redis) will be advantageous.

  • Experience with DevOps and deploying models through MLOps will be advantageous.

  • Experience working with structured and unstructured datasets is essential.

  • Proficient in statistical programming tools (e.g., R, Python), and database languages (e.g., SQL - DQL, DML, DDL)

  • Good command of written and spoken English

  • Strong planning, organisational, and time management skills

Jobdesc: EXECUTIVE/ ENGINEER, BRIDGES & TUNNEL MGMT

You will assist the team in the maintenance planning for road infrastructure assets (road tunnels / bridges, vehicular underpasses and road related facilities). The scopes include:

• Coordinating with both internal and external parties on all works affecting road infrastructure assets;

Jobdesc: The Waste Infrastructure Management Department (WIMD) under the Waste Infrastructure Operations & Management Division (WIOMD) oversees the availability of national waste disposal and incineration capacity, manages private waste facilities, waste disposal accounts and revenue collection by the Waste-to-Energy (WTE) plants and Tuas Marine Transfer Station.
Jobres:
You will work in the Waste Accounts Management Branch (WAMB) under WIMD which monitors the operation of the PPP WTE plants’ weighbridges, verifies the quantity of waste received and manages issues relating to weighbridges. WAMB also manages the security deposit of waste disposal account holders, as well as the billing and collection of refuse disposal fees. You will be responsible for the following:

Financial Processing and Reporting

  • Prepare deposit returns, create invoices, and process payments for various entities

  • Monitor revenue collection and reconcile discrepancies across systems

Account and Guarantee Management

  • Oversee refuse disposal accounts and manage Bankers' Guarantee renewals

  • Update account information and maintain proper documentation

Utility and Rental Administration

  • Handle electricity revenue remittance and charges

  • Manage land rental invoices and GIRO activations

Audit and Compliance Support

  • Provide financial data and reports for audits and year-end closing

  • Assist with regular Bankers' Guarantee audits

Interdepartmental Coordination

  • Liaise with finance, audit, and support teams to ensure accurate data and timely processes

  • Communicate with account holders and external entities as needed
Jobreq:
The job might be for you if you possess the following qualities:

  • Meticulous with strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Strong sense of responsibility, integrity and honesty

  • Team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills

  • Good command of spoken and written English

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office

  • Able to be part of the team for the site visits at the PPP IPs to conduct site audits when required

  • As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: Senior Engr Executive/Asst/Engineering Manager (Integrated Waste Mgmt Facility)
Jobdesc: You will form the core team of technical specialists working at NEA waste management facilities including Integrated Waste Management Facility (IWMF) - a large-scale waste management infrastructural project, and Tuas South Incineration Plant (TSIP). The work scope and job requirements are as follows:
Jobres:
You may be part of the project team to assist the engineer and supervise IWMF construction progress.  The work scope includes:

  • To work with project consultants and key stakeholders, such as other government agencies, on the design of the various facilities in IWMF and ensure that IWMF is constructed, erected, installed in accordance with design specifications and complying with statutory requirement.

  • To participate in the testing, commissioning of mechanical, process, or electrical, instrument, control and automation equipment/systems.

  • To attend factory acceptance tests (FATs) at local and overseas factories to witness and verify quality and performance of major equipment/systems.

You may be part of the technical team to assist the engineer in operation and maintenance of TSIP.  Your work scope includes:

  • To lead a unit of technical specialists and coordinate maintenance work between contractors and maintenance sections to ensure the safe, smooth and efficient operations of the waste-to-energy facility. 

  • To implement preventive maintenance and overhaul programs for the facility's electrical and control equipment such as turbo-generators, motors, switchgears, low tension and high tension equipment, distributed control system and field  instruments. 

  • To administer contracts for the operation and maintenance of mechanical, EICA or building services equipment                               

  • To enforce permit-to-work system and safe work culture including supervising contractors’ work for quality and safety

  • To assist in the formulation and preparation of standard operating and safety procedures, equipment testing/changeover programme

  • To perform shift work in a waste-to-energy facility, if needed

  • To assist engineer to implement initiatives on safety and continuous improvement to enhance the safety culture and standards within the plant, as well as drive projects to achieve operational excellence.
Jobreq:
• Diploma in any Engineering course or Nitec in any Engineering course

  • For Diploma holders, preferably with 3 years of relevant working experience.  Fresh diploma graduates can be considered.

  • For Nitec holders, preferably with 6 – 8 years of relevant working experience

  • Candidates with professional certification e.g. Licenced Electrical Worker, Boiler Attendant Certificate, Workplace Safety Health Officer, will be given preference

  • Good technical background and strong analytical skills. Knowledge in solid waste management would be an advantage.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, and preferably in Navisworks and Primavera P6 

  • Mature, independent, resourceful, and a good team player

  • Good interpersonal communication

  • Able to work in waste-to-energy facilities

  • Able to perform rotating shift work over public holidays and weekend if necessary

  • As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Applicants will be updated on the status of their application within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc: The Section Manager, Payroll Services leads a team of Senior Executives and Executives in handling payroll and claims processing for client government agencies.
Jobres:
• Oversee daily operations and ensure transactions are processed in compliance with prevailing legislation, policies, guidelines and practices.
• Put in place necessary structures, processes and procedures and use data analytics and prevailing workforce management and other tools and technologies to track progress of Service Requests, manage team and individual workload, facilitate effective resource planning and minimise service lapses.
• Carry out and guide staff on basic troubleshooting and management of bots and other automation tools, and work with the Ops-Tech team for more complex troubleshooting. Put in place contingency plans for bot failures and assess risks to operations and develop and implement risk mitigation plans.
• Address complex payroll cases and propose solutions/recommendations to resolve the issue. Identify and assess weakness/gaps in controls and implement measures to strengthen controls and mitigate risks.
• Oversee and address audit issues and observations via thorough investigations, implement and strengthen controls arising from audit lapses.
• Review Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and issue operating notices to streamline payroll and claims processes, including bonus payments, tax payments and CPF payments across all teams and agencies.
• Facilitate process reviews using digital tools or analytics and process improvement techniques, to remove or reduce unproductive steps within the workflows and introduce more efficient and productive ways.
• Establish and maintain close working relationships with Agency partners, policy and system owners, liaising on issues in the implementation of policies and escalating any issues, when required.
Jobreq:
•	Strong business, systems and process knowledge, and sound knowledge of HR and Payroll, and its eco-system and landscape 
•	Good collaboration and stakeholder engagement skills
•	Strong digital skills, especially in one or more of skills relating to data analytics, design thinking and automation

Shortlisted candidates may be deployed to either Buona Vista, MOE Building or Tanjong Pagar, MND Building.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Asst Manager/ Manager/ Executive Manager (International Affairs Department)
Jobdesc: The International Affairs Department (INAD) promotes and enhances cooperation between NEA and its counterparts in other countries and international organisations. You will be part of a high-performing department that assesses, formulates and recommends policies and strategies in a timely manner to safeguard and advance Singapore's environmental interests and standing at the bilateral, regional and international levels.
Jobres: In this role, you will be part of a team in formulating and implementing strategies to promote Singapore’s interests on environmental issues; monitor international trends and developments on environmental issues and; support NEA's participation in regional and international environmental meetings and negotiations.
Jobreq:
The job might be for you if you possess the following qualities:

  • Relevant knowledge in International Affairs, Environmental Studies, Humanities, and/or related fields.

  • 1 to 5 years of relevant experience.

  • Ability to motivate and collaborate with others.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Able to travel overseas on short notice.

  • Experience or keen interest in international environmental issues would be advantageous.

  • Able to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc: [LTA-LGL] LEGAL COUNSEL (PROSECUTION)
Jobres:
This Legal division provides legal services to various LTA divisions on land transport matters including the regulation of road traffic, autonomous vehicles, active mobility, point-to-point passenger transport and electric vehicle infrastructure.

You will be involved in prosecuting statutory offences under the purview of the Land Transport Authority. These statutory offences fall under a wide variety of Acts and the corresponding subsidiary legislation such as the Road Traffic Act, Parking Places Act, Street Works Act, Active Mobility Act, Motor Vehicles (Third-Party Risks and Compensation) Act and Electric Vehicle Charging Act. Training in advocacy, court craft, criminal procedure and evidence will be provided.

Additionally, you will also provide legal support and advice to enforcement and investigation divisions within the Land Transport Authority as well as liaise with the Attorney-General’s Chambers, the State Courts and Singapore Police Force.

Given the emerging and disruptive nature of the technology in the matters that the Division deals with, you will be challenged to be forward-thinking to anticipate and address implications from a legal perspective.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in Law
• Qualified Person under the Legal Profession Act or called to the Singapore Bar
• Pro-active, solution and service-oriented mind set
• Positive attitude, self-motivated, willing to learn, collaborative and a team player
• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
• Good communication, drafting and interpersonal skills

Jobdesc:
Are you interested in operations management? If so, we invite you to join our team at Traffic Police (TP), a unit within the
Singapore Police Force (SPF).
The SPF plays a critical role in keeping Singapore safe and secure, with a mission to prevent, deter, and detect crime. The
mission of the Traffic Police is to enhance the safety of road users through education, engagement, and enforcement, with
the vision of making Singapore roads the safest in the world.
As an Operations Executive in the Testing and Licensing Branch of Traffic Police, you will play a crucial role in managing
driving test operations, driving instructors, liaising with driving schools, and addressing public feedback. You are expected to
have a good understanding of the ground situation and propose suitable solutions to ensure operations run smoothly
according to prescribed standards. Additionally, you will troubleshoot problems, discuss and propose solutions with
supervisors.
You will be placed under the Management Executive Scheme.
Jobres:
The Operations Executive is responsible for managing the test centres operations, driving schools and instructors within the
prescribed testing regime and standards. This includes managing public feedback, conducting checks on driving and riding
tests, supervising the deployment of testers, coordinating the training of contract testers, ensuring optimal manpower
resources, and facilitating smooth operations at the test centres.
The Operations Executive serves as a subject matter expert for testing standards and requirements for different classes of
driving licences, providing sound advice and inputs to the design considerations of training and test routes, and ensuring that
training and testing standards for specified classes of licences are met.
The role involves managing the work performance of contract testers and driving instructors, ensuring adherence to the
stipulated driving test and instructor regime to ensure it meets the required key performance indicators and standards. The
Operations Executive is also responsible for collating and reviewing data reports concerning the test centres, driving schools
and instructors, providing ground inputs, and facilitating decision making at the management level.
You are to be open and adaptable to changes such as work processes, job rotations within the organisation and willing to
upgrade your skills to shoulder different job scope and responsibilities arising from the organisational changes in the SPF.
Jobreq:
REQUIREMENTS
• Any field of study or experience of performing testing-related roles for at least 5 years
• Prior knowledge of the operating environment on motorist training and testing will be an added advantage
• Proficiency in presentation, spreadsheet, and infographics software will be an added advantage.
• People management skills and resource management skills
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in verbal and written forms
• Class 2, 3, 4 and/or 5 driving licences holder(s) preferred
• Ability to work well in a team, lead in a team, meticulous in planning, and work under pressure and tight deadlines

Short-listed candidates will be notified within two weeks after the closing date of applications.

Jobdesc:
IMDA is spearheading Singapore’s drive to be a world leading Digital Economy. IMDA aims to empower our companies and workforce with digital technologies and enable Singapore to be a leading Digital Economy in the global area. BizTech group focuses on driving industry adoption of frontier technologies, such as AI/Data, 5G and Trust Technologies, and work with the National Research Foundation, Institutes of Higher Learning and Research Institutes on upstream research and translation at scale.

The successful candidate will be part of the Tech Policy team that advances policy to drive adoption and commercialisation of emerging technologies in Singapore, strengthening resilience and capturing economic opportunities.

Work scope includes:

  • Provide expert guidance and support on technology policy related issues and development
  • Be a thought leader on technology policies
  • Direct research and analysis on technology policies and their impact on various stakeholder
  • Develop strategies on the usage of emerging technologies based on research and analysis
  • Align IMDA’s efforts with broader national efforts, coordinating and cooperating across Government
  • Identify relevant international forums, partners and support activities to amplify IMDA’s voice and influence
  • Communicate and engage key external stakeholders on related issues

Key deliverables:

  • Strategic think-pieces and policy positions across BizTech Group’s tech areas - AI, quantum, 5G/6G, trust tech, green ICT
  • Updates on key developments and trends in tech policy areas 
  • Strategic narratives on BizTech Group initiatives 
  • Secure resources for BizTech Group’s ambitions

Requirements

  • At least 10 years of experience in working with technology teams in policy, research and/or engineering
  • Strategic thinker with collaborative attitude and a strong team player

  • International experience, industry experience and familiarity with the Singapore government highly valued

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Position will be commensurate with experience.

Jobtitle: Executive (Support) - School of Engineering [ITE College East]
Jobdesc: As an Executive (Support) staff to the School of Engineering, your role is to support policies and schemes in specific functional areas.
Jobres:
- Support the daily operation of services by assisting requestors to reserve facility through the Facility Reservation System on request, report any faults found in facility through ESV Helpdesk or email, ensure consumables are available for 3-in-1 printers in staff centre, contact vendor for servicing if printer is out of order.
- Manage enquiries from various stakeholders i.e. students, parents, public, agencies allowing students, vendors, visitors etc access to the staff centre , attend to students', vendors' and staff's queries, search & reserve suitable venue for event, covering of MSO (ME/EE) duties in his/her absence, collection & distribution of items for staff & students, issue A4 paper & stationery to staff, dispatch & collect mails / documents, inform CAS to arrange delivery of gifts / wreath, assist in distribution of certificates for Graduation Ceremony, other AD-HOC duties / requests, as well as supporting College’s events and functions.
- Monitoring and processing of the department’s budget by assisting requestors to fill in the RPA PR form, familiar with fund codes, ensuring correct account codes are used for the PRs, submit requestor's PR (eCAT/SVP/WTC) through KRIS, assist requestor to submit PR(ITQ) in KRIS, follow up on all PRs from approval to payment, send request to vendors for transport services till there is availability on behalf of requestors, raise PR for stationery, rubber stamps, copy charges, transport services, etc
- Monitoring and processing of the department’s finances by assisting requestors with information on Direct Payment/Staff Claim guidelines, procedure, fund codes & documentation, ensure direct payment forms are filled in correctly & supporting documents attached, submit DPs for approvals & to Finance for payments, prepare Virement & JAV forms, submit for approval & finance for processing, handling donation of book prizes from corporate partners, liaise with vendors on payment matters, delivery orders, etc 
- Maintain and upkeep records and inventory items
- Review and improve work processes
- Maintain proper documentation keeping
- Any other administrative duties as assigned
Jobreq:
- At least 2 years of relevant work experience
- Good interpersonal skills and communication skills (both in written and spoken)
- Self-motivated, self-disciplined with positive attitude
- Meticulous with financial matters, procurement and inventory
- Good time management and strong multi-tasking skills
- Technology savvy and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
- Candidate must be a good team player who is process/detail-oriented and organised
- Some knowledge of event management will be an advantage

Applicants may check their application status at the end of 8 weeks from the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc:
The Senior Manager assists in planning, promotion and development of Malay Activity Executive committees (MAECs) and PA MESRA (MAECs Council), so as to raise the level of outreach to and contributions by the Malay/Muslim community.
To facilitate PA MESRA’s collaboration with Mendaki and Muis as part of the M³ Ecosystem.

Key duties and responsibilities that need to be performed to meet the primary objective of the job. This will include the important result areas (what) along with the rationale (why)
• Provides effective secretariat and logistic support to PA MESRA;
• Ensures that PA MESRA operate in accordance to their objectives specified in the PA MESRA Rules and Regulations;
• Ensures that PA MESRA comply with the Financial Procedures as stipulated in their Rules and Regulations when they operate their bank accounts;
• Monitors, updates and reports on profile of MAECs, and Key Performance Indicators set for MAECs;
• Co-ordinates with MAEC Staff-in-Charge on the execution of new initiatives and programmes for MAECs;
• Communicates with MAEC Chairmen and MAEC Staff-in-Charge and external Malay Muslim Organisations (MMOs);

• Work with MESRA/MAECs and the MMO to rally their support for the M³ Focus Areas and
initiatives to uplift the MM community;
• Builds positive working relationships with Malay organisations in Singapore to strengthen
collaborations with them;
• Assists in coordinating dialogues between Malay Advisers and Malay organisations and
follow-ups with relevant Ministries and Government agencies on recommendations raised
during the dialogues;
• Assists Assistant Director to formulate, implement and review budget for Inter-Ethnic
Engagement Section;
• Assists to engage the Corporate Partners under the purview of the Inter-Ethnic
Engagement Section.

Other ad-hoc duties not covered under main responsibilities and duties.
• Performs other duties assigned by supervisors

Knowledge & Skills

Minimum - Three years of work experience
Desired - Three years of managerial experience in a community organisation. Experience in policy and operations work. Experience working with Grassroots Leaders.

Others - MS Office literacy, good interpersonal skills

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Successful candidates will be given a 3-year contract.

A little bit about who we are...
The Community Chest, formed since 1983, is the largest centralised fund-raising body for social services in Singapore to lighten social service organisations from the burden of fund-raising. The mandate of the Group was expanded in 2015 to include the role of Secretariat to the President’s Challenge, Office of the President of Singapore, and has gone beyond traditional fund-raising to engaging the community, public, family offices, foundations and the corporates in creating sustainable solutions to address social challenges and foster a more inclusive society.
Jobres:
The role as we see it...

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join our Philanthropic Partnerships team, focusing on fundraising and partnership development with individual donors, Family Offices, Foundations and Legacy Partners.

In this role, you will be responsible for crafting and executing strategies to engage philanthropic donors, corporations, and partners to support the mission and programs of the Community Chest of Singapore. You will lead efforts to secure funding while building long-term partnerships that maximize resources and drive social impact.

You should take pride in your commitment to excellence, both individually and within a team, possess a keen attention to detail and thrive in a fast-paced, high-performance environment. We place a premium on your ability in managing demanding stakeholder relationships with professionalism and poise. You excel under pressure, adeptly resolve conflicts, and focus on building sustainable, long-term partnerships.

Areas you should be passionate about and excel in...

1. Strategy Development: Create and implement comprehensive strategies to engage philanthropic donors and partners, aligning efforts with the organization's mission and objectives. Identify and establish partnerships with philanthropic donors, corporations, government agencies, trade associations, and Social Service Agencies (SSAs) to leverage resources and maximize impact. Identify and cultivate new donor segments/revenue streams by leveraging the extensive suite of NCSS resources, including matching grants and government-backed initiatives.

2. Sector Development & Advocacy: Foster and maintain strong relationships with individual donors, foundations, corporations, and other stakeholders to increase the giving of Time, Treasure and Talent. Lead sector-specific fundraising initiatives, including campaigns, events, and appeals, in close coordination with internal and external stakeholders.

3. Collaboration & Stakeholder Management: Collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure fundraising efforts are aligned with organizational goals. Work with Committees and key stakeholders to strategise and implement various philanthropic and volunteerism initiatives.

4. Donor Management, Insights and Reporting: Develop and maintain systems for tracking and reporting on fundraising activities to ensure accountability and transparency. Utilize and refine donor data and insights to enhance donor experience and satisfaction. Ensure risk management / mitigation on systems and public facing platforms and touchpoints.

5. Strategic Communication: Craft compelling messages and materials that effectively convey the impact of philanthropic support and partnerships to donors, partners, and the broader community.
Jobreq:
Possessing these qualities will help you immensely...

Personal Competencies:

1. Highly motivated, meticulous and organised

2. Business acumen combined with high emotional intelligence

3. Analytical with the ability to make good judgement calls

4. Resourceful, agile and proactive in taking initiative 

5. Embraces ambiguity while continuously seeks progress and improvement 6. Capable of working effectively both independently and collaboratively in fast-paced environments

7. Passionate about creating a meaning impact in the social service sector

Skills & Knowledge:

1. Proven track record of successfully securing major gifts, grants, and/or partnerships

2. Excellent networking and relationship-building skills, with the ability to engage and influence diverse stakeholders

3. Effective written and verbal communication skills, with the experience in crafting persuasive proposals and presentations

4. Advanced data literacy and comfortable with analysing spreadsheets and dashboards

5. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

Jobdesc: Temporary contract role in the Academic Affairs Department [Several vacancies available]
Jobres:
You may be required to work on any of the following job scopes:

1. Handling of Admissions Hotline. [4 vacancies; contract period Dec 2024 to May 2025] 
i. Handle call enquiries on Admissions and Enrolment matters
ii. Logging of enquiries
iii. Contacting applicants and students on submission of application and enrolment documents
iv. Any other administrative duties

2. Processing of applications and appeals for applicants with ITE Certificate / foreign qualification [1 vacancy; contract period Feb to Apr 2025] 
i. Updating and Verification of application records in system
ii. Creation of appeal records in system
iii. Printing out of document submission from Admissions email account
iv. Generating, printing, photocopying, mailing and filing of the application outcome to applicants
v. Updating and tracking of appeal record in e-work team site
vi. Retrieval of forms/ applicant records for evaluation
vii. Cleaning up of applicant data in system
viii. Any other administrative duties

3. Handling of Enrolment Exercises [1 vacancy; contract period Jan to May 2025] 
i. Assisting in the emailing of enrolment packages to successful applicants
ii. Assisting in enrolment activities such as
a. Updating of submission of documents in system
b. Scanning of photographs, printing of matriculation cards & distribution to schools
c. Following-up with students on submission of outstanding documents
d. Scanning and verifying enrolment documents for E-dossier
e. Filing of student dossier
iii. Any other administrative duties

4. Assisting with data cleaning of student records and handling of graduation matters [1 vacancy; contract period Apr to May 2025] 
i. Assisting with data cleaning of records such as addresses and contact numbers
ii. Checking of softcopy graduand registration cards by sessions
iii. Assisting in ad-hoc graduation registration and support other operational activities
iv. Any other administrative duties
Jobreq:
•	Tertiary qualification
•	Good interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
•	Meticulous and is a team player
•	Able to commit to the full contract period required

Jobdesc: As a Landscape Architect, you will join a team of versatile Landscape Architects to chart and review HDB’s landscape design policies, establish scope of services of external landscape consultants, and prepare design briefs and tender documents for implementation of landscape works in BTO or estate upgrading projects.
Jobres: You will have the opportunity to manage landscape projects of BTO developments and complex strategic inter-agency landscape projects from inception till completion, and to ensure that they are implemented within time, budget and of high quality for handover to Authorities & Town Councils.  You may also be called upon to undertake hands-on landscape design supervised by HDB’s in-house landscape design studio where necessary.  In addition, you may also be required to prepare and call tender for Environmental Impact Studies (EIA), monitor the progress, evaluate and provide inputs to housing developments plans based on the EIA findings.
Jobreq:
·	You should possess a relevant background in Landscape Architecture. A minimum of 5 years of relevant working experience in a professional landscape practice & familiar with local Building Codes, especially NParks and PUB’s ABC Waters design requirements.  Knowledge and experience in design and implementation of large scale landscape projects, urban design projects and landscape masterplanning projects will be an advantage. 
·    Keen interest and knowledge in local biodiversity & tropical plant species, technical detailing and landscape material knowledge.
·    Able to adopt landscape design or planning strategies that promotes the integration of building design and landscape to promote high quality user experience in high rise high density HDB development contexts.  
·    Able to communicate effectively and possess a good command of English and writing skills, a passion for service delivery, and an ability to work independently.


All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc:
At the Ministry of Transport (MOT), we spearhead developments in Singapore’s land, sea and air transport sectors to advance Singapore’s economic competitiveness and Singaporeans’ quality of life.  We seek dynamic, analytical and committed individuals to join our able MOT team in realising the vision of a world-class transportation system and a global interconnected hub.
 
If you share our vision and possess the qualities we seek, join us!
Jobres:
Our air hub is of strategic and existential importance for Singapore. It supports economic links and people-to-people flows with the rest of the world, and catalyses growth opportunities for the Singapore economy. 

As competition from other air hubs in the region intensifies, we must ensure our air hub’s competitiveness for today and the future. 

You will be part of a team of officers that develops and reviews strategies and policies to strengthen the Singapore air hub’s competitiveness. This includes developing strategies to support Singapore’s air connectivity with other regions and countries, to deepen our passenger and cargo networks in a globally contestable market. This also includes developing and reviewing policies to ensure the Singapore air hub remains safe, meets its sustainability goals, prioritises manpower productivity, and is future-ready. 

Looking to the future, the Changi East/ Terminal 5 development is a significant mega-project that will be operational by the mid-2030s. The team works closely with stakeholders on the planning and project management of this critical project. This includes planning for and reviewing its design, financing, and operations, to ensure that Changi will continue to remain competitive, efficient, and a place for Singaporeans. 

In the course of your work, you will develop and review policies, which will include the collation and analysis of data, and a good understanding of the aviation ecosystem that supports our air hub. You will work closely with the Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore and other Government agencies. You will also be required to work with key industry stakeholders such as the Changi Airport Group, airlines, and ground handlers.
Jobreq:
a.	Strong critical reasoning, with good analytical, numerical, and problem-solving skills.
b.	Excellent writing and communication.
c.	Good interpersonal skills, able to work well with diverse stakeholders with different interests, to drive collaboration, convergence and concrete outcomes.
d.	Comfortable with ambiguity, with a bias towards action, and a curiosity that drives learning. 
e.	Good team player with a positive, can-do attitude.

Jobdesc: The Senior Manager/Manager (Innovation) contributes to organisational excellence by driving process improvement efforts as well as digital initiatives to automate business processes in the areas of Finance, HR/ Payroll, Procurement processing, etc., and elevating the digital capabilities of VITAL officers to raise productivity and accelerate VITAL’s digital transformation. We are looking for candidates who have relevant experience or competency in planning, project management and process re-engineering.
Jobreq:
1.	Preferably 1-3 years of relevant working, internship or attachment experience. Applicants with no prior working experience are welcome too.
2.	Familiar with planning, business case formulation, and concepts in continuous and process improvement.
3.	Motivated individual with strong work ethic, and able to work effectively in a team.
4.	Able to think strategically, innovate and apply creativity in problem solving.
5.	Strong project management, communication, and facilitation skills. Able to communicate effectively with different levels of stakeholders (including senior management). 
6.	Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel and Powerpoint). 
7.	Competency in SharePoint and web development programming languages, such as HTML, CSS, XML and JavaScript as well as UX design for website development and .NET Framework will be an added advantage
8.	Good grasp of emerging digital and technology trends. Familiarity with automation and workflow solutions (e.g. UiPath, Blue Prism, K2, SharePoint), and data visualisation tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau) is an added advantage

Jobdesc: The Account Manager fosters strong partnership and collaboration between VITAL and its partners to deliver on partnership outcomes.
Jobres:
	Serves as the single point of contact for the client agencies and acts as an escalation point on agency issues and feedback
	Proactively engage agencies to develop sound understanding of agency's corporate services needs and explore collaboration opportunities
	Partner agencies and internal operations units to ensure that the agency’ needs are met and concerns of operations units are addressed/mitigated.
	Project VITAL’s role as a central agency for transformation and delivery of corporate shared services to Singapore government
	Project VITAL positively through regular updates of VITAL’s developments and initiatives 
	Articulate VITAL’s Accountability Statement framing VITAL’s relationship with agencies, our roles and responsibilities as the Central Agency for Corporate Shared Services and commitment to deliver high quality services with good corporate accountability
	Ensures that the Schedule detailing the services subscribed and related service performance targets, key performance indicators, roles and responsibilities are updated 
	Oversee and manage the end-to-end onboarding of new businesses
	Communicate service fees and resolve any disputes in fees in collaboration with agencies, VITAL’s Corporate Finance and operations units
	Lead agency meetings, prepare meeting materials and follow-up on matters arising till closure
	Analyse and prepare reports on service performance 
	Lead and drive agency engagement efforts and programmes to promote and strengthen service culture

	Strong skill-sets in account management and relationship management.

	Prior experience in shared services centre, engagements and partnerships roles are desirable

Jobdesc: We are seeking a highly motivated Executive to join our Finance Services team.  As a key member of our organisation, you will be responsible for managing and administering Finance Services for our service partners.

Jobdesc: We are seeking a highly motivated Executive to join our Human Resource Services team. -	Liaise with stakeholders to ensure timely resolution of operational issues.

-	Compile reports/submissions following established formats and SOP 
-	Carry out periodic reviews and archive file records regularly based on data policy
-	Exercise independent analysis and judgement according to SOPs and recommend course of action when responding to Service Partners. Highlight potential changes required to SOP to HR supervisors due to changes in policy or business process.
-	Provide excellent customer service and timely response to service partners to address their queries 
-	Work with assigned vendors where related to the business process
-	Constantly review work processes and systems and suggest possible improvements to achieve greater efficiency and effectiveness
-	Participate in the implementation of change management to work processes due to changes in HR system, HR policy or new technologies
-	Participate or volunteer in department, cross-departmental and organisation level initiatives, ad-hoc projects or tasks assigned by supervisors or by the organisation.
Jobreq:
We are looking for individuals who are passionate to join us in transforming the delivery of Corporate Services for the Public Service. To be successful in the role, you should possess the following attributes and competencies:
-	1 to 2 years of experience in HR processing and handling of HR system is preferred; Candidates without relevant experience but possess good attitude and willingness to learn are welcome to apply
-	Preferred Course of Studies in Business Administration or Human Resource
-	Strong judgement and analytical skills
-	Good attention to details
-	Ability to work under pressure and deliver within stipulated timelines
-	Effective oral and written communication with good presentation skills
-	Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
-	Strong stakeholder management and customer service skills
-	Logical and Critical thinking abilities
-	IT savvy with excellent grasp of Microsoft Office and strong appreciation for current and upcoming technologies such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), data analytics, artificial intelligence and other tools (e.g., Access, Macros, Power Query, VBA, Tableu, PowerBI) will be advantageous
-	Knowledge of HR/Payroll Software (Excelity Payroll, Workday, SAP) will be advantageous.
-	Certification in HR or experience in HR will be considered a plus 

Note: Kindly provide your resume/CV in pdf format without any bookmarks.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Associate / Assistant Director, Notes & Services Div.(1-Year Contract)
Jobdesc:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.
Jobres:
You will be part of a team in the Currency Department that is responsible for managing the Automated Materials Handling System (AMHS) that supports the issuing, receiving and processing of Singapore currency notes.  Details of the team’s roles and responsibilities are as follows:

  • Manage the AMHS to ensure the daily currency issuance activities are carried out efficiently and accurately

  • Support implementation of the AMHS upgrading project in areas such as on-site work preparation and supervision, coordination with vendors, user-acceptance testing and contract management  

  • Manage AMHS vendors to achieve optimal performance of the AMHS and ensure contractual requirements are met 

  • Administer the AMHS preventive system maintenance and security patching activities

  • Manage the AMHS spare parts and consumables inventories
Jobreq:
• Degree in Technology, Engineering or equivalent qualifications

  • Minimum one year of work experience, preferably in material-handling operations, operations engineering or supply chain automation operations

  • Good interpersonal, communication and analytical skills

  • Able to work on weekends and after office hours when required

  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders and be able to respond to changes and developments quickly

  • As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment

  • All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting

Agncy: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Jobdesc:
The Operation Analysis Branch oversees and coordinates ground-sensing information collection effort, analyse and synthesise the information to apprise SMT for policy decision making, or other regulatory/operational follow-up actions.

•	We are looking for individuals with passion and experiences in the field of information collation and preferably with intelligence analysis.
•	In this position, you will report to the Operational Analysis Manager.
•	You will liaise and coordinate with frontline divisions on ground-sensing information collection, manage and synthesise the information in support of Operational Analysis Manager in putting up reports to apprise senior management for policy decision making, or other regulatory/operational follow-up actions.
Jobres:
The job holder is expected to perform the following roles:
•	Receive and collate information from the LOs relating to the various Organization of Interests (OOIs) and Subject of Interests (SOIs).
•	Coordinate with the Liaison Officers on the information collection, and subsequent clarifications and enrichment of information.
•	Collate disparate information collected from various sources and organize them into useful clusters according to the Subject of Interests for further analysis.
•	Synthesize the information and identify information gaps, calibrating information collection efforts.
•	Support in analysis of the information gathered and development of intelligence reports to facilitate MSF policy and operational decisions.
•	Assist in the strategic analysis of the information collected by managing the information and grouping them according to their strategic implications.
•	Assist in the preparation of regular or ad hoc situation reports to update senior management on key issues and cases of interest.
Jobreq:
•	Experience in the field of information collation and intelligence analysis
•	Good and effective written and communications skills.
•	Good liaison and inter-personal skills to work effectively with the Liaison Officers or Divisional Directors on the information gathered. 
•	Ability to work with statistical tools to dissect, synthesize and work with data for analysis and presentation.

Jobdesc:
At the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), we strive to build a Great Workforce and a Great Workplace. We work to achieve a globally competitive workforce and great workplace, for a cohesive society and a secure economic future for all Singaporeans. Our work transcends the boundaries of our desks – it takes us to real workplaces all over Singapore. We are continually on the lookout for individuals who want to make a difference and impact lives in the core areas of our work. 

We are seeking a highly organised and detail-oriented Work Pass Applications Manager to oversee the end-to-end process of work pass applications for foreign employees. The ideal candidate should have a good understanding of Singapore's work pass regulations and experience in leading a team to ensure timely processing of applications.
Jobres:
•	To oversee and manage a team of officers in the daily operations to ensure that all Work Pass applications are captured accurately into the system for further processing
•	To participate or lead projects to make system and operational process changes to meet policy objectives, increase operational efficiency or improve customer service
•	Perform data mining and analysis for process reviews, and adopt new technologies to enhance workflows.
•	Handle escalated enquiries from customers as well as other MOM sections/departments, on work pass matters. 
•	Perform other ad hoc duties assigned by supervisors
Jobreq:
•	Tertiary qualifications in any discipline with at least 1 year of working experience 
•	Good communication (written and spoken) and interpersonal skills 
•	Strong in operations management skills
•	Possess analytical and problem-solving skills
•	Able to supervise a team of junior officers
•	Proficient in MS Word and Excel; some basic computer programming skills or RPA skills will be advantageous
•	Some experience in vendor management (tender process, ensuring quality of work, etc) will be a bonus

*PWDs are welcome to apply

Jobtitle: (Senior) Development Partner. Industry Human Capital (PME & Leaders)
Jobdesc:
You will play a key role in the Industry Human Capital (IHC) Division, driving EnterpriseSG’s efforts to grow Singapore enterprises through the development of talent, leadership and manpower strategies and capabilities.

At the PME & Leaders’ department, we believe in enterprise-led talent development efforts so that the talent become catalysts to accelerate the growth of enterprises. Our work entails engaging enterprises to support the development of global-ready and R&D talent, at both the young talent level (fresh grad with less than 3 years of experience) and for their middle management bench strength. Through a deep understanding of their unique challenges, we work with them to co-create solutions through in-house knowledge transfer from P&C, EA, GW or with our external ecosystem partners.
Jobres: You will develop a broad perspective and gain deep insights on global human capital trends, national manpower and education policies, and talent and leadership opportunities and challenges faced by companies. You will acquire skills in policy development, programme design and management, problem solving and stakeholder engagement. We love to have data substantiate our proposals, so you will have a chance to run data analysis and hone your data storytelling skills.
Jobreq:
We seek a self-initiated individual who is passionate about supporting local enterprises, and believes that talent (i.e. the people behind the work) is the magic factor that powers continued business growth. Some of current key projects include:

  • The Singapore Global Executive Programme to support high growth enterprises in the grooming of globally savvy young talent. People with experience in talent management (attraction, development, engagement and retention) will be an advantage
  • Develop and manage PME Leadership programmes to increase specific pools of talent shortage, such as talent to drive market expansion, talent for deep tech research, leadership benchstrength such as Industrial Post-graduate Programme, Leadership Development Initiative
  • Employer Branding initiatives to uplift good Singapore enterprises as an employer of choice, such as the annual published Good Company Report 
  • Business Partnering the frontline Industry Clusters to support enterprises’ manpower/talent needs
  • Having industry experience and/or knowledge of Singapore government’s manpower policies and programmes is advantageous, but not necessary.

Jobdesc:
[What the role is]
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.

[What you will be working on]

Banking Department is keen to recruit a Financial Risk Specialist to support the supervision of financial institutions’ trading activities and management of the attendant risks.

As a Financial Risk Specialist, you will be part of a team in charge of:

  • Evaluating banks’ front office controls, risk management and valuation processes and methodologies, as well as their valuation, market and counterparty risk models.  Crafting supervisory guidance, as needed, to raise the quality of market risk management will also be part of this responsibility. 

  • Identifying system-wide risks in the banking sector by analysing regulatory risk returns and developing risk indicators using supervisory and publicly available data. 

  • Researching into new risk management techniques/framework in response to market developments; and

  • Providing consultation in the areas of risk analytics, risk modelling and valuation practices to other departments within MAS. 

[What are we looking for]

  • Front office or market risk management experience with a financial institution preferred.

  • Strong interest in developments in the financial markets. 

  • Good knowledge of financial products and their related financial risks. 

  • Proficient in use of analytical tools/software. 

  • Inquisitive, analytical, quantitative, and has an eye for detail.  

  • Ability to communicate technical knowledge well, both spoken and in writing.

  • Relevant certification in Quantitative Finance or professional qualifications like CFA, PRM or FRM will be advantageous.

This is a 1-year contract position. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 

We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success. 

Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results. 

Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.

At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 

Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.

About the NextGen Programme
Looking to jumpstart your career? Our NextGen Programme offers technical and professional training across various dynamic and collaborative domains, enhancing your skills and enables you to contribute to impactful projects. Since its inception in 2015, this programme has nurtured 5 cohorts of passionate tech professionals.

NextGen Programme Structure
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding career in a progressive workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you: 
• Technical Training: Gain essential technical knowledge through a blend of formal and informal training.
• Experiential Learning: Contribute to impactful national ICT projects, advancing technology and critical initiatives.
• Job Rotations: Rotate across different departments or job functions including stretch assignments to broaden your expertise.
• Leadership Development: Participate in programmes designed for career progression.
• Mentorship: Receive guidance from a mentor to achieve your career goals.

As a NextGener, you will embark on a permanent tenure and will start as a Junior Term in the initial 2-year. This phase will lay the foundation for your IT career within CPF Board. Exceptional individuals will have the chance to progress to the Senior Term for an additional 2-year, where you will benefit from job rotation to gain diverse experiences, deepen your IT knowledge based across multiple facets of the IT landscape.  Those who excel during the Senior Term may be selected to join the Board's talent management programme. Regardless of progression path, all NextGeners will have the opportunity to continue contributing your expertise and make meaningful impact with the Board.
Jobres:
• Innovative and Impactful national ICT Projects: Harness on technology to support Singaporeans in funding their needs in retirement, housing and healthcare. 
• Diverse Opportunities: Explore and work in a wide range of areas with a team of 700 IT professionals with diverse job functions from Application Development & Support, Cloud Computing, ICT Infrastructure, Cybersecurity, DevSecOps to Robotics & Automation.
• Professional Growth: Gain essential technical knowledge through on-the-job training, and a structured leadership development programme.

We are dedicated to the ethos of "Work Smarter, Live Better" by continually innovating and optimising our work processes. Our goal is to harness emerging technologies and develop future-ready skills, enabling you to utilise cutting-edge advancements like GenAI and cloud-based resources to deliver seamless IT solutions. These efforts enhance our overall well-being and support the creation of a high-performing, scalable, and sustainable IT workforce that excels in an ever-evolving tech landscape. Join us in exploring the following functions:

• Application Development & Support: you will analyse user requirements, designing and implementing solutions, supporting regular updates, testing, fixing errors, ensuring security, and facilitating communication with stakeholders.
• Cloud Computing: you will manage cloud resources, ensuring smooth operation, and supporting software development and deployment in the cloud environment.
• ICT Infrastructure: you will be responsible for designing, implementing, securing, and maintaining our servers, storage systems, and operating systems to ensure maximum uptime, performance, and reliability.
• Cybersecurity: you will be at the forefront of protecting the Board's digital assets, employing proactive measures to prevent, detect, and respond to threats from risk assessments to network monitoring to ensure robust security protocols and user education, fortifying our defenses.
• DevSecOps: you will blend software development, IT operations, and security practices to streamline secure software delivery.
• Robotics & Automation: you will create and refine robotics systems and automated processes to improve efficiency from conducting testing to ensure functionality and collaborate with teams to integrate these solutions seamlessly into existing workflows.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse talents and experiences that each individual brings to the table. While mastery of every requirement may not be necessary, familiarity and expertise in some of the following areas will position you for success within this team. 
We are seeking passionate Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident, either fresh IT graduates or IT professionals with no more than 2 years of experience to join our team.
• Thinking clearly and making sound judgements: Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.
• Working as a team: Ability to form effective partnerships and collaborate across teams, with strong relationship-building and communication skills.
• Working effectively with citizens and stakeholders: Ability to engage, rally, and mobilise stakeholders toward common goals
• Keep learning and putting skills into action: Possess curiosity and courage to learn, adapt, and apply new skills and knowledge in the face of evolving work practices.
• Improving and innovating continuously: Possess an agile mindset to seek continual improvements and demonstrate boldness in exploring new ideas while managing associated risks.
• Serving with heart, commitment, and purpose: Demonstrate genuine care and empathy for stakeholders by considering issues from their perspectives.

What you can expect
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding career in a progressive workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you:  
• Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance.
• A vibrant community of like-minded and friendly colleagues, where collaboration and creativity thrive. 
• A hybrid work model that offers flexibility for remote work, subject to exigencies of service.
• Flexible dress code that empowers you to choose your appropriate outfit for the day.
• A comprehensive rewards package that includes annual leave, pro-family leave, medical and dental benefits, and access to recreational activities.

Are you ready to be at the forefront of tech? We want you to help build the future CPF Board for future generations! 

Application Process
1. Submit Your Application: Click on the "Apply Now" button below and ensure you include your most recent educational transcript along with details of your class of degree obtained or expected in your submission.
2. Online Assessments: Candidates who meet the eligibility criteria will be invited to complete our online assessment.
3. Assessment Centre: Shortlisted candidates will be contacted to attend a one-day Assessment Centre in person, scheduled between November to December 2024.
4. Interview: If selected, you will be invited for a final onsite interview with our core management team.
5. Application Outcome: Our HR team will notify you of the application outcome by February 2025. Successful candidates will embark on their journey with #TeamCPF starting in July 2025.

Discover more about the NextGen Programme on our CPFB NextGen Programme page.

Your journey towards a fulfilling and impactful tech career starts here. Apply now and take the first step towards a future of endless possibilities with CPF Board!
