At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 

We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success. 

Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results. 

Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.

At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 

Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.

About the Management Associate Programme
Are you a natural trailblazer? Do you have what it takes to lead us into the future? Our Management Associate Programme offers you an opportunity to be at the forefront of contributing to the development and implementation of policies that will create impactful outcomes to the lives of Singaporeans.

Management Associate Programme Structure
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding career in a progressive workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you: 
• Holistic Development: You will gain a deep understanding of CPF policies and strategies through a structured training programme and work on a broad range of challenging and impactful projects.
• Mentorship and Career Progression: You will receive guidance from our experienced leaders to develop your core leadership competencies and prepare you for higher-level positions. 
• Interdisciplinary Exposure: You will undergo two rotations and take on stretch assignments to get to know the nuts and bolts of the Board’s operations. 

Our Management Associate Programme offers two rotations over a 2-year term, aimed at establishing the foundation for your career at the CPF Board.

Those who demonstrate potential and excel in their work during the tenure of the 2-year Management Associate appointment may be invited to join the Senior Term to further their career development, for an additional 2 years through a third rotation. Officers who performed well and demonstrated leadership potential will be admitted into the Board’s talent management programme.
Jobres:
• Innovative and National Projects: Work on essential policies and schemes that support retirement, housing, and healthcare for 4 million Singaporeans.
• Diverse Opportunities: Explore and work in a wide range of areas with a team that possess diverse job capabilities including Policy and Corporate Development, Schemes Delivery, Agency Services, Enforcement, and Infocomm Technology.
• Professional Growth: Gain essential technical knowledge through on-the-job training, and a structured leadership development programme.

As an MA, you will embark on a transformative learning journey, gaining expertise across various sectors and schemes, contributing to the development and implementation of policies that create impactful outcomes for Singaporeans in one of these functions:
• Policy and Corporate Development: You will harness the power of data to strategically design policies to shape the future. Access ample opportunities to grow and provide expertise in communications, strategic planning, audit and more.
• Schemes Delivery: You will innovate and improve ways to better oversee CPF accounts and serve members in meeting their changing needs to access their savings for approved uses to meet their retirement, housing, healthcare, and other needs.
• Agency Services: You will be the bridge between CPF members, government agencies and our organisation to ensure seamless implementation of national schemes to benefit CPF members.
• Enforcement: You will work hand-in-hand with employers to ensure our CPF members receive accurate and timely CPF contributions. 
• Infocomm Technology: You will push the boundaries of technology to provide innovative solutions to serve our staff and CPF members.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse talents and experiences that each individual brings to the table. While mastery of every requirement may not be necessary, familiarity and expertise in some of the following areas will position you for success within this team. 

We are seeking passionate Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident, either fresh graduates or working professionals with no more than 2 years of experience to join our team.

• Thinking clearly and making sound judgements: Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.
• Working as a team: Ability to form effective partnerships and collaborate within and across teams, with strong relationship-building and communication skills.
• Working effectively with citizens and stakeholders: Ability to engage, rally, and mobilise stakeholders toward common goals and effectively co-create solutions with them.
• Keep learning and putting skills into action: Possess the drive and curiosity to learn, adapt, and apply new skills and knowledge in the face of evolving work practices.
• Improving and innovating continuously: Possess an agile mindset to seek continual improvements, demonstrate boldness in exploring new ideas while managing associated risks, and leverage data to gain insights for decision-making. 
• Serving with heart, commitment, and purpose: Demonstrate genuine care and empathy for stakeholders by considering issues from their perspectives.

Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding career in a progressive workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you:  
• Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance.
• A vibrant community of like-minded and friendly colleagues, where collaboration and creativity thrive. 
• A hybrid work model that offers flexibility for remote work, subject to exigencies of service.
• Flexible dress code that empowers you to choose your appropriate outfit for the day.
• A comprehensive rewards package that includes annual leave, pro-family leave, medical and dental benefits, and access to recreational activities.

Are you ready to embark on a journey to become a compassionate leader? We want you to help build the future CPF Board for future generations!

Application Process
1. Submit Your Application: Click on "Apply" button below and ensure you include your most recent educational transcript along with details of your class of degree obtained or expected in your submission.
2. Online Assessments: Candidates who meet the eligibility criteria will be invited to complete our online assessment.
3. Assessment Centre: Shortlisted candidates will be contacted to attend a one-day Assessment Centre in person from December 2024 to February 2025.
4. Interview: If selected, you will be invited for a final onsite interview with our core management team.
5. Application Outcome: Our HR team will notify you of the application outcome by April 2025. Successful candidates will embark on their journey with #TeamCPF starting in July 2025.

Discover more about the Management Associate Programme on our CPFB Management Associate Programme page.

Your journey towards a fulfilling and impactful career starts here. Apply now and take the first step towards a future of endless possibilities with CPF Board!

Jobdesc:
The Accountant-General's Department (AGD), a department under the Ministry of Finance (Singapore), is at the centre of public sector finance. We partner with government agencies to strengthen financial management capabilities and drive finance transformation initiatives across the public sector.

"One Career, Many Opportunities" is AGD's core employee value proposition. We are dedicated to developing finance leaders to take on key leadership (C-suite) positions, across the public sector.

As a Lead Associate or Senior Associate at the Government Finance Function Office (GFFO), you will be part of the Capability Development (Internal Audit and Finance) and Risk Management team. In this role, you will drive finance and internal audit functional leadership development efforts within the Public Service by enhancing the professional development and engagement of finance and internal audit officers, as well as managing cross-cutting risk areas related to finance and internal audit across the whole of government.
Jobres:
•	Build workforce capabilities by identifying key emerging competencies in line with broader industry trends and WOG priorities for the Public Sector Finance and IA officers e.g. of emerging capabilities include data analytics, digitalisation and sustainability reporting/assurance
•	Strategize the adoption of the Finance Competency Framework and the Internal Audit Competency Framework and review of the learning and development roadmaps of finance and IA officers, supported by partnerships with Civil Service College and professional bodies 
•	Plan for engagement events and initiatives to promote cohesiveness within the function and cascade messages from the functional office to officers on the ground
•	Strengthen risk management through the development of an Enterprise Risk Management Framework for the Finance and IA functions
Jobreq:
•	Bachelor's degree in Accountancy, Finance, or a related field; CA (Singapore) qualification preferred.
•	A minimum of 8 years of internal audit experience, including prior supervisory roles. 
•	Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage diverse stakeholders, including senior management. 
•	A collaborative and energetic team player who excels in fast-paced environments.
•	*Please note that this position is offered on a 2-year contract basis.

Jobdesc: You serve as the principal safety trainer and educator to raise safety awareness and standards in the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) Medical Corps by developing, implementing and monitoring the safety training and education program in the Medical Corps.
Jobres: You also conduct safety audits of SAF's medical training and clinical facilities, carry out safety investigations to determine the causal factors of accidents and near misses, and recommend remedial actions to prevent recurrence. In addition, you compile regular safety updates and reports, and present them at relevant meetings. Your challenge lies in internalising the safety culture in the attitude and behaviour of staff in SAF Medical Corps such that implementation of safety is second nature during both work and play.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification in Nursing, Medical or Biomedical Sciences, with at least 5 years' working experience. If you are a healthcare worker, you should be registered with the relevant local authority (e.g. Singapore Nursing Board). You should have a keen eye for details to be able to scrutinise policies, workflows and processes. Possession of strong interpersonal skills to communicate with the different stakeholders is essential. Ability to multitask is advantageous.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc:
Reporting to the Manager (who in turn reports to Deputy Director/Finance), the responsibilities for this role include:

Job Description

Financial Management
• Process receipts and perform reconciliation of collections for Power System Operation charges and Inspectorate licence fees;
• Raise adjustment journals;
• Monitor accruals and raise reversal entries;
• Monitor suspense accounts and prepare month-end balance sheet schedules;
• Support month-end and year-end closing activities (e.g. post receipt accruals and tax allocation etc);
• Accounts payable tasks - raising requests for creation/update of supplier records, verifying direct e-invoices and foreign supplier e-invoices and inform Department users of unsuccessful interface of e-invoices from New Financial System (NFS@Gov);
• Support year-end statutory audit activities; and
• Other adhoc tasks, as assigned

Grant Management
• Verification of grant claims in accordance with funding guidelines from fund sponsors;
• Ensure accuracy of claim amounts against relevant supporting documents;
• Raise payment instructions for disbursements to grantees for approved claims;
• Prepare submissions to seek reimbursements from fund sponsors;
• Monitor timely submission of claim forms and audit reports, including sending of reminders; and
• Support audits and handle other tasks, as assigned.


Requirements:
• Education in Accounting or Finance with minimum 3 years of working experience in Finance.
• Strong attention to detail, able to work independently and contribute actively as part of a team.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (mandatory) and familiarity with Workday System (preferred)
EXECUTIVE ENGINEER / ENGINEER, COMMUNICATIONS
Jobres: You will provide engineering support for communications systems to various current and future transit and road projects. You will review and implement communications systems, which include data transmission networks, digital trunked radio systems, video surveillance systems, public address systems, telephony systems, etc. for transit lines or road projects. You will be given the opportunity to develop expert knowledge in multiple areas in communications systems.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in Electrical / Electronics Engineering.
• Knowledge of data transmission network technologies (such as Gigabit Ethernet, MPLS), wireless LAN technologies, TETRA digital trunked radio, PABX and video surveillance systems will be an added advantage.
• Team player with strong analytical mind and ability to work independently.
• Good communication and interpersonal skills.
• Self-motivated, resourceful and possess a positive attitude.
• Those with more relevant years of experience will be considered for senior positions.
• Those without working experience are welcome to apply.

Jobdesc:
At IMDA, we are dedicated to nurturing and developing the next generation of leaders. Our Talent Management team, which sits in the Human Resource Division, plays a critical role in shaping the future of our organisation by attracting, developing, and retaining top talents. We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive and achieve their full potential.

We are seeking dynamic and passionate Talent Managers to join our growing team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of our efforts to identify and cultivate high-potential talent, design and execute leadership development and succession planning programmes, and enhance our employer brand. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on our organization by driving initiatives that ensure we have the right leaders in place for today and tomorrow.

If you’re passionate about Talent Management and excited about the opportunity to shape the future of leadership at IMDA, we want to hear from you!

Campus Attraction, Outreach & Strategy

  • Drive and manage end-to-end processes for two of our key young talent programmes, Smart Nation Scholarships and IMDA internship programme.

  • Oversee campus outreach efforts and strategy, forging strong relationships with universities to market IMDA as employer of choice and attract top-tier talent.

  • Execute IMDA’s EVP initiatives, including developing marketing assets, driving social media campaigns and organising employer branding events.

  • Design, track and analyse key metrics and dashboard to assess the effectiveness of our talent programmes and branding and marketing efforts for continuous improvement.

Leadership Development & Succession Planning

  • Track, develop and execute the career progression and development plans of our high potential officers. These include reviewing and developing suitable Route of Advancement (ROA) and career pathing options to effectively groom our leadership pipeline; facilitating postings and secondment to public and private sector companies that are aligned to officers’ career interests and organisational needs; and identifying suitable stretch appointments, projects and milestone programmes to optimise leadership exposure and development.

  • Prepare, facilitate and execute succession plans for key management positions and engineering and technical leadership roles.

  • Coordinate with key ministries and/or agencies to sense-make and implement capability building initiatives that are contextualised to IMDA’s operating landscape, and track and prepare key talent data to facilitate discussions at various talent meeting platforms.

What We’re Looking For:

  • At least 4 years of experience in campus recruitment, talent management, leadership development, or related HR roles. Experience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment is a plus.

  • Strong project management and organizational skills.

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities.

  • A strategic thinker with a passion for developing talent.

  • Proficient in using HR software and data analytics tools.

  • Proactive, results-oriented, and enjoy working in a collaborative environment. You have a keen eye for talent and are committed to fostering a culture of continuous learning and development.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Position offered will be commensurate with experience.

#LI-BR1

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) is the lead agency driving Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and public sector digital transformation. As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Smart City Technology, Digital Infrastructure, and Cybersecurity.

At GovTech, we offer you a purposeful career to make lives better. We empower our people to master their craft through continuous and robust learning and development opportunities all year round. Our GovTechies embody our Agile, Bold and Collaborative values to deliver impactful solutions.

GovTech aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do.

Play a part in Singapore’s vision to build a Smart Nation and embark on your meaningful journey to build tech for public good. Join us to advance our mission and shape your future with us today!

Learn more about GovTech at tech.gov.sg.

Who we are 

The GovTech Anti Scam Products Team’s mission is to build tech solutions to detect, disrupt and deter scammers at scale. The work spans data infrastructure, developing and deploying AI & ML to scale proactive detection, API connections to partners, as well as front-end systems for enforcement agencies.  

What you will be working on:

As a Data Scientist, you will be identifying opportunities for data exploitation through in depth conversations with business stakeholders which includes:  

  • Understand the evolving problems and strategize about what data and techniques would be needed to solve it  
  • Develop different machine learning models, track their effectiveness, and deploy the most appropriate solution  
  • Build and operate production systems independently (with light engineering support) together with engineers) to serve these solutions  
  • Present findings, solicit feedback and prioritize refinements to the analysis in close iteration with stakeholders while managing overall project timeline 
  • Establish best practices developing data science / ML systems 
  • Provide technical leadership across multiple product teams 
  • Share your expertise, mentor and/or manage other data scientists 
  • Help with recruiting 

What we are looking for:

  • Experience in model development (e.g. regression, random forests, LLMs, Graph Neural Networks) and deployment (e.g. Sagemaker, TensorFlow) 
  • Experience in stakeholder management  
  • Experience in agile development  
  • Experience in developing capability in others 

We're here to improve how we live as a society through what we can offer as a government. Because our team focuses on pushing new initiatives, you will also have to: 

  • Identify potential projects that improve the public good 
  • Design novel systems that work around bureaucratic constraints 
  • Advocate and explain these technical ideas to other government agencies 

 

You're not just here to write code, but also to figure out what we should be building and how we should build it. You will work on meaningful projects to reduce scams and make a big impact on people’s lives.  

 

Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. These include leave benefits to meet your work-life needs and employee wellness programmes. 

  

We champion flexible work arrangements (subject to your job role) and trust that you will manage your own time to deliver your best, wherever you are, and whatever works best for you. 

Learn more about life inside GovTech at go.gov.sg/GovTechCareers.

Stay connected with us on social media at go.gov.sg/ConnectWithGovTech.

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) is the lead agency driving Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and public sector digital transformation. As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Smart City Technology, Digital Infrastructure, and Cybersecurity.

At GovTech, we offer you a purposeful career to make lives better. We empower our people to master their craft through continuous and robust learning and development opportunities all year round. Our GovTechies embody our Agile, Bold and Collaborative values to deliver impactful solutions.

GovTech aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do.

Play a part in Singapore’s vision to build a Smart Nation and embark on your meaningful journey to build tech for public good. Join us to advance our mission and shape your future with us today!

Learn more about GovTech at tech.gov.sg.

Who We Are:

The GovTech Anti Scam Products (GASP) team’s mission is to build tech solutions to detect, disrupt and deter scammers at scale. The work spans data infrastructure, developing and deploying AI & ML to scale proactive detection, API connections to partners, as well as front-end systems for enforcement agencies. 

What it is like working here:

Your job will be to bring your experience, technical expertise, and capability in solving abstract problems to tackling scams using tech. 

Sometimes this means coding new systems from scratch. Other times this means using the best solutions the development community has to offer. We use cloud services, open source software, and commodity hardware as much as possible. These often include, but are not limited to: GitHub, AWS, React Native, and MongoDB, amongst others. Knowing what to build and what to reuse lets us avoid wasting time on solved problems and focus on delivering actual value.

As software engineer, you will 

  • Build prototypes to demonstrate technological opportunities

  • Design system architectures

  • Write production quality code

  • Manage deployments to cloud infrastructure

  • Maintain systems to a high level of reliability

More senior software engineers will also be expected to:

  •  Establish best practices for developer operations

  • Provide technical leadership across multiple product teams

  • Share your expertise and mentor other engineers

  • Help with recruiting 

What we are looking for: 

Must have

  • Python, JavaScript and/or Scala
  • Experience working with CI/CD setups
  • Strong knowledge of algorithms and database structures

Preferred

  • Experience in AWS Cloud
  • Experience building high scale, low latency APIs & deploying scaled AI / ML solutions
  • Experience with data intensive frameworks & data warehousing solutions (e.g. presto, spark, glue), bonus if you’re familiar with graph data structures
  • Understanding of event driven architectures involving kafka, bonus if you’re familiar with Flink!

We're here to improve how we live as a society through what we can offer as a government. Because our team focuses on pushing new initiatives, you will also have to:

  • Identify potential projects that improve the public good
  • Design novel systems that work around bureaucratic constraints
  • Advocate and explain these technical ideas to other government agencies

You're not just here to write code, but also to figure out what we should be building and how we should build it. You will work on meaningful projects to reduce scams and make a big impact on people’s lives.

Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. These include leave benefits to meet your work-life needs and employee wellness programmes.

At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 
We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success. 
Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results. 
Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.
At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 
Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.
Jobres:
As a member of Accounts Information & Services Department, you play a pivotal role in maintaining the integrity of CPF members’ CPF accounts and personal particulars records, as well as ensuring the provision of accurate data and services to CPF members, internal and external stakeholders. 
In this role, you will:
•	Implementing Projects or System Enhancements (e.g. closure of CPF accounts of foreigners; closure of Special Account for CPF members aged 55 and above; implementing the Year-in-Review statement)
o	Translating enhancements into requirements for development by our IT support
o	Drafting test cases and conducting user acceptance testing to ensure objectives are met in various scenarios 
o	Conducting post-implementation quality assurance 
o	Manage stakeholders and work on deliverables within the implementation timeline 
•	Overseeing Operations and Conducting Process Reviews 
o	Analyse, monitor trends and proposing enhancements to anticipate new customer needs 
o	Assist in monitoring operations and proposing improvements to policies or processes, with a focus on automation and reduction of manual work
o	Reviewing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), implementing enhancements, communicating revised SOP and train the operations team
o	Approving applications processed by the operations team and vetting correspondences from the public to address their enquiries
Jobreq:
We value the diverse talents and experiences that each individual brings to the table. While mastery of every requirement may not be necessary, familiarity and expertise in some of the following areas will position you for success within this team.
•	Demonstrated experience in project management and operations management.
•	Good stakeholder management and communication skills for engaging with internal and external parties.
•	Ability to interpret data and trends; proficiency in statistical and programming software (e.g., STATA, Python) is a valuable asset.
•	Good problem-solving skills, adept at addressing and resolving operational challenges effectively.
•	Good analytical, writing, and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information and insights.
The seniority of appointment and actual corporate job title will commensurate with individual work experiences.
We welcome fresh graduates in any discipline and candidates without working experience to apply. To help us better understand your academic background, please provide an official or unofficial copy of your academic transcript, as well as any other relevant documents or certificates that you believe would support your application.
Position is on a 1-year full-time contract directly under the payroll of CPF Board.

What you can expect
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding career in a progressive workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you:  
•	Opportunities to engage in a mix of formal and informal training, keeping your skills sharp in our ever-evolving technological landscape.  
•	Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance.
•	A vibrant community of like-minded and friendly colleagues, where collaboration and creativity thrive. 
•	A hybrid work model that offers flexibility for remote work, subject to exigencies of service.
•	Flexible dress code that empowers you to choose your appropriate outfit for the day. 
•	A comprehensive rewards package that includes annual leave, pro-family leave, medical and dental benefits, and access to recreational activities.

Jobdesc: Provide geotechnical engineering services to the project management office and to plan, manage, implement, and supervise of development projects to realise the greater Sentosa Master Plan.
Jobres:
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external agencies/partners on Master Plan development projects from project inception to handover.
• Responsible for geotechnical engineering matters related to the Greater Sentosa Master Plan.
• Responsible for project management and coordination throughout the entire project lifecycle.
• Develop project briefs, requirements, technical specifications for the procurement of consultancy and construction contracts.
• Identify project interface issues and collaborate with all interfacing parties to develop effective mitigation measures.
• Identify project risks and implement necessary mitigation measures.
• Work with the respective project managers to ensure projects are completed safely, on time, within budget and meet specified quality standards.
• Demonstrated the ability to work independently and lead project teams.
• Facilitate and organise meetings with internal stakeholders and external agencies/partners.
• Conduct regular site visit/inspections and to report on quality and progress.
Jobreq:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Civil Engineering, with a major in Geotechnical Engineering.
• Minimum of 15 years post-graduate relevant experience in the construction industry, with at least 7 years of recognised practical experience in geotechnical engineering.
• Must have project experience in at least 2 deep underground infrastructure projects.
• Registration as a Specialist Professional Engineer in Geotechnical Engineering would be an advantage.
• Project Management experience in multi-disciplinary engineering projects or infrastructure projects would be an advantage.
• Possess strong written and communication skill in English.

Jobtitle: Assistant Manager/ Deputy Manager, Registration Division(TCMPB)
Jobdesc: As a member of the secretariat team, you will be involved in reviewing and managing the policies and operations of the Healthcare Professional Boards in regulating healthcare professionals. Specifically, these include the areas of registration of TCM Practitioners, staffing of Boards and professional committee meetings, as well as administrative support to the Boards, including preparation and facilitating the conduct of examinations for TCMPB.
Jobres: As a member of the secretariat team, you will be involved in reviewing and managing the policies and operations of the Healthcare Professional Boards in regulating healthcare professionals. Specifically, these include the areas of registration of TCM Practitioners, staffing of Boards and professional committee meetings, as well as administrative support to the Boards, including preparation and facilitating the conduct of examinations for TCMPB.
Jobreq:
•	Relevant working experience of at least 3 years in administration operations will be an advantage
•	Possess good writing and communication skills
•	Proficient in spoken and written Chinese (in emails and writing of minutes of meeting)
•	Possess good critical thinking, customer-relationship and information analysis skills
•	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint and Words)
•	Meticulous and able to work independently as well as in a team
•	Self-motivated and positive working attitude
•	Advantage if applicant has TCM practice knowledge/ experience

Jobdesc:
You will oversee and run all facilities management (FM) operations of assigned government office properties and be involved in performance management of term contractors, budget planning, FM technology implementation, sustainability and procurement role (i.e. calling of tenders and awarding of contracts). 

You will also manage and plan future resource optimization for future facilities projects in the pipeline. You will recommend, advise, and implement outsourcing strategies, review and devise improvements for processes and procedures to enhance building operations, customer satisfaction and engagement.
Jobres: You will perform operational duties such as manage customer feedback and closure, support for tenancy renewals and conduct site inspection for our managed properties to ensure compliance by our contractors in accordance with the requirements set by the building owner and other government agencies. You will prepare maintenance contract specifications which includes reviewing the standard, schedule and requirement of maintenance, schedule of rates, and manage these contracts to ensure the facilities service providers efficiently carry out their maintenance work.
Jobreq: Background in Project & Facilities Management/Building, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent, with at least 2 to 5 years of working experience in building & facility management. Candidates with experience in the management and operation of government or commercial office properties with good stakeholder management and communication skills will be highly regarded. You must be a team player, self-driven and able to work under pressure and within tight deadlines.

Jobtitle: Analysis of agencies’ root cause analysis for audit observations by the AGO
Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Performance & Evaluation Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
1.	To analyse 4 years’ worth of data of agencies’ root cause analysis (RCA) for audit observations by the Auditor-General’s Office (AGO) to derive insights on areas for improvement
2.	To suggest improvements to the RCA guide
Jobreq:
Applicant should be comfortable in analysing qualitative information relating to finance, procurement and operational processes.

Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025.

Jobdesc: You lead a team of trainers to conduct training to operationalise newly procured dogs, conduct assessment for all dog courses and audit operational standard on all handlers and working dogs in the SAF.
Jobres: You assist in the continual development/enhancement of training doctrines and guide Military Working Dog Unit trainers to develop their dog training knowledge and skills.
Jobreq:
You should possess a Diploma. You should complete the Trainer's Course or equivalent and possess at least 5 years' experience in animal management. Possession of good communication and management skills is essential.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: [Winter Internship] Indicator Scanning and Analysis Project
Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Performance & Evaluation Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
This workstream involves scanning past approved evaluation plans, sifting out indicators (both tracking and KPIs) that have been proposed for various outcomes, and compiling them in a meaningful way for P&E officers to reference. 

The intern may also be required to provide a first-cut analysis of the quality of these indicators.
Jobreq:
Applicant should have an eye for detail and able to apply critical-thinking skills into practice. 

Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025.

Jobtitle: Landscape scan of evaluation policies and best practices to enhance PE
Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Performance & Evaluation Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
This workstream involves conducting a landscape scan of evaluation policies and frameworks in a country that is advanced in programme evaluation. 

The research could focus on best practices in structures and processes adopted by the country, evaluation theories underpinning these practices, areas of interest in performance evaluation, and key areas of learning for P&E.
Jobreq:
Applicant should have an interest in policy-making and research. 

Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025.

Jobdesc: You lead a team to operationalise and manage the NS Contact Centre (NSCC) to ensure a high degree of efficiency in its operations; and undertakes management reporting, operations/performance analysis, content and feedback management to achieve a high level of service delivery and customer experience.
Jobres: You drive also the resolution of systemic issues in NSCC case management. In addition, you  optimise the management and deployment of lean resources to meet our service delivery requirements and targets. Your challenge lies in managing a multitude of stakeholders to ensure good services for our customers.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification in Business, Service Management or equivalent discipline. You  should have at least 8 years' work experience in customer service design or service operations, along with 5 years' managerial experience. Having at least 3 years of experience in contract or vendor management is preferred.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You manage the daily operations and readiness of the network operations centre.
Jobres: On this, you manage several teams in the operations centre, such as recovery teams that respond to network faults. In addition, you work with relevant stakeholders to enhance processes and implement new tools to strengthen the efficiency and effectiveness of the network operations centre. You also provide assistance on the unit’s financial responsibilities and perform relevant financial duties. Your challenge lies in coordinating with multiple internal and external stakeholders to manage the jobs and faults of the IT networks. You also need to continually refine the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for the operations centre to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of detection and recovery of network faults. Lastly, you need to possess knowledge of industry enterprise data network operations and best practices, coupled with strong and professional leadership.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification in Information Technology (IT) or related discipline, preferably with at least 5 years' working experience in IT. Possession of professional IT certification such as CCNP, CCNA and ITIL Certification will be advantageous. Being able to learn quickly and perform under pressure in a dynamic and fast-paced environment is required. Possession of critical thinking, good interpersonal and communication skills is essential.  Appointment will be commensurate with your experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You drive the master planning effort for Quantum Research and Technology (R&T) encompassing Quantum Communications, Quantum Computing, and Quantum Sensing, and initiate projects and collaborations to realise the Quantum Research and Technology masterplan.
Jobres: You are responsible for the development and implementation of end-capability Systems roadmaps involving Quantum. You also initiate and strengthen collaborations within the local ecosystem (comprising of start-ups and Whole-of-Government beyond the traditional defence ecosystem) as well as with key overseas strategic partners.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, with at least 8 years' work experience in technology development, technology policy or technology management. Possession of strong oral and written communication, interpersonal, time management and analytical skills is essential. You must be a highly motivated individual and good team player who is able to work under pressure.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You drive and develop the overall Research and Technology (R&T) Strategy of Dual-Use Critical Emerging Technologies (CETs) such as Microelectronics, Quantum, and Artificial Intelligence to meet SAF/MINDEF needs.
Jobres: You develop a strategy to build up sovereign capabilities, improve resilience of access to these technologies, and build up the portfolio and network of dual-use technology providers. In addition, you will be in charge of coordinating with national efforts and advancing MINDEF’s R&T efforts in CETs with deep tech start-ups, Small-Medium Enterprises, and Large technology companies globally.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, with at least 12 years' work experience in technology development, technology policy or technology management. Possession of strong oral and written communication, interpersonal, time management and analytical skills is essential. You should be a highly motivated individual and good team player who is able to work under pressure.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Optimize Data Workflows for Dwelling and Geospatial Statistics Intern
Jobdesc:
Register-based dwelling and geospatial statistics are crucial for government agencies to inform policy decisions, providing valuable insights into demographics, structures, and trends.

The intern will gain valuable experience in developing register-based dwelling and geospatial statistics by designing and implementing Python-based ETL processes. This involves understanding business rules, optimizing workflows, testing and refining processes, deploying to production, as well as creating time series data cubes and charts to monitor statistical indicators. Additionally, they will participate in system cloud migration.
Jobreq:
Undergraduates from Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics and Computer Science preferred
Experience with coding in Python preferred
Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobtitle: Optimize Data Workflows for Family Statistics Intern
Jobdesc:
Register-based family statistics plays a crucial role in supporting government agencies in their policy planning, offering insights into family demographics, structures, and trends. 

The intern will gain valuable experience in developing register-based family statistics by designing and implementing Python-based ETL processes. This involves understanding business rules, optimizing workflows, testing and refining processes, deploying to production, as well as creating time series data cubes and charts to monitor statistical indicators. Additionally, they will participate in system cloud migration.
Jobreq:
Undergraduates from Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics and Computer Science preferred
Experience with coding in Python preferred
Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobdesc: You are responsible for managing functions that facilitate smooth daily operations in the flying operational units, including IT infrastructure management, software access control, life support and survival currency management, support for overseas travel administrative requirements, and ground logistics and resource management.
Jobres: Your challenge lies in understanding the dynamic operational requirements of a flying unit to provide the necessary logistics and administrative support. This involves effectively communicating the unit's requirements through close coordination with multiple support agencies.
Jobreq:
You must have a Diploma. You must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications (M365, Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint). You should be able to work independently in a fast-paced environment and be adaptable to changes, as well as receptive to new ideas. Possession of good communication and execution skills is essential.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Investigating the Challenges Faced by the Ageing Workforce Intern
Jobdesc: Singapore's ageing workforce faces unique and significant challenges, such as in adapting to rapid technological advancements. These challenges have been further exacerbated by the impact of COVID-19, making it crucial to understand the specific issues confronting older workers. This project aims to identify these challenges using longitudinal individual-level data, providing a better understanding of the obstacles faced by this demographic. The insights gained can support the development of more targeted and effective policies, enabling the government to better address the needs of the ageing workforce and facilitate their continued contribution to the economy.
Jobreq:
- Undergraduates in Economics or Statistics
- Knowledge in STATA / Python / SAS
- Knowledge in Econometrics / Regression Analysis

Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobtitle: Enhancing Data Workflows and Products in Taxes and Benefits Statistics Intern
Jobdesc:
DOS gathers data on government benefits and taxes from diverse sources to deliver insights on how government support influences income inequality and social outcomes. If you’re eager to gain deeper insights into this data domain, acquire hands-on experience and contribute to enhancing the efficiency and products of this end-to-end data value chain, come join us on this internship project where you will be involved in the following: 
- Support the migration of data processes from SAS to Python.
- Analyze current data workflows and provide actionable recommendations to enhance process efficiency and effectiveness with implementation
- Perform literature review on latest research in government benefits and taxation 
- Leverage on existing data to develop key indicators and analyses that further inform on the impact and effects of government benefits and taxes.
Jobreq:
Undergraduates in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science
Proficiency in Python with experience using the software in data cleaning, preprocessing and management 
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
General understanding of government benefits and taxation policies and evaluation is preferred

Internship Duration : 7 months from Jan to Jul 2025

Jobdesc: You advise the unit Commanding Officer (CO) in planning, organising, directing, and evaluating all safety efforts within the Battalion.
Jobres: You also assist the unit CO in crafting the Battalion Safety Policy and developing a safety program focused on accident prevention. In addition, you are responsible for initiating regular research and reviewing safety policies, operational procedures, and formalising safety regulations for dissemination. Your challenge lies in ensuring the conduct of tough, realistic yet safe training, and that our soldiers are not exposed to unnecessary dangers and are protected against serious injuries or unwanted loss of life during peacetime training.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, preferably in technical or scientific fields. Having military experience in high risk vocations is advantageous. Possession of good organisational, supervisory and inspection skills is essential.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Develop Cloud-based Sample Selection Portal Intern
Jobdesc:
The Department of Statistics (DOS) operates an internal portal (S3) responsible for selecting a sample of addresses for government agencies to conduct household surveys. Government agencies input sample selection parameters into the portal, which are then automatically transferred to a backend system for sample selection.

The intern will be tasked with researching and developing a cloud-based prototype of the portal, integrating it with Python scripts for sample selection.
Jobreq:
Computer Science preferred
Experience with coding in Python and Year 3 students are preferred

Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobdesc: You monitor and sense-make defence and security developments.
Jobres: On this, you conduct research and build knowledge repositories on the digital domain. You also collaborate with various stakeholders to validate preliminary assessments. Your challenge lies in having to process large amounts of data as well as keeping abreast on developments and providing quick-cycle intelligence to key stakeholders.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, preferably with Social Science majors such as Political Science, International Relations, Economics, Sociology and Geography or STEMS subjects such as Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Information Systems Engineering and Electrical Engineering. Prior work experience in the field of research is advantageous. Possession of effective communication skills as well as the willingness to learn is essential. 

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Developing New Register-based Data Series Intern
Jobdesc:
Are you keen to learn how Official Statistics are compiled and produced in Singapore? Join our team for a hands-on experience and apply your technical skills to create data processes in the development of a new data series!

By participating in this internship, you will gain valuable experience and skills in statistics, data visualisation and gain insights into the public sector.
Jobres:
Attached to the Business Statistics Division, you will:
- Review existing statistical processes across the data value chain 
- Conduct desktop research and process mapping to understand business and technical requirements of the new data series
- Develop and test new data processes for the new data series.
Jobreq:
Undergraduates in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Business/Data Analytics	

Required Skills:
Basic Programming Knowledge (R/Python)

Preferred Skills:
Knowledge in SAS
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or PowerBI

Internship Duration : Any 3 to 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobtitle: Enhancement of DOS Trusted Centre's AI Chatbot (Beta Version)
Jobdesc:
The Trusted Centre for Individual and Business data at DOS (DOS TC) performs data stewardship activities for the public sector to enable timely, convenient and secure access to government administrative data for whole-of-government (WOG) policy analysis, agency operations and service delivery. 

The intern will be attached to the property data, data engineering and data governance teams, where he will work with TC officers to review, re-design and automate processes for data concierge and stewardship and engagement with key stakeholders, leveraging advanced tools where relevant. 

The intern will build on the findings from a recent proof-of-concept for a chatbot that seeks to harness generative AI and large language models (LLMs) to transform DOS TC's data concierge and stewardship work to be less manpower-intensive, while providing timely and accurate responses to our users.

The intern will work closely with TC officer(s) and GovTech officer(s) to enhance and test the accuracy of the chatbots, evaluate and recommend the best-fit chatbot, and productionise it on a recommended platform for WOG use. 

He will also work on projects to review, re-design and implement data governance and data concierge processes linked to recent engagements with users and data source agencies, with the aims of community-building with key stakeholders and making improvements in response to feedback.
Jobreq:
- Familiarity with text analytics, LLMs and chatbots.	
- Undergraduates in Data science / Business Analytics / IT / Computing
- Some understanding and prior experience in handling cloud technologies. 
- Proficient in Python programming and Jupyter Notebook usage. 
- Some experience and knowledge in Natural Language Processsing (NLP), text analytics and large-language models (LLMs).
- Interest and motivation in exploring chatbot models and process re-design and automation. 

Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobtitle: Singapore Statistical Classifications, Well-being and Sustainability Intern
Jobdesc:
The Policy Planning Division (PPD) oversees the regular review of a few major national statistical classifications with inputs from key stakeholders, to ensure alignment with international frameworks and incorporation of the latest developments in the local context. We also research, collate, monitor and report statistical trends and analyses on Singapore's well-being and sustainable development.

PPD will be reviewing two key national standards in 2025, namely the Singapore Standard Industrial Classification (SSIC) for classifying economic activities undertaken by economic units, and the Singapore Standard Educational Classification (SSEC) for classifying educational programmes and qualifications, are undergoing review. The intern will assist the PPD Secretariat in dissemination of the SSIC 2025 publication, which involves drafting the SSIC and conducting consistency checks on the supporting documents (i.e. detailed definitions and alphabetical index) to reduce cross references errors. Additionally, the intern will participate in the publicity efforts for the SSIC 2025 release and get the opportunity to learn and appreciate how industrial classification codes are used by the different stakeholders. With the experience gained from the SSIC workstream, the intern will move on to assist in the preparation/review of the SSEC 2026 alphabetical index.

The intern may also be tasked to assist other PPD teams such as in collating data on national well-being and Sustainable Development Goals.
Jobreq:
Knowledge in Excel Macro (preferred)
Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobdesc: You assist in conducting longer-term research, and providing analytical research reports for the Digital and Intelligence Service (DIS).
Jobres: On this, you process, sense-make and analyse intelligence to provide in-depth reports to support operations. Your challenge lies in having to process large amounts of data as well as keeping abreast on developments and providing quick-cycle intelligence to key stakeholders.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, preferably with Social Science majors such as Political Science, International Relations, Economics, Sociology and Geography or STEMS subjects such as Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Information Systems Engineering and Electrical Engineering. Prior work experience in the field of research is advantageous. Possession of effective communication skills as well as the willingness to learn is essential.

(Applicants with no experience may apply.) 

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Automation and Streamlining of Statistical Compilation Workflow Intern
Jobdesc:
This project focuses on automating and streamlining the statistical compilation workflow for Singapore’s International Investment Position(IIP) using Python.

Working with the IIP team, the intern will develop scripts to enhance efficiency and accuracy in handling Excel files, including reading data, processing, and outputting results. 

The intern will also create a workflow process chart.

The role includes analysing the current workflow, identifying automation opportunities, and testing solutions.

The intern will obtain a foundational-level understanding of Singapore’s International Investment Position and the underlying compilation methodology.

The intern will also gain exposure to AI/ML projects, particularly Generative AI, and their practical implementation and applications.
Jobreq:
Undergraduates from Statistics / Mathematics / Computer Science / Information Technology
Proficiency in Python programming.
Experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and openpyxl or similar for Excel file handling.
Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Basic understanding of statistical analysis and data processing.
Basic understanding of workflow automation and optimization concepts.

Internship Duration : 6 - 7 months from Jan to Jul 2025

Jobdesc:
DOS Household, Income and Population (HIP) Division releases several reports informing the public on the latest population statistics every year.

The project aims to leverage programming e.g. python and GenAI tools to automate the updating of key demography reports. This project involves learning about the various key demographic concepts, creating python scripts to generate demographic statistics and making use of GenAI tools and/or Python to generate written analysis and charts to update demography reports.
Jobreq:
Undergraduate students from Mathematics, statistics, data science, or economics students preferred.

Required Skill:
Python 

Internship Duration: 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobtitle: Engaging Stakeholders via Communication Channels and Digital Services Intern
Jobdesc:
Participate in the process of  conceptualisation, creation and amplification of marketing communication materials for social media channels and other dissemination/ publicity platforms, to publicise DOS's data and data services.

Support the revamp of the SingStat Website through review of contents on the Website and/or be involved in the conduct of User Experience Study.
Jobreq:
Degree/ Diploma in related fields i.e. Media and Design; Mass Communications; Film & Video; Marketing; User Experience Design

Strong writing and creative data storytelling skills, with knowledge of graphic design, video editing and animation software e.g. Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe After Effects.

Have an eye for design to create visually appealing graphics and videos. Have an awareness of latest social media trends.

Some knowledge on website design, content creation and user experience design processes such as design thinking, ideation and prototyping would be advantageous.

Internship Duration : 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobdesc: You manage manpower staffing and plan the professional development for all Military Domain Experts, Warrant Officers and Specialists (MDES/WOSPECs) within the Command.
Jobres: On this, you assist in the preparation and conduct of Posting Plan Boards. You identify and engage servicemen for their Route of Advancement (ROA) courses, and work closely with the respective stakeholders in the management of their ROA courses for all MDES/WOSPECs in the Command. Your challenge lies in keeping abreast of HR initiatives in order to ensure service delivery to stakeholders. You also need to review work processes routinely so as be in sync with prevailing policies. You also need to work closely with various entities with regards to MDES/WOSPECs posting matters within the Command. Lastly, you are required to interact with all MDES/WOSPECs on their posting preference, and be able to strike a balance between personal preferences versus organisational needs.
Jobreq:
You must have a diploma, with at least 3 years' HR experience. Possession of good communication, time management, public relations skills, coupled with good planning abilities is essential. You must be meticulous, competent in using Microsoft Office applications and able to multi-task and also able to work under stressful environment.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Improving the Quality of Short-Term Business Indicators Intern
Jobdesc:
Are you passionate about data analysis and statistical methods? Do you have a drive to improve data quality of large datasets? If so, we invite you to join our team as an intern in the Business Statistics Division, and apply your statistical knowledge and programming skills in enhancing the quality of short-term business indicators. 

By participating in this internship, you will gain valuable experience and skills that will be beneficial for your future career in data analysis, statistics and beyond.
Jobres:
- Research various statistical benchmarking methods to align high-frequency business indicators (e.g. quarterly data) with low-frequency benchmarks (i.e. annual data), including the best practices adopted by advanced National Statistical Organisations,
- Perform data simulations using statistical programs (Python/R) and gain hands-on experience in statistical benchmarking using real data, and  
- Recommend suitable benchmarking methods to improve the data quality of short-term business indicators.
Jobreq:
Undergraduate from Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics

Required Skills:
Statistics
Basic Programming Knowledge (Python/R)

Knowledge of SAS is beneficial

Duration : 3 - 4 months from Mar to Jun 2025

Jobdesc: Are you ready to apply your creativity and technical skills to drive innovation with data? Join our team as an intern! This internship offers a unique chance to experience the full lifecycle of data analytics projects, honing your skills while also gaining valuable experience and insights into the public sector.
Jobres:
Research and Ideation: Conduct thorough research and brainstorming sessions to conceptualize new and experimental economic indicators.
Data Analytics Projects: Engage in the end-to-end process of data analytics projects, from initial conceptualization to detailed analysis.
Innovative Solutions: Apply innovative thinking and technical expertise to develop solutions that provide new insights and add value.
Jobreq:
Undergraduates in Computer Science / Data Analytics / Data Science / Business Analytics / Statistics / Economics

Required Skills:
Basic Programming Knowledge (R/Python)
Regression Models

Preferred Skills:
Knowledge in Machine Learning methodology
Experience with data visualisation tools such as PowerBI or Matplotlib

Duration : Any 3 - 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Jobdesc:
Join Our Team for a Dynamic Internship in Machine Learning and Data Visualization!

As an intern in the Business Statistics Division, you will play a key role in enhancing our current machine learning scripts, performing AI data editing, and conducting data exploration and visualization. This is a unique opportunity to experience the entire lifecycle of a machine learning project, from conceptualization to analysis.
Jobres:
Enhancement of Machine Learning Scripts: Improve and optimize existing machine learning algorithms to increase efficiency and accuracy.
AI Data Editing: Assist in cleaning, preprocessing, and managing data to ensure high-quality inputs for machine learning models.
Data Exploration and Visualization: Utilize data visualization tools to interpret and present data insights in a clear and impactful manner.
Project Involvement: Engage in the end-to-end process of machine learning projects, including conceptualization, development, and analysis.

By joining us, you will gain hands-on experience in cutting-edge technologies and methodologies, while also gain valuable experience and insights into the public sector.
Jobreq:
Preferred Discipline:
Undergraduate in Computer Science / Data Analytics / Data Science / Business Analytics / Statistics / Economics 

Additional Skills & Requirements:                                
Basic Programming Knowledge (R/Python)
Regression Models

Preferred Skills:
Knowledge in Machine Learning methodology
Experience with data visualisation tools such as PowerBI or Matplotlib

Duration : Any 3 - 6 months from Jan to Jun 2025

Agncy: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
Jobtitle: Manager / Senior Manager (Talent Attraction & Development) (2-yr contract)
Jobdesc: Reporting to the Deputy Director (Talent Attraction & Development) in the Human Resource Division, you will design, develop and implement talent, career development and employee engagement initiatives in MPA to ensure an engaged workforce.
Jobres:
The key duties include:

Career Development

  • Develop career pathways and related resources to guide officers and supervisors on career planning by articulating key experiences/ competencies at different career stages.

  • Drive career development initiatives to develop, engage and retain MPA officers and talents.

  • Identify key competencies to meet current and future business needs. Work with business units to establish competency framework and translate to implementation in HR processes.

  • Align with MPA’s business transformation, work with line divisions to review the impact on MPA jobs. Develop and implement HR initiatives to support the transformed jobs. This includes career development, training and performance management.  

Learning and Development

  • Work with line divisions to translate MPA’s business goals into upskilling strategies to prepare officers to be more future-ready to support evolving business needs amidst tighter resource constraints.

  • Develop and implement upskilling initiatives to prepare our officers early ahead of retirement, so as to enhance their employability.

  • Work with MPA Academy and training providers to curate and implement core and leadership training programmes. This includes onboarding programmes for new hires.

As part of the Talent Attraction and Development team, you may also be involved in talent outreach events such as career and recruitment fairs.
Jobreq:
• You should possess at least 3 – 5 years of working experience, with relevant experience in the aforementioned HR functions or Business Partnering. Knowledge in recruitment policy, sourcing strategies, career development and job redesign will be useful.

  • You should be a team player with strong stakeholders’ management skills and able to work in a fast-paced environment.

This position will be a 2-year contract appointment in the first instance.

Jobtitle: AGRI Centre - Research Staff (Smart Urban Farming)
Jobdesc: Research Staff to be part of our groundbreaking industry project “Integrated Smart Urban Agriculture Monitoring and Control System” that will contribute to sustainable urban agriculture. This is a 12-month project aims to revolutionize urban farming by leveraging advanced technologies to optimize growth conditions, reduce resource and energy consumption, and increase yields.
Jobres:
• Design, develop, and maintain software components for smart urban farming system.

• Develop and implement robust data communication protocols and algorithms.

• Build and manage IoT device firmware and cloud-based applications.

• Perform thorough testing and debugging of IoT systems.

• Analyze IoT data to identify patterns and optimize system performance.
Jobreq:
• Expertise in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.

• At least 1 year of working experience in Engineering related work field that involves embedded system programming, mechanical design, data analytics.  Prior experience with monitoring, growing and maintaining plants in hydroponics/aeroponics/ substrate culture for urban agriculture or commercial farm will be considered favourable.

• Proven experience in software development, preferably in IoT or embedded systems.

• Strong proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++, Python, or Java.

• Knowledge of IoT protocols (MQTT, HTTP) and communication technologies (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, cellular).

• Understanding of hardware components and sensors used in IoT devices.

• Passion for urban agricultural development and sustainability.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic research environment.
• Successful candidates will be employed on a contract basis.

Jobdesc:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.
Jobres:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Cloud Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with a strong background in AWS and exposure to Azure. The ideal candidate will possess leadership capabilities while also maintaining hands-on technical expertise. Knowledge of Unix systems is essential for this role.

  • Lead a team of SREs in designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud infrastructure on AWS and Azure platforms.

  • Develop and implement best practices for cloud reliability, scalability, and performance.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of cloud services and applications.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to cloud infrastructure and services.

  • Automate and streamline processes to improve operational efficiency and reliability.

  • Conduct regular performance monitoring and capacity planning to ensure optimal cloud resource utilization.

  • Mentor and coach junior team members to enhance their technical skills and knowledge.
Jobreq:
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field.

  • Proven experience in a lead role within a cloud SRE or DevOps team.

  • Hands-on experience with AWS cloud services and infrastructure.

  • Familiarity with Azure cloud services and exposure to its infrastructure is an added advantage.

  • Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux systems and shell scripting.

  • Proficiency in infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect or DevOps Engineer certification.

  • Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.

  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or GitLab.

  • Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools such as Zabbix and ELK stack.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: [LTA-T&ID] MANAGER / DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, INDUSTRY DEVELOPMENT
Jobdesc: MANAGER / DEPUTY / ASSISTANT MANAGER, INDUSTRY DEVELOPMENT
Jobres:
You will be part of the industry development team, tasked to shape and develop a robust land transport ecosystem in Singapore. A major function of the role is to develop and implement sector-level strategies and initiatives, and work with fellow LTA groups and industry partners to build a highly resilient and future-ready land transport ecosystem that supports LTA’s goals under Land Transport Masterplan 2040.

You will be part of a team to:
•Gather and analyse relevant data to obtain insights and identify market/sector gaps for targeted industry segments and/or land transport domains to support LTA’s operational needs;
•Conceptualise and develop strategies and initiatives for targeted industry segments to address market/sector gaps;
•Obtain buy-in and support from LTA management and relevant stakeholders for proposed strategies and initiatives;
•Project manage industry development initiatives and industry engagement events;
•Manage strategic collaborations with industry partners and/or Government agencies;
•Establish platforms/channels with industry and other Government agencies to promote sharing of ideas and concerns to facilitate industry development.
Jobreq:
•Tertiary qualification preferably in Engineering, Technology-related fields Business Administration or any equivalent;
•At least 3 years of work experience with at least 2 years in industry engagement/business development;
•Relevant knowledge of the technology landscape and/or land transport sector will be a plus;
•Strong situational awareness, good analytical and strategic thinking skills;
•Self-starter with strong stakeholder management, presentation and communication skills;
•Motivated, resourceful and able to work independently as well as in a team;
•Possess good written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills;
•Well-versed in Microsoft Office applications (e.g. PowerPoint, MS Word, MS Excel etc.);
•Experience in event management, marketing and outreach activities will be a plus.
•Candidates who possess the relevant skills and experience may be considered

Jobdesc:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.
Jobres:
• Part of a team responsible for the supervision of financial institutions conducting financial advisory and insurance broking activities. This includes banks and insurers which carry out financial advisory activities, as well as licensed financial advisers.  

  • Involved in assessing the adequacy and effectiveness of financial institutions’ risk management systems and internal controls, and market conduct practices, through both onsite inspection and offsite review.

  • Involved in policy reviews related to the supervision of financial institutions, and reviewing data collection processes.

  • Opportunities to interact with other departments in MAS, as well as external parties such as audit firms, industry bodies, foreign regulators, and other government agencies.
Jobreq:
• Strong audit and analytical skills, and ability to pay attention to details, as well as identify broad trends and issues 

  • Possess good written and verbal communication skills

  • Good working knowledge and experience in financial institutions conducting financial advisory activities

  • Ability to multi-task and keep to tight timelines

  • Self-motivated and driven

Agncy: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
Jobdesc:
Key Responsibilities

- Support the stakeholder engagement, development, implementation and maintenance of systems for data collection, storage, access, and analytics at scale.
- Implement data pipelines that draw operational and sensor data from core MPA systems such as SG Maritime Data Hub, digitalPORT@SGTM, port operation and vessel traffic information systems, that can be harnessed in data science and AI (DSAI) applications.
- Develop and manage continuous improvement of data architecture and ensure alignment with business requirements, data management and governance policies.
- Participate in the evaluation of strengths and weaknesses of possible technologies and recommend solutions that best meet the organization requirements.
- Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards that provide insights and data visualizations to support business decision-making.
- Collaborate closely with business users and the data science team to identify relevant data that can help to achieve business goals, such as analysis to inform policy-making and operation/process streamlining.
- Support the design and definition of the data architecture framework, standards, and principles, including modelling, metadata, privacy, security, reference data and master data
- Assist in the development of data pipelines for large datasets such as operational, sensor or unstructured data to:
- Enable the implementation of DSAI models/applications that support business use cases
- Perform data validation and quality control checks
- Automate regular updating of models and dashboards
- Provide secure access to data via common analytical tools such as Tableau
- Work with the data science team to deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning, and statistical methods, e.g. processing of unstructured input data for automated decision making.
- Identify data processes and tasks that can be automated to increase officer productivity.
- Assist in the compilation and maintenance of an MPA data catalogue to foster awareness of data available to support business use cases.
- Assist in the development of data competencies across MPA to promote a data-driven culture, via workshops and co-development of data products.
