- Collaborates with stakeholders to understand business requirements, designs and develops interactive dashboards using data visualization tools, develops and maintains data pipelines, creates and maintains documentation for the dashboards, works with cross-functional teams to ensure data consistency, and stays up-to-date with the latest data visualization techniques.

Requirements

  • Degree in Data Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, or other related disciplines that provide proficiencies in data engineering. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.

  • Good coding and scripting capability in Python and SQL.

  • Familiarity with data management, data architecture, ETL processes (for both structured and unstructured data sources), and building data pipelines using distributed process frameworks, e.g. Cloudera Hadoop.

  • Knowledge or experience in any of the following areas are a plus
    a. Experience in data engineering and data architecture design and implementation, including experience in architecting or developing organizational-level enterprise data lakes or data warehouse solutions.
    b. Experience working with medium to large data processing pipelines, distributed data stores and distributed file systems, especially enterprise data platforms and Big Data tools.
    c. Experience in cloud platforms used in Government Commercial Cloud, e.g. AWS and Azure
    d. Proficient in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI

  • Creative and innovative in solving problems.

  • Achievement driven and delivery focused while maintaining required quality.

  • Team player with strong organisational skills.

  • Experience in collaborating with interdisciplinary teams that combine technical, business and data science competencies.

  • Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders.

We are looking for dynamic and driven HR Practitioners to value add to the Compensation and Benefits functions in the Human Resource Division. The selected candidates will drive the formulation, implementation and review of related policies, procedures, practices and systems. There are also opportunities to helm or involve in organization wide and HR related projects.
Jobres:
Compensation: You will work on the development of compensation strategies and translate them into operational objectives and policy formulation. You will build collaborative partnerships with various internal and external stakeholders and adopt best practices on compensation management. Your primary role will involve regular market benchmarking, market analysis, recommend enhancements, implement and communicate compensation policies and programmes to reinforce CAAS’ market position in attracting and retaining talent. You will be involved in the annual salary review, promotion and bonus cycles. As part of the job evaluation panel, you will review and ensure that job evaluations are carried out objectively to establish the relative importance of the job accurately. You will also be involved in the annual budgeting process relating to staff costs.

Benefits: You will be responsible to review and implement CAAS’ benefits programme to ensure they are relevant and inclusive. You will involve in benchmarking benefits offerings to market competitive practices and make recommendations for changes and additions to CAAS’s benefits. You will lead the benefits function and work cross-functionally to ensure success of new benefit programme as well as manage all communication and change efforts.

Depending on your experience and skillsets, you may be assigned to take on a combination of portfolios as mentioned above.
Jobreq:
• At least 5-10 years’ experience as a HR practitioner or in an equivalent capacity, with strong leadership and supervisory skills, and relevant hands-on experience.
• Prior experience working in public sector would be an advantage.
• Strategic mindset, self-driven, resourceful and results oriented.
• Be attentive to details and able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
• Ability to work with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality.
• Strong analytical skills, organisational capabilities with ability to work effectively within tight deadlines.
• Possess strong interpersonal, communication (both written and verbal) and confident in engaging key stakeholders at all levels.
• Technology savvy and familiar with digital HR solutions to drive efficiencies.

Note: Your appointment designation will commensurate with your relevant work experience. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in the first instance and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure or subsequent contract renewal.

Jobdesc: The CAAS Next Generation Programme Office integrates capabilities across CAAS divisions and co-opting technical experts and system of system professionals to develop and deliver the NexGen ANS systems. The Director (Engineering) role will focus on leading the team in developing and enhancing maintenance capabilities of the current engineering systems and subsequently the NexGen systems.
Jobres:
As Director (Engineering) in Next Generation Programme Office, you are expected to lead a team of more than 70 engineers to:

  • Develop overall technology roadmap for NexGen Air Navigation Services (ANS) Systems.

  • Develop System integration methodology, tech requirements, process and procedures.

  • Lead the development of tender specifications and documents for key ANS systems.

  • Deliver key ANS Systems.

  • Engage and coordinate with relevant stakeholders that include divisions within CAAS, other government agencies and industry in the course of your work.
Jobreq:
• Extensive experience in systems architecting, management of complex engineering projects

  • Has spearheaded development of engineering capability

  • Expertise in government procurement processes and procedures

Agncy: Ministry of Digital Development and Information
Jobtitle: Technology Strategy And Plans (Deputy Director/ Assistant Director)
Jobdesc: The role of DD/AD /SM Technology Strategy and Plans, Technology Office (TO), is to manage strategic initiatives to support MDDI’s Smart Nation and Digital Economy (SNDE) initiatives.
Jobres:
TO sits at the intersection between MDDI’s senior management team and the executive agencies so that it could help bridge higher level strategies or policies with ground-level deliverables.  

Some of the activities to be undertaken by the incumbent are as follows:

•	Develop a good understanding of the key emerging digital technology areas 
•	Formulate policies, plans and strategies and fund strategic initiatives to support our digital agenda 
•	Maintain oversight of a portfolio of projects under funded under the NRF’s Research Innovation and Enterprise [RIE] funds 
•	Develop qualitative and quantitative assessments to measure the progress of our R&D programmes 
•	Work closely with government agencies and the R&D ecosystem (academia and industry) to grow local capabilities and develop translation strategies
•	Support key decision makers (i.e. MDDI Senior Management, Ex-Co) on matters concerning the direction, progress and budget utilisation of SNDE programmes.
Jobreq:
•	Minimum 3-10 years experience in policy, strategic planning or sector development role
•	Minimum 3-10 years of experience working in a relevant digital technology sector (e.g. AI, Cybersecurity, Infocomm, Quantum)
•	A keen eye on opportunities in exploiting the technology, and in the potential risks it brings, the ability to network and work well with technical experts.
•	The ability to relate with technical and non-technical (layman) people alike. He or she should be able to communicate technical ideas in an effective manner with senior management. 
•	Familiarity with Singapore RIE landscape is advantageous


Please note that only shortlisted candidates would be notified. 

For more information on careers in MCI, please access the link (https://www.mci.gov.sg/Careers-Grants/careers). For more information on our job vacancies, please access Careers@Gov (https://www.careers.gov.sg/) and search for “MCI” in the Search bar.

Jobtitle: [2025 H1 Term-time + Summer Internship] Cloud Infra/DevOps Engineering Intern
Jobdesc:
At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties.

We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success.

Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results.

Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.

At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve.

Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.
Jobres:
The Citizen Disbursement Systems Department is responsible for the development, maintenance, and operation of systems facilitating governmental fund distribution to citizens via social transfer programs such as Assurance Package, Silver Support, GST Voucher, and Workfare Income Supplement. As an Application Team Intern, you will be part of an agile team working to deliver business objectives In this role, you will:

Infrastructure
•  Collaborate with the team to conceptualise, design and deploy cloud infrastructure and workloads, ensuring seamless support for various systems operating on the cloud environment.

• Gain valuable insights into cloud operations and contribute to ongoing enhancements in processes and procedures, aiming for optimised outcomes.

• Dive into the CD systems security framework, refining strategies to bolster data and asset protection, and fortifying the system's defenses against potential threats.

• Collaborate with the team to address the long-term requirements of CD systems, optimising computing resource utilisation, and enhancing the consistency and efficiency of system functions.

DevOps

• Collaborate with the team to conceive, design, and implement cloud-based CI/CD pipelines and related functions, ensuring seamless support for diverse application development teams and facilitating smooth development and release processes.

• Develop tools and features to monitor cloud environments, enhancing the visibility and understanding of system operations within the cloud infrastructure.

• Delve into the DevOps security framework to bolster the security posture of the DevOps platform. Establish policies, standards, and guidelines to govern the DevOps environment effectively.

• Work with the team to address the evolving needs of continuous delivery systems, optimising CI/CD pipelines and releases to improve efficiency, scalability, performance, and transparency across the DevOps platform.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse skills and perspectives that each intern brings. While you may not need to meet every requirement fully, having some familiarity or budding expertise in the following areas will help you make the most of this opportunity and succeed with our team.

•  Currently Enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Information Systems, Information Security, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.

• Demonstrates keen interest in technology, particularly in gaining hands-on experience with cloud systems.

• Proficient in both verbal and written communication, essential for clear articulation of ideas and collaboration within the team.

• Strong focus on accuracy and precision in maintaining records and executing tasks.

• Ability to work harmoniously within a team, valuing input from others and contributing positively to shared goals.

• Readiness to embrace and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, continually seeking opportunities for growth and development.

• Innate drive to take initiative, tackle challenges proactively, and drive personal and professional advancement.

Position is on a full-time internship basis from Jan – August 2025.

What you can expect

Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding internship in a workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you during your internship with CPF Board:

• Learning Opportunities: Engage in impactful projects that allow you to apply theoretical concepts to real-world challenges, helping you gain valuable insights and practical experience along the way.

• Mentorship Guidance: Boost your internship experience with guidance from experienced mentors and supportive peers committed to fostering your growth and helping you thrive.

• Gain Dynamic Exposure: Gain dynamic exposure, drive innovative solutions, and advance your career through involvement in strategic national projects.

• Expand Your Network: Forge meaningful relationships and expand your professional circle within the public service sector through curated intern activities and networking events

Jobdesc:
Hablas español?

We’d like to hear from you.

Join us as a full-time Spanish Language teacher and share the beauty of the language and the culture.
Jobres:
Visit this website to have more details on the daily work of a teacher in MOE and MOELC:

•https://www.moelc.moe.edu.sg/courses/#post_299
Jobreq:
We are looking for dedicated and highly-motivated Spanish Language teachers to work full-time at our MOE Language Centre.

If you have a degree and teaching certification in Spanish Language, in addition to possessing excellent communication skills and a passion for teaching, we welcome you to apply for this position. Applicants should also have the fitness and stamina to deliver lessons, and resilience required to engage students safely and carry out their duties effectively.

You can look forward to a fulfilling career that enables you to develop your students both within and beyond the classroom.

Requirements

• A university degree in Spanish Language.

• A Certificate in the Teaching of Spanish as a Foreign Language (e.g. Bachelor/Masters in Education, Postgraduate Certificate/Diploma in Education).

• At least 3 years of relevant experience teaching Spanish as a Foreign language.

• Experience teaching in classroom settings at secondary level (13-18 years old) in public schools and preparing students for the GCE/GCSE O or A-Level will be an advantage.

• Familiar with setting assessment papers for essay writing, reading and comprehension, and grammar.

• Up-to-date with current best practices, current teaching materials, and current instructional strategies (e.g., effective application of educational technology).

• Good interpersonal skills, communication skills and an excellent team player who works well with students, colleagues and parents.

• A working knowledge of English (CEFR B2 level) is necessary.

Application Details

The application window is open from 4 September 2024 to 1 October 2024, 11pm (SGT, GMT+8). If you wish to be considered for a teaching position, you are required to:
• Click "Apply Now" to fill in the FormSG application form. 
• Attach all your educational transcripts along with your application. If you have not received your official transcripts, you can submit your latest transcripts at point of application.

You will need to submit your application by 1 October 2024, 11.00 PM (SGT, GMT+8). Only applications received via the FormSG application form will be considered.

Should you encounter any difficulty in submitting your application, please contact us at moe_fru@moe.gov.sg for assistance.

Jobdesc: To drive Learning agenda as well as leadership development in the formulation and implementation of people strategies and employee experience.
Jobres:
(I) Learning:

1.  Refresh learning policies and guidelines in line with the organisation’s learning philosophy, including developing a comprehensive training and development system for staff.

2. Refresh and drive Competency Driven Growth (CDG) framework to guide learning and growth based on current and future functional competencies.

3.  Equip reporting officers  to conduct CDG and career conversations with staff, using Career Development Plan tool.

4.  Monitor and assess the impact of the learning and development strategy and initiatives on organisational outcomes.

5.  Manage the learning budget.

(II) Leadership Development

1.  Design and drive Leadership Competency Framework (LCF) with 360 and other leadership development tools.

2. Plan, conduct and follow through Leadership Conversation Series (LCS).
Jobreq:
1. Serving with Heart

2. Commitment and Purposes

3. Thinking Clearly and Making Sound Judgements

4. Stewarding Systems for Today and Tomorrow

5. Caring for, Developing and Inspiring Staff

6. Change Management

7. Data Management and Analysis

8. Business Partnering

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc:
Communicable Disease Agency (CDA) is a new government agency, under the Ministry of Health (MOH) to oversee Singapore’s communicable disease preparedness, prevention and control, surveillance, risk assessment and outbreak response. It will consolidate and build on the public health functions under MOH, the National Centre for Infectious Diseases, and the Health Promotion Board. 

The Head (Internal Audit) of CDA is responsible to build, shape and lead the newly formed Internal Audit function of CDA.  You will establish and oversee the strategic direction and vision for Internal Audit, setting a foundation for its future success.

Apart from providing an independent and objective assessment of CDA’s internal control and governance, the role will entail business partnering, working closely with Senior / Line Management to build internal capabilities, influence attitudes to risks and controls as well as provide objective and professional audit advice and insights. 

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.

This position reports to the Chairperson, Audit, Risk and Finance Committee (ARFC), who oversees the functions of the internal audit department.
Jobres:
In this pioneering role, you will be instrumental in establishing and leading the Internal Audit Team, ensuring robust governance and compliance frameworks from ground up. You will lead to assist ARFC in effectively discharging its roles and responsibilities through: 

a)	Providing strategic leadership, operating at a strategic level to lead CDA’s Internal Audit function, and provide assurance to Senior Management and ARFC members. 
b)	Developing in-depth understanding of CDA’s emerging business needs and developing strategic audit approaches that align with these needs.
c)	Acting as strategic and value-adding partner with business owners, jointly identifying areas of concern and developing robust audit plans.
d)	Undertaking comprehensive review of the entire audit universe to create a thorough and systemic audit plan, that addresses the specific risks and requirements of CDA’s business environment.
e)	Leading both planned and ad-hoc audits, or special investigation as directed by ARFC and Senior Management.
f)	Overseeing the performance of internal audit functions, including managing internal teams and/or outsourced audit service providers to deliver the audit plan and providing actionable recommendations to Management.
g)	Closely monitoring the resolution of audit issues by Management, keeping ARFC and other auditing bodies informed as necessary.
h)	Providing advisory services to Divisions on compliance and controls, ensuring best practices are followed.
i)	Serving as a value-adding liaison between Management, the Auditor-General’s Office (AGO), and other auditing bodies, facilitating clear and effective communication.
j)	Leading and managing the secretariat function of ARFC and other Board Committees, as appropriate
k)	Establishing and overseeing a robust Whistleblowing Management channel, ensuring issues are addressed promptly and transparently.
l)	Driving the development and transformation of the Internal Audit team, enhancing its capabilities to meet stakeholders’ expectation and business requirements.

Additionally, you will assist in supporting MOH Group Chief Internal Auditor (GCIA) in the Ministry’s efforts to drive and facilitate Ministry – Family IA transformation changes and initiatives.
Jobreq:
•	Minimum tertiary qualification from recognised discipline, in an Accounting, Finance or its equivalent background.
•	Minimum 12 to 15 years of experience in public, non-profit or private sector, with at least 6 years supervisory experience in audit and/or risk management roles.
•	Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) and/or Chartered Accountant (CA) is preferred
•	Experience working with Board members and Senior Management
•	Strong sense of responsibility and initiative, with a positive working attitude
•	Proactive team player with strong leadership and effective communication skills
•	Ability to multi-task, with good organising skills (thorough, meticulous, organised and resourceful)
•	Familiar with IT audit and knowledge of data analytics tools will be an added advantage. 

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobtitle: Senior Manager / Manager / Assistant Manager (Office Services) (CDA)
Jobdesc:
As Senior Manager, Manager or Assistant Manager (Office Services) of the Communicable Diseases Agency (CDA), you will be involved in the setting up and management of the office services function in the agency.

The CDA is a new government agency that is being established by the Ministry of Health (MOH) to oversee Singapore’s communicable disease preparedness, prevention and control, surveillance, risk assessment and outbreak response. It will consolidate and build on the public health functions under MOH, the National Centre for Infectious Diseases, and the Health Promotion Board. 

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time for a smooth transition to the CDA.
Jobres:
Your key responsibilities include the following:

•	Be involved in the day to day running of CDA’s office operations and the provision of office services to CDA divisions, including managing key facilities-related contracts
•	Oversee the relevant vendors to ensure the office facilities are well-maintained
•	Propose innovative processes to increase operational efficiency and streamline office processes 
•	Develop and implement various office service policies and procedures
•	Support the implementation of Greengov.sg initiatives for CDA’s offices and ensure CDA complies with the necessary rules, regulations and requirements
•	Promote awareness of sustainability in the organisation through the development and implementation of internal communications strategy
•	Be involved in the preparation of CDA’s annual sustainability disclosures
•	Coordinate business continuity planning and other crisis management matters, including maintaining the business continuity plan and promoting fire safety awareness for the organisation
Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

The jobholder may be activated for duty on weekends and after office hours, as and when the need arises.
Jobreq:
Job Requirements

•	At least 2 years of relevant working experience in office administration is preferred 
•	Tertiary qualification in any discipline
•	Prior experience in planning and implementing sustainability initiatives and sustainability reporting will be an added advantage
•	Familiarity with Government Instruction Manual on Procurement will be an added advantage
•	Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills
•	Effective stakeholder management, communication and interpersonal skills to co-create solutions
•	Good team player
•	Independent and self-driven with the ability to multi-task in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and perform under pressure and tight timelines

Candidates without the required experience are welcomed to apply.

Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobdesc:
As Manager or Assistant Manager (Estate Management) of the Communicable Diseases Agency (CDA), you will play a key role in the setting up and management of CDA’s offices.

The CDA is a new government agency that is being established by the Ministry of Health (MOH) to oversee Singapore’s communicable disease preparedness, prevention and control, surveillance, risk assessment and outbreak response. It will consolidate and build on the public health functions under MOH, the National Centre for Infectious Diseases, and the Health Promotion Board. 

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time for a smooth transition to the CDA.
Jobres:
Your key responsibilities include the following:

•	Be involved in the planning and management of CDA’s office leases as well as CDA’s office space resources
•	Be part of the project team managing the full scale renovation project for CDA offices, including the design consultancy process, to ensure CDA’s offices reflect its corporate identity and provide a conducive environment for staff. This involves managing the full spectrum of CDA renovation projects, including procurement, project management and stakeholder management.
•	Oversee any renovations and refurbishments projects as part of steady-state work
•	Lead projects and initiatives to upgrade the workplace to enhance staff’s experience and provide a conducive environment to support divisional operational needs
•	Manage and track budget expenditure and utilisation for the Facilities Management team
•	Be involved in the planning of CDA’s long term office needs
The jobholder may be activated for duty on weekends and after office hours, as and when the need arises.
Jobreq:
Job Requirements

•	At least 2 years of relevant working experience in facilities/estate management is preferred.
•	Tertiary qualification in Engineering or Building related fields is preferred.
•	Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills
•	Effective stakeholder management, communication and interpersonal skills to co-create solutions.
•	Good team player.
•	Independent and self-driven with the ability to multi-task in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and perform under pressure and tight timelines.
Candidates without the required experience are welcomed to apply.

Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobtitle: Executive Engineer, Enforcement & Structural Inspection Department
Jobdesc:
The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) champions the development of a future ready built environment for Singapore. Besides regulating building safety, we lead and transform the built environment sector in delivering a safe, high quality, sustainable and friendly built environment.

We are looking for resourceful, energetic and self-motivated individuals who are inspired to play an active role to make a difference to Singapore’s built environment.
Jobres: You will be part of the team that regulates safety of existing building structures and slopes. In the course of your work, you will review engineering submissions by professional engineers and liaise with builders and building owners in ensuring the safety of building structures. As part of a dynamic organisation, you will also have the opportunity to work on other aspects of building control.
Jobreq:
- Degree in civil/structural engineering
- Preferably a practicing professional engineer (PE) registered with the Professional Engineers Board Singapore
- Candidates who are not registered PEs but are preparing for registration with the PE Board would also be considered
- At least 5 years of working experience in structural design and analysis of buildings or infrastructures
- Good command of spoken and written English

Successful candidates will be offered contract employment. Interested applicants, please apply online.

Jobdesc:
What the role is:

The Education & Manpower Development (E&MD) team oversees policies and programmes which aim to build a skilled arts workforce that will shape Singapore’s cultural development.
To support the professional development of the arts sector, our key strategic directions include manpower planning and development through research on the arts workforce, PET/CET skills development, manpower policies as well as strong HR practices in arts organisations.

You will contribute towards the formulation of strategies and polities, and/or implementation of programmes and partnerships for arts manpower planning and development. You will also work on building strong relationships with arts institutions and relevant government agencies that are involved in the training and development of the arts sector.

What you will be working on:

  • Research and analysis (e.g. for PET planning).
  • Identify issues, gaps/needs, develop policies and oversee the management of manpower schemes and programmes (e.g. foreign manpower schemes, tripartite standards).
  • Collaborate closely with industry stakeholders (education institutions and arts organisations) and government agencies to develop strategies and initiatives, including developing skills/ competency frameworks, and implement capability development programmes (e.g. apprenticeship programmes, endorsement of SkillsFuture programmes) to builds skilled arts workforce and self-sustaining arts organisations.
  • Manage the Arts Resource Hub (e.g. programmes, physical spaces) for self-employed persons working in the arts.
  • Supervise, guide and mentor the team to development their capabilities and career in NAC.

What we are looking for:

  • At least 10 years of experience in policy or strategic planning.
  • At least 5 years in supervisory position.
  • A good degree in any field.
  • Relevant working experience will be an advantage.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Good communication, relationship management, project management and writing skills.
  • Proactive, resourceful, independent, self-motivated and a team player.
  • Passionate about the arts and culture, and good knowledge of the arts landscape in Singapore.
  • Deep understanding of at least one of the following sectors (literary arts, visual arts, performing arts) will be an advantage.
  • Good understanding of the professional development (CET) needs of the arts sector.
  • Applicants who require work passes need not apply.

About EDB

The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation, and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore.  For more information on EDB, please visit www.edb.gov.sg
Jobres:
As a Data Officer, you will be supporting the Data Office’s mission to foster a strong data culture and governance within EDB. You will be working closely with our divisions to leverage data for strategy formulation, policy implementation and decision making.

The work streams that you could be involved include:

  • Data Products: Establish the business and technical requirements to fulfil EDB’s analytics and reporting needs; shaping our data products to align with the business objectives.
  • Data Services: Deliver the data strategy to grow the data literacy and competencies of EDB; promoting the adoption of data-driven decision making in the organization.
  • Data Governance: Elevate EDB’s maturity in data governance to ensure data quality, the right usage and compliance.

Your roles and responsibilities would include the following:

  • Design and develop data literacy training programs;

  • Conduct regular briefing and training programs to improve data literacy skills, including data analysis, interpretation and visualization, and create awareness on data governance policies and processes

  • Curate and publish data contents, including data policies, processes, best practices, user guides, FAQs, etc, on internal wikis and communication platforms;

  • Monitor and report success metrices for various data program;

  • Develop and maintain data governance policies and processes, including data sharing, data classification and usage, data quality, etc;

  • Support the acquisition of external datasets;

  • Implement data catalog to manage inventory of EDB data assets;

  • Conduct regular reviews to ensure compliance towards data policies;

  • Manage the data sharing between EDB and other external parties;

  • Gather business and technical requirements and translate them into data use stories/chores and documentations;

  • Review and validate completed data user stories;

  • Design and develop engaging and intuitive data visualizations;

  • Provide advisory and support to data users;

  • Review data collection processes and propose improvements to enhance efficiency and data quality;

  • Act as moderator of the data community within the EDB, and foster connections with Whole-of-Government (WOG) data community.
Jobreq:
To meet the challenges of this role, you must have/ be:

  • Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related disciplines;

  • 1-3 years of work experience in Data Management and Governance, Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Project/Product Management, Policies or related work (fresh graduates are welcomed);

  • Good communication and writing skills;

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders;

  • Ability to work effectively under time constraints and potentially changing priorities, while maintaining a high level of attention to details;

  • Ability to work independently; and

  • Singaporean.


Proficiency in the following will be advantageous:

  • SQL scripting experience to analyze, transform and integrate data sources;

  • Experience in designing and developing data dashboards (preferably with Tableau);

  • Experience in gathering requirements and writing user stories;

  • Experience with agile or other rapid application development methodologies;

  • Experience in establishing data policies, standards and best practices;

  • Knowledge of data regulations and privacy requirements (e.g. PDPA, GDPR)

Jobtitle: Senior Manager, Substance Abuse (1.5 years contract)
Jobdesc:
Looking for a job that actually makes a difference?

Join us at the Forefront of Shaping Healthier Lives

The Health Promotion Board’s vision is to make Singapore a nation of healthier people.
Come be a part of this journey if you’re passionate about creating boundary-pushing work that drives behavioral change.

You will be a part of HPB’s Preventive Health Programmes & Rewards Division, Substance Abuse Department, which plans and implements the National Tobacco Control Programme through a multi-prong approach comprising public education, collaboration with partners, and the development of policies to encourage citizens to adopt a nicotine-free lifestyle. The ultimate goal is to help HPB achieve its vision of making Singapore a nation of healthy people and to establish itself as a local and international authority on health promotion.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT

As a key member of Substance Abuse team, you will be actively involved in conceptualising, planning, coordinating, and evaluating public education and implementation of substance abuse prevention and cessation initiatives to reduce the prevalence of smoking and vaping in Singapore. Additionally, you will participate in planning and research to prevent the initiation of smoking and/or vaping among the general population and targeted segments such as youth. Your role will involve educating, motivating, and assisting smokers and/or vapers to quit smoking and/or vaping. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with government and non-government organisations as well as the private sector to develop information and plans in support of anti-vaping efforts.    

        

Together with the Substance Abuse Team, you will conceptualize and implement substance abuse prevention and cessation initiatives, focusing on smoking and vaping, to be delivered at a national scale. You will be involved in the following key areas:

(1) Content creation and programme development, including

  • Evidence-based/informed approach through conducting research of available literature on smoking & vaping to distil learning, findings and relevant information for programme development

  • Curate content suitable for Singapore context, based on understanding of the local situation from available data, surveys, resources etc

  • Derive an overarching framework for alignment of messages related to the department’s work across various segments and settings, in support of the department’s strategic plans and vision

(2) Project management of contracts with service providers providing a suite of offerings for smoking/vaping control initiatives, such as talks, workshops and activations, across different settings, including community, workplaces and schools. This includes:

  • Procurement of services through a tender process

  • Upon award of tender, be the POC and to coordinate requirements and requests from partners and stakeholders

  • Oversee implementation of the contract through close coordination with vendors, partners and stakeholders

  • Monitor and track KPIs, analyse the ROI and evaluate the cost effectiveness of the project

(3) Secretariat to a cross-matrix (inter-divisional) workgroup on Substance Abuse, focusing on smoking and vaping initiatives. This includes:

  • Planning and coordination of meeting schedules and agenda

  • Proactively and strategically propose items for discussion in consideration of ongoing and upcoming efforts

(4) Any other ad-hoc or new tasking as directed by Head of Department

BE PART OF THE TEAM

Join us if you are a good team player with strong interpersonal skills, the ability to communicate with people at all levels, and the ability to work independently and multi-task in a fast-paced environment. You should also possess:

  • Relevant work experience or background in Public Health, Health Promotion or Communications, Public Policy, Business Administration or a related field is advantageous.

  • Possesses at least 5 years of working experience managing projects related to conceptualising and planning programmes, preferably with experience working with government entities, healthcare institutions and service providers.

  • Have the ability to initiate and manage nationwide projects and campaigns.

  • Good communication skills, strong presentation and writing abilities, as well as strong negotiation and influencing skills.

  • Possesses strong analytical & organizational skills 

  • Experience in digital product development, such as app and systems development, will be advantageous

  • Experience in data management, business analytics and PowerBI dashboard will be advantageous

[What the role is]
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape

[What you will be working on]

You will be a member of the team responsible for the formulation of anti-money laundering, counter-terrorism financing and counter-proliferation financing (AML/CFT/CPF) policy for Singapore’s financial industry.  In addition to working closely with  MAS’ sectoral supervisory departments, you will collaborate with other agencies in the Singapore Government, to execute robust, coherent WOG responses to ML/FT/PF risks, and with the industry on initiatives (e.g. the AML/CFT Industry Partnership (ACIP)) to strengthen the collective AML/CFT understanding and defences. Lastly, you will help in the preparations for Singapore’s participation at meetings of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), the international AML/CFT standard setting body, to shape international rule-making.  This will involve the preparation of the review and setting out of issues in relation to the papers tabled at the FATF meetings. You will be required to assist in coordination and tracking of priority follow-up actions across agencies in the lead up to Singapore’s 5th round FATF Mutual Evaluation. You will also be required to help compile and manage statistics that MAS collates across agencies as Secretariat in the lead up to the 5th FATF mutual evaluation.

[What are we looking for]

  • Minimum 1-2 years of experience in a policy, international, and/or regulatory supervisory role.

  • Excellent analytical capabilities, able to dissect policy issues and offer useful options and workable solutions.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong data analytical skills.

  • Team player who is proactive and self-motivated, with a keen interest in shaping outcomes.

  • At the same time, able to work independently, with a proven ability to drive multiple projects to produce quality outcomes in a timely manner.

  • Strong interpersonal skills and able to positively influence internal and external stakeholders.

  • You will be working in a fast-paced environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.
DEPUTY / ASSISTANT SAFETY & HEALTH MANAGER
Jobres:
At LTA, safety is our top priority. We value the safety and health of our staff and the people who work alongside us.

You will provide specialist advice on workplace safety and health issues relating to LTA Construction Projects and play a key role in our drive for a Zero Accident target. To improve site safety performance, you will undertake to conduct site safety audits/inspections/enforcements, corporate safety training sessions and organise corporate safety health promotional events (e.g. Safety forums, Corporate safety retreats). You'll also participate in the Project Safety Review (similar to the Design for Safety requirements) and contribute articles on workplace safety and health for our in-house publications.

To achieve the Zero Accident target, you will come up with new corporate safety initiatives based on data analytics of past near miss/incident/accidents records. You'll also conduct research to gather insights on the latest developments in the area of Safety and Health and new construction technologies.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification preferably in Science or Engineering
• At least 2 years of validated experience in construction safety, preferably in mega or large scale construction projects as a registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer
• Excellent presentation skills
• Good communication and interpersonal skills
• Successful candidate who is not a registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer will be required to attend the WSQ Specialist Diploma Workplace Safety & Health (Level C)
• Those without working experience are welcome to apply

Jobtitle: Performance and Operations Support Unit Specialist
Jobdesc:
At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 
We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success. 
Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results. 
Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.
At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 
Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.
Jobres:
CPF Board helps members to save for their retirement, housing and healthcare needs. Its Customer Contact Centre (CCC) handles one of the highest volumes of phone calls and correspondences (e.g. email) within the Public Service. As a member of the Performance and Operations Support Unit, you will play a crucial role achieve a best-in-class standard for our customer service.
In this role, you will:
•	Review and assess calls and correspondences received by the CCC to identify trends, issues, and areas for improvement.
•	Diagnose potential operational challenges and propose actionable solutions to optimise CCC’s performance and efficiency.
•	Design and standardise comprehensive frameworks for data collection, processing, analysis, and visualisation to ensure consistency and accuracy in reporting.
•	Initiate and manage projects that leverage data to gain customer insights and enhance customer experience. This includes utilising tools for live chat analysis and speech analytics to drive meaningful improvements.
•	Effectively communicate analyses and concepts through engaging presentations and lead knowledge-sharing sessions to foster collaboration and learning.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse talents and experiences that each individual brings to the table. While mastery of every requirement may not be necessary, familiarity and expertise in some of the following areas will position you for success within this team.
•	Relevant experience in roles such as Data Analyst or a similar analytics function which includes hands-on experience with data collection, processing, and analysis, as well as expertise in using data visualisation and analytics tools to drive data-informed decisions.
•	Proficiency in a diverse range of data and statistical tools is highly preferred. This includes advanced skills in programming languages such as Python, R, and VBA. Experience with machine learning techniques and large language models is advantageous.
•	Good experience with data visualisation and productivity software, including Power BI, Jupyter Notebook, Amazon SageMaker, and Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Word, Excel).
•	Good understanding of data infrastructure, operations, and policy, with a focus on data storytelling, foundational analytics principles, and data-driven decision-making.
•	Familiar in handling large datasets with precision, ensuring accurate tracking and reporting of big data. Experience with quantitative analysis, as well as text and speech analysis, is beneficial.
•	Ability in creating clear, impactful written reports and presentations.
The seniority of appointment and actual corporate job title will commensurate with individual work experiences. 
Position is on a 1-year full-time contract directly under the payroll of CPF Board with an option to renew, contingent upon confirmation and subject to organisational needs. Additionally, there is potential for emplacement into a permanent position.
What you can expect
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding career in a progressive workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you:  
•	Opportunities to engage in a mix of formal and informal training, keeping your skills sharp in our ever-evolving technological landscape.  
•	Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance.
•	A vibrant community of like-minded and friendly colleagues, where collaboration and creativity thrive. 
•	A hybrid work model that offers flexibility for remote work, subject to exigencies of service.
•	Flexible dress code that empowers you to choose your appropriate outfit for the day. 
•	A comprehensive rewards package that includes annual leave, pro-family leave, medical and dental benefits, and access to recreational activities. 
About Central Provident Fund Board 
At the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board, we believe in developing individuals who are inspired to do their life’s best work, through 3Ps: Purposeful Work, Professional Growth, People & Culture.
Purposeful Work – The CPF Board helps 4 million members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Beyond being a pension fund, we are unique in being a national social security organisation, and we serve CPF members knowing that we make a difference.
Professional Growth – At CPF Board, you will have the opportunity to learn on the job and pick up new skills and knowledge. Although you are joining one organisation, you will have access to many career paths in the years ahead.
People and Culture – When you join CPF Board, you become part of a mission-oriented organisation with a strong culture of teamwork, collaboration, and innovation. As an employer, we value our people as our greatest asset, and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusivity, where everyone's voice is heard, and contributions are recognised and celebrated.
Come and be a part of #TeamCPF today, to make a difference in the lives of others and in the future of Singapore.

Jobtitle: Manager/ Senior Manager (NCRP), Capability Masterplanning Office
Jobdesc: You will join a dynamic team at the forefront of advancing Singapore’s cybersecurity R&D capabilities. Within the CSA, the Capability Masterplanning Office (CMO) leads the National Cybersecurity R&D Programme (NCRP), where you will play a crucial role in strategising and driving national cybersecurity initiatives. Your work will directly contribute to strengthening Singapore’s cybersecurity landscape by developing and executing strategic programmes and launching initiatives that build a sustainable and resilient system.
Jobres:
•	Conceptualise, plan, and drive R&D programmes to expand Singapore’s cybersecurity research capabilities.

•	Collaborate with a range of stakeholders, including academia, government agencies, and industry partners, to drive the successful delivery of R&D projects and initiatives.

•	Oversee R&D project deliverables, evaluate outcomes, manage budgets, and resolve challenges.

•	Develop and forecast technology requirements, create roadmaps, and shape R&D initiatives within assigned cybersecurity areas.

•	Conduct studies and prepare briefs on global and local cybersecurity trends for management.

•	Provide secretariat support to relevant committees and workgroups, and organise local and international outreach events as needed.
Jobreq:
•	Relevant qualification(s) in Business or Computer Science/Engineering with an interest in cybersecurity. At least 3 years of work experience for Manager role & 5 years & above for Senior Manager role. Candidates from other disciplines may be considered, dependent on relevant working experience.

•	Demonstrated ability to analyse and conceptualise complex issues, providing clear ad actional solutions.

•	Highly adaptable with the capacity to thrive independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

•	Excellent planning and coordination skills, with a focus on precise execution.

•	Strong writing, presentation, and communication skills to effectively engage and influence both technical and non-technical stakeholders, handle sensitive issues, and present ideas with clarify and conciseness.

•	Experience with Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs), public policy, and programme and research management is advantages

If you share our passion to make a difference in the cyber security landscape, take up the challenge and apply now. 

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

For any issues with the application, you may drop your resume with us at csa_recruit@csa.gov.sg.

Note: CSA will be shifting to Punggol Digital District (PDD) in year 2026.

Agncy: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Jobtitle: Assistant Director / Senior Manager (Baby Bonus - Product Lead)
Jobdesc:
At Family Life Group (FLG), our mission is to build strong and resilient families and support them through all stages of life towards the vision of making Singapore a great place for families.

The Services Division (SVC) administers Government services and schemes that enable and encourage family formation. The Baby Bonus and Leave Branch administers the Baby Bonus Scheme and the Government-Paid Leave Schemes, which are key initiatives to support Marriage and Parenthood. 

We are looking for individuals who are keen to contribute to MSF's mission of fostering strong and happy families to join our team.

This position is an excellent opportunity to hone your skills in a) product development and maintenance; b) regulation and compliance; c) operational policy reviews; and d) operational service delivery, in relation to the administration of the Baby Bonus Schemes.
Jobres:
As the Product Lead, you will lead the development and improvement of the Baby Bonus Online (BBO) and related service delivery channels. This includes (i) translating operational policy directions and operations requirements into BBO’s system parameters and (ii) ensuring the BBO is developed as a user-friendly and accessible services for parents and stakeholders.

Your role will involve collaborating with partners, internal departments, government agencies and vendor, and manage a small team to
•	Understand, analyse and streamline processes for Baby Bonus Scheme
•	Review and translate business requirements into systems development requirements
•	Ensure features on the Baby Bonus systems are implemented within budget, scope and timeline 
•	Review and analyse data to support daily operations for compliance and efficiency
•	Prepare submissions to management
Jobreq:
•	Proven experience as a Product Lead or similar role with at least 5 years of working experience
•	Strong understanding of user-centric product design and research, and agile methodologies 
•	Good command of spoken and written English as the position requires regular submissions to management and key stakeholders
•	Strong problem-solving skills, result-oriented, resourceful, adaptable and collaborative
•	Able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment

Jobdesc:
At Family Life Group (FLG), our mission is to build strong and resilient families and support them through all stages of life towards the vision of making Singapore a great place for families.

The Services Division (SVC) administers Government services and schemes that enable and encourage family formation. The Baby Bonus and Leave Branch administers the Baby Bonus Scheme and the Government-Paid Leave Schemes, which are key initiatives to support Marriage and Parenthood.

o Ops policy and/or service journey reviews which include providing input to policy review of new schemes and/or scheme enhancements, developing Ops policy guidelines and SOPs to improve work processes.
o Supporting service delivery projects, including digital transformation efforts.
•	You may be required to review and analyse data to support cross functional projects
Jobreq:
•	Good written and communication skills with at least 2-3 years of working experience
•	Good inter-personal skills working with teams and partners across public and private sector
•	Self-driven, independent and meticulous
•	Open to learning and trying new skills and areas of work
•	Relevant work experience in Ops policy, service delivery related work, change management work is an advantage but not a prerequisite.

Jobdesc:
You will be responsible in supporting the Ministry’s mission to promote a culture of continuous learning and quality improvement through value-driven care to enhance health outcomes and patient experiences.  

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.
Jobreq:
Work Experience, Competencies and Personal Traits

An ideal candidate should possess the following:

•	Thinking Clearly & Making Sound Judgements – Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to support the crafting of sound policy recommendations; ability to grasp timelines, operating context and ground realities.
•	Learning & Putting Skills into Action - Possesses the drive and curiosity to learn and apply new skills, knowledge and new ways of working. 
•	Improving & Innovating – Ability to seek continual improvements, and to innovate and experiment while managing the risks involved. 
•	Working Effectively with Stakeholders – Ability to mobilise and rally partners and stakeholders towards a collective purpose.

Functional competencies required:

•	Systems thinking and analytical mindset – Ability to understand the bigger picture, current realities and interdependencies, develop a deeper appreciation of key issues, envision a better future state by formulating feasible, sound and timely decisions on a plan of action.
•	Foundational knowledge on quality improvement concepts, approaches, methodologies and tools - Demonstrates an understanding in the use of key quality and safety improvement concepts (including value-driven care), approaches, and tools. 
•	Foundational knowledge on data-driven performance management, quality and safety – Demonstrates skills in collecting, analysing and interpreting qualitative and quantitative healthcare performance data related to quality and safety. This includes familiarity in literature review, basic statistical analysis, data visualisation tools and performance measurement.  
•	Leadership and stewardship – Ability to positively influence and inspire the team members, MOH peers and colleagues. 

Requirements
•	Tertiary qualification. Healthcare-related, Data Science or Economics qualification would be an added advantage. 
•	At least 10 years of relevant working experience in the healthcare industry.  
•	Aptitude for in data collection and analytics. 
•	Possess good people and networking skills demonstrating strong key stakeholder management experience.
•	Good project and time management skills.
•	Effective interpersonal skills. 

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobdesc:
As a Senior Manager/Manager/Assistant Manager in the Mental Health Office, You will play a critical role to support the coordination of Whole-of-Government efforts and development of strategies and policies in the implementation of the National Mental Health and Well-being Strategy. You will also support longer term strategic planning and development of enablers in mental health care and promotion of social-health integration for the mental health ecosystem of the future.

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.
Jobres:
To develop an effective mental health ecosystem, you will support the Office to implement the National Mental Health and Well-being Strategy (“Strategy”) in the following areas but not limited to: 
(1)	Coordinate and monitor Whole-of-Government efforts under the Strategy through developing, coordinating and monitoring population-level mental health and well-being indicators and maintaining the Office’s resource allocation;
(2)	Conduct strategic planning and enabler development for the mental health ecosystem. Develop a digital mental health blueprint that maps out the ecosystem for digital solutions and processes for mental health care; and
(3)	Review legislations related to mental health.
Jobreq:
•	Relevant qualifications in healthcare, public health or related field, preferably psychology or allied health or life science. Fresh graduates are also welcome to apply.
•	Postgraduate education in Public Health or equivalent would be an advantage.
•	Relevant knowledge and experience in developing and implementing strategies and policies.
•	Additional experience in reviewing of legislations, stakeholder engagement, or public communications would be an advantage.
•	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyse qualitative and quantitative data, and develop evidence-based recommendations.
•	Good communication skills, both written and verbal, and well-versed in coordination and logistical arrangements.
•	Able to work independently as well as in a team, and in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.


Key Competencies Required:
•	Thinking Clearly & Making Sound Judgements – Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to support the crafting of sound policy recommendations; ability to grasp timelines, operating context and ground realities.
•	Learning & Putting Skills into Action - Possesses the drive and curiosity to learn and apply new skills, knowledge and new ways of working. 

•	Improving & Innovating – Ability to seek continual improvements, and to innovate and experiment while managing the risks involved. 

•	Working Effectively with Stakeholders – Ability to mobilise and rally partners and stakeholders towards a collective purpose.

Agncy: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Jobtitle: Assistant Director/Senior Manager/Manager (Ops and Systems/Policy and Planning)
Jobdesc:
At Family Life Group (FLG), our mission is to build strong and resilient families and support them through all stages of life towards the vision of making Singapore a great place for families.

The Services Division (SVC) administers Government services and schemes that enable and encourage family formation. 

We are looking for individuals who are keen to contribute to MSF's mission of fostering strong and happy families to join our team. This will be an excellent opportunity to hone your skills in (a) grant governance and scheme administration involving operations and policies; and (b) planning and executing service delivery projects.
Jobres:
We are looking for individuals to be part of a dynamic team tasked to implement a new scheme to support families. 

We are looking for people with experience in either (a) operations and systems or (b) ops policy work.  Depending on your experience and interests, you may choose to be part of either one of the teams.  Please indicate your preference to HR when applying. 

(a)	Team 1: Operations and Systems
As part of the ops and systems team, your scope will include:
•	Working closely with policy, ops, IT and vendor stakeholders to translate scheme parameters into system requirements and operations. You may be required to review data glossaries to translate it into system parameters. 
•	Review and implement operational workflows and processes (such as exceptions handling, appeals, grant administration)
•	Manage day-to-day operations and system/product development
•	Manage the contact centre team
•	Any other tasks assigned to you to achieve operational and service excellence for the scheme.

(b)	Team 2:  Ops policy and Planning Team
As part of the ops policy and planning team, your scope will include:
•	Working closely with policy and ops stakeholders to translate policy parameters into scheme parameters.
•	Develop and steer implementation strategy based on policy intent, which may comprise drawing up ops policy guidelines and includes working out appeals criteria, exceptions handling criteria amongst others.
•	Request and manage the budget for the scheme and team.
•	Drive data-informed reviews on the scheme to monitor KPIs, identify business gaps and opportunities for improvements.
•	Any other tasks assigned to you to achieve policy outcomes and operational excellence of the scheme.
Jobreq:
•	Able to work as a team and be open to take on tasks with positive and collaborative mind set
•	Analytical – able to connect the dots and translate policy into operations
•	Resourceful – able to come up with ideas or workarounds to manage speed bumps
•	Able to engage stakeholders across domains as well as with senior management
•	Good written and communication skills
•	Self-driven, independent and meticulous
•	Relevant work experience in Ops policy, service delivery related work, change management work or systems and ops work is an advantage

Jobdesc: As a statistician in the Policy Planning Division, your responsibilities include monitoring, coordinating and reporting on Singapore’s progress in sustainable development, as well as developing and driving the adoption of national statistical standards and classifications, and statistical best practices.
Jobres: You may need to engage other government agencies and be involved in reviewing statistical legislation as well as data management policies and processes to facilitate data access and sharing from a WOG perspective.
Jobreq:
•	Possess knowledge or experience in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or other relevant subjects  
•	Strong analytical and writing skills  
•	Excellent communication and presentation skills  
•	Strong liaison skills in working with other agencies, with the ability to work under tight timelines  
•	Able to work well both independently and as a member of a team

Jobdesc:
As an Assistant Director in the Mental Health Office. You will play a critical role to support the coordination of Whole-of-Government efforts and development of strategies and policies in  the implementation of the National Mental Health and Well-being Strategy. You will also support longer term strategic planning and development of enablers in mental health care and promotion of social-health integration for the mental health ecosystem of the future.

This will include mental well-being related areas as part of population upstream preventive efforts.

You will also lead the team to drive longer term planning and develop strategy directions for future care needs, and drive collaboration and engagement processes with relevant stakeholders. 

You will also lead the team to support the implementation of the National Mental Health and Well-being Strategy through coordinating and monitoring of Whole-of-Government efforts; and provide support as MOH liaison & secretariat for interagency mental health committees.
