Jobdesc:
At the Ministry of Transport (MOT), we spearhead developments in Singapore’s land, sea and air transport sectors to advance Singapore’s economic competitiveness and Singaporeans’ quality of life.  We seek dynamic, analytical and committed individuals to join our able MOT team in realising the vision of a world-class transportation system and a global interconnected hub.
 
If you share our vision and possess the qualities we seek, join us!
Jobres:
You will play the role of a Project Manager, responsible for the Budget System implementation:
•	Lead the project team in the implementation of the Budget Planning and Management System (iBPMS), working with internal stakeholders and external stakeholders to ensure the timely delivery of a good working system with minimal issues. 
•	Work closely with the Vendor to ensure project deliverables meet quality standards, anticipating issues and planning proactively to mitigate risks.
•	Work closely with the Finance Budget Team to understand their requirements, engage them for key design decisions and play the role of an intermediary with the Vendor. 
•	Perform first level review of documents provided by the Vendor prior to review by the Finance Budget Team.
•	Coordinate with MOT IT Section to ensure that the infrastructure will be able to support the System 
•	Stay aware of policy changes to ensure that the System is aligned with business objectives.
•	Advise Finance Budget Team on process transformation where applicable.
•	Engage LTA (MOT’s SB) on the integration of iBPMS with their budgeting system and project contractual matters. 
•	Lead and guide the team to perform User Acceptance Testing, Data Migration and other activities throughout System implementation.
•	Work with Change Management team to engage MOT HQ Divisions and SBs.

You will lead a team of officers, who will support you in the system implementation. You will also work closely with your supervisors in your officers’ personal and career development, including engaging your officers and conducting career conversations.
Jobreq:
•	Tertiary qualification in IT /Accounting or equivalent professional qualification will be an advantage.
•	Knowledge of Government budgeting will be an advantage.
•	Strong leadership qualities and proven track record of system delivery. 
•	A self-starter who can work independently and be a team player as well
•	Proven ability to effectively multitask and manage heavy workload independently
•	Strong written and communication skills
•	Meticulous attention to details is necessary 
•	Possesses good interpersonal skills and is service-oriented

Jobdesc: This is an Executive position under Industry Development Division.
Jobres:
• Support division in reviewing, categorising and digitising key documents for knowledge management.
• Support division in set up and maintenance of document folders within SSG document records system.
• Provide regular updates and summary of digitisation efforts.
• Support on-going document filing requests.
• Support division in data preparation, data cleansing work and report collation.
• Provide other administrative support to Division which includes handling meeting logistics, general correspondences, enquiries and data administration work.
Jobreq:
• Possess at least 3 years of administrative work experience
• Proficient in at least 2 or more of the following work tools: MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, MS PowerPoint.
• Able to handle and manage data and information.
• Positive attitude, willing to learn.
• Possess the following qualities: collaborative, adaptable, independent, meticulous.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc:
ICA is Singapore's lead agency in border security and our country's first line of defence against security and immigration threats. The checkpoints at our borders play a crucial part in ensuring the security and safety of Singapore. The relentless vigilance of our ICA officers and heightened security checks ensure that the safety of our country is assured.

If you aspire to make a difference to our nation's security, come join us now!
Jobres:
[ LEADER IN BORDER SECURITY ]

As a HAS (ICA) Direct-Entry Inspector, you are responsible for the implementation and enforcement of the laws, regulations and policies of the various work of the Department; as well as the management and operation of the various branches/commands under the Department.

Leading a team of highly-skilled and well-trained ICA officers who are tasked with the duty of protecting Singapore's gateways, you play a critical role in ensuring the security of the nation. You have to possess leadership capability, be decisive, mentally agile, and display qualities of courage and integrity. You will be trained and developed to become a professional in border security, in-land enforcement and policy implementation.

[ REMUNERATION ]

First Class Hons / Second Class (Upper) Hons - $4,809 to $5,436
Second Class (Lower) Hons / Pass with Merit / Pass - $4,460 to $5,227
*Starting salary will vary according to assessment during interview, relevant work experience and completion of full-time National Service.

[ $15,000 SIGN-ON BONUS ]

Newly appointed Direct Entry Inspector will receive a sign-on bonus, with $5,000 paid upon signing on and $10,000 upon confirmation after a one-year probation. 

[ BENEFITS ]

•	18 - 21 days vacation leave
•	Medical & dental subsidies
•	Group Life insurance
•	Sponsorship for postgraduate study
•	Use of government holiday bungalows
•	Subsidies for sports and recreation activities
•	Performance and annual bonuses
•	Marriage / Child benefits
•	Birthday vouchers

[ TRAINING ]

Newly appointed officers will undergo a 26-week non-residential ICA Basic Course (Inspector) at the Home Team Academy, which will equip officers with the knowledge and skills to perform their duties.

Training includes:
•	Document examination & forgery detection
•	People, goods and vehicle screening
•	Profiling and interview techniques
•	Law and legislation
•	Firearms training
•	Control and restraint techniques
•	Protective security
•	Personal effectiveness and soft skills 
•	On Job Training
•	Leadership Training and Development (includes residential training)

Direct-Entry Inspectors are required to serve a one-year bond upon completion of training.

[ JOB DEPLOYMENT ]

- Foundational Posting
Upon graduation from the ICA Basic Course (Inspector), officers will be deployed to one of the Checkpoints e.g. at Woodlands, Tuas, or Singapore Cruise Centre. Officers deployed at the checkpoints work on three shifts. They are also required to wear uniform while on duty.

- Developmental Posting
As part of officers' career posting and exposure to ICA's line operations, officers with suitable aptitude may be deployed to perform enforcement-related work which includes the conducting of raids against illegal immigrants, participation in operations against smugglers, contraband detection and investigations. Officers may also be deployed to the Services Centres to assess applications for travel documents, permanent residence, citizenship, identity cards or other passes/permits. The posting deployment choices extend to development of officers in the areas of planning and review, operations management and policy administration. There are also opportunities for officers to go on overseas posting stints.
Jobreq:
[ REQUIREMENTS ]

•	Physically fit
•	Normal Colour Vision
•	Possess qualities of leadership, initiative and versatility
•	Singapore Citizen

Jobdesc:
SSG is a dynamic and forward-thinking organization dedicated to empowering individuals and shaping the future of Singapore's workforce. As a statutory board under the Ministry of Education, SSG leads the charge in driving the SkillsFuture movement, a national initiative that promotes lifelong learning and skills development. With a strong focus on innovation and collaboration, SSG works closely with employers, training providers, and individuals to create a vibrant ecosystem of learning and growth. By offering a wide range of initiatives, programs, and funding schemes, SSG enables individuals to unlock their full potential, acquire new competencies, and stay ahead in a rapidly changing job market.

Join the Data Strategy & Analytics Division (DSAD) team to grow SSG into a data-mature organization where we use data pervasively and securely to deliver on our business missions:
• Develop and drive SSG’s data strategy, including LOIs, data competency, and maintaining strong links with CIO Office
• Develop, implement and maintain comprehensive data governance and management framework that complies with WOG requirements Implement Lines of Inquiries
• Support data management and exploitation
• Develop MLOps and instil best practices
Jobres:
The Data Scientist in the Data Strategy and Analytics Division reports to the Principal Manager and plays a pivotal role in deriving business insights from large and real-time datasets for fraud and risk management, strategic planning as well as operational efficiency. This position will develop, deploy and maintain data analytic models as well as have opportunities to also collaborate with other public agencies to introduce and enhance data science capabilities (such as Jobs and Skills) for the organisation. As the domain expert in data analytics the Data Scientist is also expected to coordinate, strategize and guide the SSG officers performing data analytics work to achieve efficiency and accuracy.

  • Data Analysis & Model Development

  • Research and develop statistical and machine learning models for comprehensive data analysis

  • Utilize algorithms and models to mine big data, perform data and error analysis, and ensure data uniformity and accuracy

  • Apply data mining techniques and perform statistical analysis to generate insights at scale

  • Collaboration & Solution Development

  • Work closely with both internal and external stakeholders to understand analytic needs and develop effective solutions

  • Create machine learning-based tools or processes, such as recommendation engines, and monitor their performance through A/B testing and predictive capabilities

  • Communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement necessary improvements to operational systems

  • Innovation & Capability Building

  • Identify relevant structured and unstructured data sources for mining meaningful insights

  • Build prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide scalable insights

  • Contribute to building data analytics capabilities across the organization, emphasizing the strategic value of data in achieving business objectives
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics.

  • 3-8 years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational disciplines.

  • Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) and data analysis/processing tools (e.g., R, Python).

  • Experience with Cloud Technology (e.g., AWS data and analytics Tech Stack) and distributed computing tools (e.g., Hadoop/Spark).

  • Demonstrated ability in building machine learning models at scale, using real-time data pipelines on platforms.

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.

  • Proficiency in data engineering, including SQL and manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis.

  • Advanced skills in pattern recognition and predictive modeling.

  • Experience or specialization in fraud prevention/detection, compliance, forensics, or Jobs and Skills related analysis will be considered advantageous.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a strong emphasis on collaboration and innovation.

Jobdesc:
The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation, and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore.
For more information on EDB, please visit www.edb.gov.sg

Contact Singapore engages entrepreneurs and business owners who are interested in relocating to and investing in Singapore.
Whether creating new businesses or expanding businesses in Singapore, we connect entrepreneurs and business owners with relevant partners to facilitate their decisions in establishing strategic activities in Singapore
Jobres:
As part of the team, you will:

  • Spearhead the attraction and engagement of global business owners and entrepreneurs to invest in Singapore, thereby creating new business activities and generating new job opportunities.

  • Develop and implement effective lead generation and client engagement plans both in Singapore and in markets that you are responsible for.

  • Facilitate the interests of the business owners through close collaboration with private and public sector partners.
Jobreq:
To meet the challenges of this role, you should have the following experiences and attributes:

  • Degree in any discipline

  • At least 4 years of work experience, preferably in client engagement roles

  • Excellent interpersonal and communications skills

  • Dynamic and keen to work in a fast pace environment

  • A self-starter and able to work independently

  • Good analytical and lateral thinking abilities

  • A keen eye for details

  • Ability to converse, read and write in Business Mandarin is preferred

  • Singaporean

We review applications on a rolling basis. Applicants can expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date.

The team supports STB in the area of public relations, media engagement and marketing campaigns to drive corporate and destination messaging and safeguards STB’s corporate identity and reputation. As a Strategic Communications Officer, you will be responsible for shaping STB's corporate identity and keeping international and local travel trade informed of STB’s latest developments, through a variety of communications channels and strategies.
Jobres:
• Support the organising and execution of STB’s annual Tourism Industry Conference. This would include working with the event organiser as well as internal line units on the invitations, logistics as well as creative assets for the event etc.  
  • Oversee daily media monitoring and reporting. You would be required to work closely with the media monitoring agency on the daily monitoring reports to ensure it is well curated, accurate and succinct.

  • Strong team player and collaborative with good interpersonal skills to manage both internal and external stakeholders

Jobtitle: Deputy Director, Senior Cyber Research & Intel Analyst
Jobdesc:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.
Jobres:
You will be part of a dynamic team within the Technology & Cyber Risk Supervision Department in MAS that is responsible for strengthening the cyber resilience of Singapore’s financial sector.


In this particular role, you will be leading a team that is responsible for conducting surveillance, research and analysis to monitor the latest trends and developments in cyber threats/attacks, assess the risk implications to financial institutions in Singapore, and participate in initiatives to strengthen cyber situational awareness and resilience in the Singapore financial sector. The work undertaken by the team encompasses the following:

  • Gather and analyse cyber threat information and intelligence from various sources to derive insights on the latest attack tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs), attack trends and patterns, as well as threat actors’ profiles

  • Provide technical support on the analysis of cyber incidents, as well as recommendations on the incident response and mitigation measures

  • Disseminate relevant information to both internal and external stakeholders, including senior management, to provide early-warning on impending cyber threats and promote greater cyber situational awareness

  • Administer test-beds to study malware and exploits, as well as evaluate cyber security applications, rules/signatures, access controls and configurations of security platforms

  • Implement projects and initiatives to continuously improve the team’s research and intelligence capabilities

In addition, you can also be expected to drive projects and initiatives in one or more of the following areas:

  • National and financial sector CII protection and cybersecurity initiatives

  • Cross-border cyber collaboration and intel-sharing with other financial authorities, government agencies and strategic partners

  • Cybersecurity workshops and exercises to strengthen cyber resilience in the Singapore financial sector

You will be working in a fast-paced environment that will require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments.
Jobreq:
• Proven track record with 10 or more years of working experience in IT/cyber security or related fields, and at least 2 years in leading a team and managing projects

  • Effective leader and team player, who thrives under pressure and possesses strong communication, critical thinking and stakeholder management skills

  • Technically competent and well-versed in the key principles of cyber security and risk management, and the relevant industry best practices

  • Good understanding of cyber threat intelligence (CTI) and what the work entails

  • Ability to think critically and strategically to guide team members in conducting effective threat and risk assessments  

  • Having relevant professional qualification/certification (e.g. CISSP, CISM, SANS-SEC511, SANS-FOR578, SANS-FOR610 etc.) will be beneficial

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobdesc:
The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation, and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore.
For more information on EDB, please visit www.edb.gov.sg

The Integrated Marketing team is part of EDB’s Brand, Marketing and Communications (BMC) division. Collectively, we oversee the Singapore business brand; coordinate all of EDB’s advertising needs; and execute campaigns promoting Singapore’s attractiveness as a destination to companies. Our goal is to build awareness of Singapore amongst international businesses and talent; and to translate this awareness into tangible interest from these audiences in moving to Singapore.
Jobres:
As a Senior Associate/Manager (Brand), you will be the proud parent of one of the most exciting brands in the world, the Singapore business brand (yes we’re biased). You will use the left side of your brain to analyze how Singapore should be perceived by a global business audience and the right side of your brain to come up with exciting ideas to make this happen; you will then make these ideas a reality through compelling activations and campaigns around the world.

Your responsibilities will include:

Campaign execution and localization

  • Manage integrated brand campaigns across paid, owned, earned, and partner channels. This involves campaign strategy and planning; production and execution; performance reporting; and stakeholder/vendor management

  • Localize the Singapore business brand in one or more of our key markets, including Germany, Japan, Singapore, the UK and the US. This involves working with EDB’s international offices in those locations on online and offline activations as part of those offices’ overall go-to-market

Brand strategy

  • Support meetings, workshops, and consultations with EDB senior management and Singapore government stakeholders on the direction of the Singapore business brand

  • With the rest of the Brand team, suggest changes to the Singapore business brand in line with EDB’s wider industry development strategy, and translate these suggestions into EDB’s brand campaigns

Brand governance and proliferation

  • Commission, govern, and drive adoption of Brand SG and EDB assets and toolkits, including visual assets, design templates, and merchandise

  • Monitor application of the Singapore and EDB brands across EDB and partner touchpoints, including events, digital campaigns, and partnerships

Other ad hoc responsibilities

  • Depending on business needs, you may be asked to support other integrated marketing work led by other team members. This could include supporting the execution of other marketing campaigns through events, partnerships, and paid media.
Jobreq:
• Singaporean

  • At least 4 years’ brand marketing experience, preferably in B2B or public sector, as part of a marketing agency or as part of a corporate/government brand marketing team

  • Experience in planning and executing integrated marketing campaigns spanning paid, owned, and earned channels

  • Experience supervising and working with marketing vendors such as creative agencies and market research firms

  • (Preferred) Experience with Singapore government procurement processes

  • A degree in relevant disciplines including, but not limited to Marketing, New Media, and Mass Communication

  • Ability to deliver high-quality work with minimal intervention from your managers

  • Ability to influence internal and external stakeholders, including many who are not marketing experts

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced working environment with high complexity tasks

We review applications and interview on a rolling basis. Applicants can expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

  • Meticulous eye for detail and processes
  • A strong command of the English language
  • Good writing, communication and presentation skills

Jobtitle: School of Technology for the Arts, Media and Design - CET Associate Lecturer
Jobdesc: School of Technology for the Arts, Media and Design - Continuing Education and Training (CET) Associate Lecturer
Jobres:
As a CET Associate Lecturer you will:

1. Deliver and assess curriculum for youth and adult learners via face-to-face and E-learning modes, in these areas:

a. Digital Photography, Video Production, Immersive Media Production and Visual Post-production e.g., short factual/fictional video content for web, 360 Video Production, Product and Portrait Photography,

b. At least one foundational school discipline area (creativity, story writing and appreciation, photography, working in the creative sector, or arts history)

2. Supervise programme development activities as assigned such as portfolio development, competition training, and student projects

• The ability to manage projects and events whilst adhering to strict timelines, and conduct post implementation project reviews

• Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to present to large and small groups, and a sensitivity to the needs of people of diverse academic, socio-economic, and cultural backgrounds

• A self-starter, agile learner, with a personal interest in coaching and mentoring others and managing stakeholder expectations

• Strong analytical, administrative and digitalisation skills including accessing databases and IT-enabled automation Additional Advantages:

• Advance Certificate in Learning and Performance (ACLP) certified

• Management experience

• Experience in Motion Graphics and Post-production, both in Adobe and Davinci Resolve

• Experience using digital design applications (Adobe or similar) and E-learning tools (e.g., Adobe Captivate or similar)

We encourage applications from people with a disability and will make any reasonable adjustment that you need both in the interview process and on the job.

Jobtitle: Deputy / Assistant Director, Competitiveness & Grants, Business Competitiveness
Jobdesc:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. ​

[What you will be working on]

You will be part of the team responsible analysing the competitiveness of Singapore’s financial sector and developing the financial ecosystem to support Singapore as an international financial centre. This includes the management and administration of the Financial Sector Development Fund (FSDF).

Your role will include:

  • Monitoring financial sector developments and tracking the performance of asset class strategies

  • Studying the business environment and formulating developmental strategies to enhance Singapore’s position as a leading international financial centre

  • Overseeing the management and administration of incentive schemes under the FSDF to support Singapore’s growth as an international financial centre

  • Conducting budget planning and designing resource allocation frameworks to effectively manage FSDF’s resources

  • Engage relevant MAS departments and other external stakeholders (including industry players, consultants and other government agencies) to identify emerging issues, as well as to seek feedback and propose strategies and initiatives that will advance Singapore’s standing as a modern services hub

[What we are looking for]

  • Strong interest in financial sector trends and economic development work

  • Possesses strong numeracy, problem solving and reasoning skills

  • Effective communication and stakeholder management skills

  • Accounting knowledge or relevant experience in economic development work, grants management/ administration, budget planning or financial modelling is an advantage

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.
You will support the Business Partnership function by partnering key divisions in CAAS in strategic and operational financial planning.
Jobres:
You will provide mission critical financial/operational information to drive financial performance, including impactful trends and variance analysis, risk sensing and scenario planning.

You will drive financial performance to achieve value-for-money outcomes through financial advisory and decision support in project planning, contract awards and management, as well as operational and strategic planning for the division. You will also develop financial models and business analysis to support strategic initiatives to review critical strategic and financial decisions. You will lead the review of current modelling tools and processes, as well as the design of analytics. You are also to ensure alignment with, and support the CAAS' strategic directions over the long-term.
Jobreq:
We require an energetic, results-oriented leader and team player with the following prerequisites:

• Training in Accountancy, Business, Finance or related areas
• Minimum 3 years of relevant experience, candidates with background in audit are also welcome to apply
• Possess strong thinking and analysis skills, self-motivated and resourceful
• Strong communication, influencing and team playing skills

Note: Your appointment designation will commensurate with your relevant work experience. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in the first instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure or subsequent contract renewal.

Jobdesc: You will support the Business Partnership Branch in strategic and operational financial planning.
Jobres: You will provide mission critical financial/operational information to drive financial performance, including impactful trends and variance analysis for forecast, budgets and long-term financial projections. You will identify cost-effective funding strategies, develop appropriate costing methodologies, pricing models and policies to set fees and charges. You will also develop financial models and business analysis to support strategic initiatives to review critical strategic and financial decisions.
Jobreq:
• Relevant qualifications in related fields e.g. Finance, Accounting, Business Administration. A professional certification such as Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), or Certified Management Accountant (CMA) will be advantageous
• Minimum 10 years of experience in financial planning and analysis
• Solid business partnership experience
• Effective financial leadership

We require an energetic, results-oriented leader and team player with the following pre-requisites:
• Possess strategic vision, strong thinking and analysis skills. You must be able to think strategically and provide financial insights that support the organization's overall goals and objectives.
• The ability to manage multiple projects and priorities, work under pressure, and meet deadlines. A strong work ethic, attention to detail, and a commitment to accuracy and integrity are essential.
• Strong partnering, influencing and interpersonal relationship skills. This is a cross-functional role that requires collaboration with other departments and stakeholders. The ability to work collaboratively and build strong relationships is essential.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills. You will need to be able to communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Note: Your appointment designation will commensurate with your relevant work
experience. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in the first
instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure or
subsequent contract renewal.

Jobtitle: School of Technology for Arts, Media and Design - Tech Exec (up to 11 mth)
Jobdesc: School of Technology for Arts, Media and Design - Technical Executive - Up to 11 Months Contract
Jobres:
(a)  Teaching and Learning
i. Liaise with lecturers to assist in the set up of AV equipment for classes, industry projects, campus and off-campus events, and adhoc workshops.
ii. Perform first-tier repair/servicing work of AV equipment and troubleshoot IT issues
iii. Ensure operational readiness of teaching aids, such as video cameras, sound systems, projectors, computers and AV consumables


(b) Facilities and Asset Management
i. Liase with vendors on the:
•       Sourcing of quotations related to equipment/component purchases

iv. Tag purchased goods, consumables and file for asset management
v. Ensure proper and safe use of teaching spaces and equipment in accordance with QEHS (Quality Environment Health Safety), WSH policies and procedures

(c) Administrative Support
i. Perform simple admin tasks as required

(d) Able to perform entry-level IT functions and also, have good computer literacy.
(e) Familiar with Microsoft Word and Excel.
(f) An aptitude for learning and innovation
(g) Strong team player mind-set yet able to work independently and work well under pressure to meet deadlines
(h) Able to work shifts if necessary to support evening classes

Jobdesc: Assistant Manager, Residential Leasing
Jobres:
• Maximise potential of properties through the formulation & implementation of marketing, estate and asset enhancement initiatives

  • Collaborate with internal and external partners including marketing and managing agents, valuers and facilities managers to increase occupancy, rejuvenate properties & estates and establish strong relationships with good tenants

  • Manage revenue and cost to ensure optimal returns from properties including the setting up and monitoring of budget for the assigned portfolio

  • Review existing contracts, practices and workflows to complement efforts to achieve the performance level of the properties, enhance the tenants’ experience; improve the service level agreements with external partners; and monitor the performance of external partners effectively and efficiently

  • Resolve feedback and property enquiries from public, tenants, ministries and other government agencies in a professional and timely manner in the best interests of SLA and the Government
Jobreq:

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Good writing and presentation skills

  • Good sense of emerging trends in residential real estate

  • Able to work independently as well as in a team

  • Working knowledge of contracts, facilities management and government procurement would be an advantage

Jobdesc: DEPUTY/ ASSISTANT MANAGER, REVENUE PROTECTION
Jobres: You will be part of a team to ensure that the public bus operators put in place measures to minimise bus fare revenue leaks, as well as audit the bus operators’ declared fare evasion rates. You will be actively involved in the collation and analyse of fare evasion data as part of bus fare revenue protection measures. You will also work with other LTA divisions and the bus operators to develop the equipment used for fare evasion checks. You will liaise often with other government and non-government agencies, as well as the public bus operators in the course of your work.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in any discipline
• Resourceful team player with good initiatives, situational awareness, integrity and ability to work independently
• Mature and ability to analyse operation needs and put in place procedures or processes to optimise work flow
• Meticulous and have an eye for details, with good writing, communication, analytical and interpersonal skills

Jobdesc:
Manager, Land Development (Architect)

You will be part of a team working on project management of large scale commercial and integrated development works.
Jobres:
• Review and manage different stages of project from feasibility studies, concept, schematic to design development for integrated development projects

  • Develop project directives, outlines, projections, time lines, resource studies, and strategies to meet pertinent building/construction rules and regulations

  • Work with various stakeholder on the users’ requirements

  • Consultation with regulatory authorities and liaison with relevant stakeholders

  • Review shop drawings, RFI, material samples, method statement, etc

  • Project management to ensure project is kept on schedule including supervision of work progress, resolve ground issue with contractor and relevant stakeholders, conduct progress meeting
Jobreq:
• Background in Architecture, preferably registered with Board of Architects, Singapore

  • Good knowledge of building codes and regulations

  • At least 8 years of working experience in design and development of large scale commercial and integrated development works

  • Good communications and writing skills

  • Flair in design, ability to sketch fast and produce good design concepts

Jobtitle: Software Engineer - School of Information Technology
Jobdesc: You will undertake industry and Applied R&D project design and development and will play an active role in the professional & personal development of your learners to prepare them for work & life.
Jobres:
• Work with project manager/lead to fulfil the required project deliverables

  • Provide technical mentorship to project students

  • Relevant qualification in the area of Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related fields of study

  • Good knowledge of agile development, DevOps and cloud technologies; and hands-on experience with cloud infrastructural services such as AWS, Google etc

  • Experienced in web and mobile and leveraging technologies such as React,  JQuery, JavaScript, iOS, Android.

  • Experience in eliciting requirements from users and translating to software requirements

  • Experienced in architecting and developing solutions with different complexity

  • Good analytical and able to communicate well

  • Possess a passion for working with youths and nurturing them

Jobdesc: Conduct landscape research of employer branding efforts to identify story ideas, including interviewing internal and external stakeholders for features
Jobres:
The scope will include but not limited to:
• Propose and conceptualise CSA’s social media contents plan for 2024 to brand CSA as an employer of choice to potential scholars/students/working professionals
• Design social media contents (eg. EDM, Posters, Flyers) on #insideCSA activities or initiatives
• Film and produce short clips to showcase the fun side of working in CSA
