Jobreq:
Application Requirements:

• Background in digital communications, digital media design or marketing preferred
• Strong interest and understanding of social media channels and trends (LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, Twitter and Facebook.Etc)
• Experience in graphic design and video editing tools (Adobe Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro and basic knowledge of social media analytics tools
•Excellent writing skills and digital media content creation for social media stories
•Resourceful and creative – able to generate ideas for social media stories 
 
Application Details:
To apply, please submit your cover letter indicating your internship availability period, resume and latest transcripts (poly and/or university). Incomplete applications may be considered. Shortlisted candidates should hear from us within 2 to 4 weeks from date of application. Due to the high volume of applications we receive, we seek your understanding that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Internship Period: Minimum 6 months or more

Jobdesc: The Singapore Global Network (SGN) is a division in the Economic Development Board tasked to re-energise Singapore’s efforts in building a strong and extensive ecosystem of overseas Family, Friends, Fans (3F) for Singapore. SGN leads the Whole-Of-Government effort to coordinate across agencies and strengthen our collective networks whose skills, affinity and influence could help build linkages to global business and talent communities, and enhance the international mindshare of Singapore as a leading globally-connected city.
Jobres:
Responsibilities

As a member of SGN’s digital products team, you will develop, deliver and maintain a tech stack that enables SGN’s work in fostering connections between and within Singapore’s global business and talent communities. There is also opportunity to work on other digital products within the wider EDB organisation.

We are looking for a Software Engineer with an interest in full stack development to join our passionate and purpose-driven team. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a start-up environment, building up the digital platform and infrastructure to serve a large-scale network all around the world.

As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, testing and deployment of end-to-end software solutions, with the following key responsibilities:

  • Spearhead work with cross-functional teams to develop user-centric web applications, supported by necessary back-end applications and databases for functionality

    • Create performant code by figuring out how to make a feature work best for users as well as under-the-hood optimization, while conforming to system design

    • Design and create automated tests to ensure functionality of components and applications

    • Participate in code reviews and contribute to team knowledge sharing

    • Support, maintenance and documentation of software functionalities and technical specifications

    • Ensure quality of releases, responsiveness and security of applications, debugging issues, fix bugs, and identify bottlenecks

    • Design and develop RESTful APIs

  • Proactively stay abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages to identify and recommend existing components and technologies that can be leveraged to deliver on our goals
Jobreq:
Requirements

Resourcefulness, integrity, drive, and a good team player are must-haves. Some combination of the following would help for favourable consideration:

  • At least 3 years of experience as a software developer or equivalent position

  • Diploma or degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related disciplines

  • Experience with cloud-based application development and web security

  • Experience in translating user’s requirements to technical solutions for high fidelity testing

  • Experience in agile development teams, employing relevant methodologies and practices such as Scrum, Continuous Integration and Deployment to enable rapid delivery of value such as scripts for automated testing tools, scripts for configuration management

  • Knowledge of modern Software Engineering best practices, software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

  • Proficiency in:

    • Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS. Proficiency in other modern programming languages is a plus.

    • Relational and non-relational databases, such as MS SQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB etc

    • Front-end frameworks such as React or Angular 2

    • Deploying and maintaining content management systems and web applications in the cloud

  • Curious, inquisitive, keen and quick to learn, and generous and patient to share knowledge with team mates and mentor fellow developers

  • Singaporean

Jobdesc:
Project Title: Study of best practices in leveraging technology to transform and redesign jobs in the future economy in the ASEAN region.

Project Overview: In an era marked by rapid technological advancements and disruptions, understanding the future of work is more crucial than ever. ASEAN member states (AMSes) acknowledge the urgency of leveraging technology to transform and redesign jobs to meet the needs of the future economy.

Singapore is working with AMSes to consolidate their experiences, best practices and success stories in a study. The repository and cross-sharing of experiences will guide AMSes to navigate such changes effectively, and a roadmap to advance preparations of a future-proof workforce.
Jobres:
The intern is expected to draft a paper consolidating the best practices in leveraging technology to transform and redesign jobs in the future economy in the ASEAN region. 

To this end, the intern is expected to (a) conduct a literature review and (b) research selected best practices and identify success factors.
Jobreq: The project will enhance the intern’s research, writing, analytical and critical thinking skills. The project will also help the intern develop soft skills given the need to engage foreign counterparts. These are valuable skills for those looking to join the Public Service in a policy making role after graduation.

Jobdesc: You design operating procedures and oversee the operations of a printing centre which provides in-house printing services to all SAF units.
Jobres: On this, you supervise two teams to ensure the timely delivery of all print jobs and maintain high-quality control that aligns with service delivery and product quality standards. You also manage finance and logistics to support production requirements. Your challenge lies in being able to track the performance of the team to meet customers' needs and expectations.  You must also ensure quality standards, cost efficiency, and timely delivery to achieve customer satisfaction.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, preferably with 5 years' experience in printing production. You should possess good knowledge of graphic design and production process as well as good interpersonal skills. Appointment will be commensurate with your experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You formulate and establish sound processes, systems and frameworks to oversee the smooth and efficient execution of core financial processes within MINDEF.
Jobres: You also review, implement effective performance measurement frameworks, and undertake effective management and governance of financial services which have been outsourced. You manage and ensure that resources are optimally utilised and introduce digitalisation and innovation to help streamline and automate the internal and outsourced financial processes. In addition, you monitor the resource accounting/allocation mechanisms and educate units on the need to be prudent in the used of services rendered by the Shared Service Provider, and facilitate resolution of issues through establishing escalation procedures in the event of a conflict. Your challenges lie in creating benchmarks and ensuring that the quality and cost of services provided by the Shared Services partners are consistent with industry standards, and to continuously review the financial operations landscape within the Whole-of-Government (WoG) and to put in place new technologies or process improvements where relevant.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, in Business Administration, Business Studies, Finance, Accountancy or any related field, with at least 2 years' working experience, preferably with an understanding and/or experience in accounting, managing service level agreements, and outsourced processes. You should have hands-on knowledge of accounting software (SAP) and working knowledge of MS Office applications, as well as possess strong analytical, communication, planning and writing skills. Appointment will be commensurate with your experience.

(Applicants with no experience may apply.)

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You manage key stakeholders in our eco-systems and bridge partnerships with our digital counterparts in the Whole-of-Government (WoG) and technology partners in the digital industry.
Jobres: On this, you are the main Point-of-Contact to manage all of the Digital and Intelligence Service’s (DIS) tech partnerships within our own internal eco-system and externally to MINDEF/SAF, WoG and Industry. Through the partnerships, you identify opportunities from our tech partnerships and convey them in senior-management level meetings within the DIS, and with the wider community of MINDEF/SAF and the Defence Tech Community. Your challenge lies in being able to work in a high tempo and dynamic environment, well-versed in MINDEF/SAF establishment policies, as well as being keenly aware of MINDEF/SAF wide organisation developments. You also need to understand technological concepts, industry trends and draw value for the DIS.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, preferably with relevant working experience. Possession of good analytical, interpersonal, writing and verbal communication skills is essential. Having proficiency in computer applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel and Data Analytics/Visualisation programme such as Power BI, Qliksense is advantageous. You may be required to travel overseas for work. Appointment will be commensurate with your experience.
 
(Applicants with no experience may apply.)

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You manage employee feedback from MINDEF/SAF employees to resolve employee service-related issues.
Jobres: You analyse feedback and identify policy and process reviews to address system issues and employee pain points. In addition, you build a seamless omni-channel experience for employee feedback and driving channel migration/improvement efforts towards digital services to enable self-help and reduce feedback volume.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, with 1 to 2 years' work experience in a service delivery or project management role. You should possess an understanding and familiarity with system/technical solutions of the different employee feedback channels, the MINDEF/SAF ecosystem, policies, and processes for employee feedback management, as well as good service delivery and customer experience. Possession of strong communication, interpersonal, and project management skills is essential to establish strong working relationships with feedback channel owners, obtain their buy-in, and mobilise their involvement to establish a seamless omni-channel experience for employees. Appointment will be commensurate with your experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Agncy: Ministry of Digital Development and Information
Jobtitle: Manager / Snr. Manager (Workforce Transformation), Workforce Development, SNDG
Jobdesc:
The Smart Nation Group – Digital Government (SNDG), under the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) and administratively managed by the Ministry of Digital Development and Information (MDDI), plans and prioritizes key Smart Nation and digital government projects, raises the standards of Government ICT and services, builds long-term capabilities for the public sector, and promotes adoption and participation in digital and smart innovations. It takes a whole-of-nation effort, and we will actively engage the public, the industry and fellow agencies as we build a Smart Nation together.

The Workforce Development Division at the Smart Nation Group – Digital Government is at the forefront of facilitating the digital transformation of the Government's workforce. Join our dynamic Transformation team and play a crucial role in shaping the future of tech workforce development, impacting public good outcomes through innovative projects and programmatic interventions. This role offers a high-impact, fast-paced environment with exciting challenges and opportunities to contribute significantly to the digital evolution of the public sector.
Jobres:
As a Manager/Senior Manager in the Workforce Development Transformation team, you will be responsible for running projects, adding value as a team player to lead to better outcomes, and making interventions and recommendations that yield benefits for the organisation. 
In this role, you will propose and implement ways to improve existing processes, contributing to quantifiable savings in time, finances, and addressing skills gaps at the whole-of-government level. This role demands a strong technical acumen, strategic thinking, and effective stakeholder management.

Key Responsibilities:
•	Independent Project Leadership: Run projects independently, making interventions and recommendations that result in quantifiable benefits exceeding costs as compared to the status quo.
•	Process Improvement: Propose and implement ways to improve existing processes, leading to better outcomes, including quantifiable savings in time, finances, and addressing skills gaps.
•	Project Execution: See through projects in well-defined problem spaces independently, with minimal supervision. Handle regular projects with clear problem statements where stakeholder interests are broadly aligned.
Jobreq:
What you need to do it:
•	Collaborativeness and Ability to Drive Team Outcomes: Work well and contribute effectively to the team. Coordinate seamlessly within the team, discussing issues comfortably, clearly, and concisely. Display openness towards constant improvements, applying skills and knowledge to drive better outcomes for projects and teams.
•	Strong Technical Acumen: Defend and articulate views effectively, consider relevant HR and organisational development data points, and suggest alternative metrics for project success.
•	Strategic Thinking: Understand broader developments and the operating context well. Consider longer-term implications of relevant policy developments and integrate them effectively into considerations.
•	Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholders well in most instances, displaying initiative and a track record of making things happen. Seek occasional assistance in navigating complex situations.
•	Problem Diagnosis and Solution: Diagnose problems with today's systems, provide clear problem statements, and actualize ideas to address them.

Qualifications:
•	Bachelor's degree or equivalent in relevant field(s) (e.g., Engineering, Management, Computer Science, Business Management).
•	Proven experience in project management, workforce development, or related roles.
•	Keen interest in the technology space

Jobtitle: [Winter Internship] Overseas post-18 models for persons with disabilities
Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Social Programmes Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
The intern will conduct a literature review of overall expenditure on adult disability, and financing models (by service type) in other countries, and determine how findings can be applied to Singapore's context.

The intern will also study the extent to which mental health conditions are defined as disabilities, and its impact on fiscal outlay.

At the end of the internship, the intern will prepare a report and present the findings.
Jobreq:
•	Good writing skills and interest in subject matter
•	Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025

Jobdesc:
You will lead the team to ensure optimal provision, allocation and management of Ministry’s budget to achieve the strategic objectives of the Ministry and WOG in a fiscally sustainable and value-for-money manner.  

You will be working in an innovative, people-centred organisation that contributes towards the promotion of good health and ensuring access to good and affordable healthcare for all Singaporeans. 

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.
Jobres:
•	Lead and supervise in the review of MOH’s block budget requirements
•	Formulate and operationalise funding frameworks, budget policies and procedures to ensure the effective use and allocation of resources in line with national strategic outcomes.
•	Lead in the review of the funding approach and budgetary requirements for Agencies under MOH
•	Lead in the operating and development budget proposals from MOH Divisions, MOH Agencies and other MOH funded entities
•	Lead in the preparation for Committee of Supply Debate & Parliamentary Questions
•	Supervise and guide the budget team in meeting work deliverables and initiatives
Jobreq:
•	Tertiary education in Finance related discipline. Specialised training in finance and accounting would be an added advantage.
•	At least 15 years of relevant experience in finance with at least 5 years of experience leading a budget team in Ministries & Statutory Boards
•	Good leadership and team management 
•	Good teamwork and able to work well with and engage other Divisions  
•	Good writing and strong communication skills
•	Good quantitative and analytical skills 
•	Excellent project and time management skills
•	Able to see the strategic, big picture from the policy perspective
•	Able to multi-task, work independently, and work under pressure and meet tight deadlines to produce the desired results.
•	Meticulous, committed and responsible

Ideal candidate should also possess the following key competencies 
•	Thinking Clearly & Making Sound Judgements – Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to support the crafting of sound policy recommendations; ability to grasp timelines, operating context and ground realities.
 
•	Learning & Putting Skills into Action - Possesses the drive and curiosity to learn and apply new skills, knowledge and new ways of working. 

•	Improving & Innovating – Ability to seek continual improvements, and to innovate and experiment while managing the risks involved. 

•	Working Effectively with Stakeholders – Ability to mobilise and rally partners and stakeholders towards a collective purpose.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobdesc: You will drive excellence in the planning and operations, policy development, compliance and governance, as well as the system enhancements of the procurement function. You will manage stakeholders, including procurement practitioners and management, to build procurement awareness and achieve high performance in controls and efficiency.
Jobres:
• Develop procurement strategies to achieve cost-effective results
• Continuously review and improve the policies, processes and systems to enhance governance, results and operational efficiencies in procurement
• Deep dive into spend analytics to identify efficiency opportunities
• Enhance procurement literacy and upkeep procurement competencies of officers conducting procurement in CAAS
Jobreq:
Requirements:
• At least 5 years of relevant experience
• Prior experience in government procurement is advantageous
• Keen interest in governance, processes, systems, analytics and policy development
• Strong thinking and problem-solving skills
• Excellent written, communication and interpersonal skills
• Independent, pro-active, persuasive, impactful & resourceful
• Able to focus on priorities and deliver in a fast-paced environment

Note: Your appointment designation will commensurate with your relevant work experience. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in the first instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure or subsequent contract renewal.

Jobdesc:
Supporting the Business Partnership Branch in the Finance Division, you will
serve as a business partner for strategic & operational financial and
procurement planning.
Jobres:
You will provide decision support for projects and new initiatives, including
procurement advisory to achieve value for money in project outcomes. You
will improve the monthly spend analysis to enhance governance, results and
increase operational efficiencies in procurement. You will support the
development of financial plans and procurement approaches, including longterm projections, budgets, and forecasts.
Jobreq:
Requirements:
 Training in relevant work areas or equivalent professional qualification
 At least 5 years of solid experience in procurement, with a track record
in supervision
 Independent, resourceful, energetic, proactive, results-oriented leader
and team player
 Strong thinking and analytical skills
 Excellent written, communication and interpersonal skills
 Good project management and decision support skills
 Conversant with integrated software applications

Note: Your appointment designation will commensurate with your relevant
work experience. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in
the first instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent
tenure or subsequent contract renewal

Jobtitle: Deputy Director, Customer Insights and Service Process Improvement
Jobdesc:
Health Promotion Board (HPB) is committed to inspiring a healthier Singapore. As a trusted partner of our citizens, we strive to deliver intuitive and personalised experiences that empower individuals to embrace holistic well-being.
To serve Singaporeans, HPB engages its customers via online and offline touchpoints such as outreach through the different settings including workplaces, schools, community, health screening / school health and dental services. HPB also manages a contact centre, corporate website, social media platforms, HPB’s Healthy 365 mobile app, and conduct roadshows in support of specific programmes.
As we embark on a transformation journey to enhance our customer experience delivery across the various touchpoints, we are looking for a data-driven leader with a proven track record in enhancing customer satisfaction and touchpoints improvements, who will play a pivotal role within our organisation, to lead the development and implementation of a comprehensive customer insights programme, oversee customer survey management, and lead CX strategy implementation and service process improvement initiatives.

Responsibilities
The responsibilities of the successful candidate will include:

  • Develop a comprehensive CX strategy implementation plan that outlines clear objectives and actionable initiatives to achieve the intended CX adoption.
  • Develop and execute strategies for gathering, analysing, and interpreting customer insights through various channels such surveys, feedback mechanisms, and customer interactions.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of customer feedback, behaviours and interaction data to identify trends, patterns and areas for improvements.
  • Utilise customer insights to identify pain points, opportunities, and areas for improvement across all touchpoints.
  • Collaborate with cross-divisional/functional teams to implement process enhancements.
  • Lead continuous improvement initiatives to optimise service delivery.
  • Leverage data analytics and automation to enhance the customer experience and lead operational efficiency.
  • Establish CX standards and implement processes for ongoing monitoring and evaluation.
  • Develop and implement strategies to address gaps and lead continuous optimisation of customer experiences.
  • Presenting findings, insights and recommendations to stakeholders (i.e. programme and touchpoint teams) to formulate action plans for improvement.
  • Update at key CX forums to update progress, lead data decision making and prioritisation in CX initiatives.
  • Leverage on board-wide change management efforts to drive adoption of the new CX strategy across the organisation. This may involve identifying potential barriers to change, developing mitigation strategies, and fostering a culture of openness and adaptability.
  • Oversee the procurement process, propose and manage budget and maintain close oversight of contracts to maximise the value for the organisation.
  • Monitor contract performance and compliance throughout the contract lifecycle.

Requirements
 

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Minimally Bachelor in Business, Service Management, Service Design, Statistics, Data Analytics, or a related field.
  • Certifications in Customer Experience Management (CXM), Service Design, Agile methodologies, BPR, Six Sigma, Lean methodologies, and data analytics (e.g., SAS, SPSS, Python, or equivalent) are desirable.
  • Minimum of 8-10 years of progressive experience in customer experience, market research, service management, and data analytics.
  • Proven track record in leading and managing teams.
  • Experience in developing and implementing customer experience strategies.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in data analysis, statistical software, and key driver analysis.
  • Experience in designing and conducting customer surveys and research.
  • Knowledge of survey management systems, customer data management, and data warehousing.
  • Experience in process improvement methodologies (e.g., BPR, Six Sigma, Lean) and service blueprinting.
  • Proficiency in data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and process mapping software (e.g., Visio).

Skills Requirements:

  • Strategic thinker: Ability to develop and execute a long-term vision for customer experience.
  • Strong leadership skills: Proven ability to lead and inspire teams.
  • Excellent communication skills: Effective in communicating complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Analytical mindset: Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.
  • Customer-centric: Passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences.
  • Results-oriented: Focus on achieving measurable outcomes and driving business impact.
  • Change management: Ability to lead organisational change and overcome resistance.
  • Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships across departments.
  • Influencing skills: Ability to persuade and influence stakeholders at all levels.

Jobtitle: Manager (Customer Service Delivery - Enterprise Grants Management)
Jobdesc:
At IRAS, we partner you to deliver quality services and foster a competitive economic environment to achieve growth for our nation. You will be part of a future-ready team that leverages data and digital capabilities to support enterprise growth and inclusive workforce practices through effective enterprise grants management.

This role manages the distribution of funds for the government and ensures that there are safeguards in place for the payouts to be fairly and correctly disbursed.
Jobres:
Service Delivery
- Handles queries from enterprises on Government payouts schemes administered by IRAS, including handling appeals and feedback across multiple contact channels, displaying IRAS’ service attributes (e.g. 3PCs) to deliver the desired IRAS experience 
- Understands the profile of stakeholders, identifies their needs and nudges them towards self-help channels

- Facilitates understanding of scheme eligibility conditions
- Is proficient in using various digital tools and systems to provide service to taxpayers
- Keeps abreast of tax and service developments to provide up-to-date and accurate advice to stakeholders

- Service data analysis

Stakeholders Engagement & Education
- Analyse target stakeholders’ profile, define engagement purpose and devise engagement content
- Analyse market trends, business models and audit observations that may impact compliance level and plan for relevant engagement/education activities to prevent non-compliance
- With understanding of IRAS services, products and methodologies (e.g. Design, BI), develop and execute robust stakeholder engagement and education campaigns through digital and non-digital channels (e.g. social media) to tackle areas of non-compliance
- Promote the use of digital services and digital record-keeping to improve overall compliance
- Ensure contents (digital and non-digital channels) meet channel goals and taxpayers’ expectations
- Create concepts and messages that are user-centric and provide visual experiences to users across digital assets (web and other digital channels)
Jobreq:
- Degree in any discipline
- Experience in customer service, good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to question, probe and analyse
- Organized and systematic in handling data
- Resourceful and able to work independently in a team environment

We regret to inform that only short-listed candidates will be notified.
All successful hires will be offered a 2 year contract in the first instance.

Jobdesc: EXECUTIVE / ENGINEER, TRAFFIC ANALYSIS & PROJECTS
Jobres: You will play an active role in the design, review and implementation of traffic diversion schemes in Singapore. Your traffic analysis and work will help facilitate the movement of vehicles on our roads, during road/rail infrastructure development, major events or even when providing priority to buses etc. You will offer professional advice to consultants, event organisers, other agencies and LTA divisions on traffic plans and traffic impact studies. Besides exercising your professional judgement, you will also develop your interpersonal skills through interaction and communication with the community and various stakeholders. You will also spearhead projects that will enhance the travel experience of commuters, motorists and cyclists, to create an improved living environment for all road users. We offer a dynamic working environment to those with technical and analytical abilities and who enjoy challenging boundaries.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering, Traffic / Transportation Engineering, or related engineering fields.
• 1 year of experience in Traffic / Transportation-related or operational fields / familiar with highway design preferred
• Possess initiative, good communication and leadership skills with lateral thinking ability
• Possessing Class 3 driving license is an advantage
• Knowledge of Data Analysis tools or Traffic Microsimulation is an advantage

Jobdesc:
The key scope of work for the position is to provide operational support of Energy Management Systems which involves round the clock monitoring and control of electricity generators as well as the electricity and natural gas transmission networks. In addition, the position is also required to operate a Cybersecurity Operation Centre to monitor cybersecurity threats and manage Power Sector Critical Information Infrastructure incidents.

Energy Management System
• Provide first-level technical support to the Energy Management System to ensure high availability and reliability. This includes attending to technical problem reported by Power System Operators, operations and maintenance of Energy Management System, other supporting operational technology systems, OT/IT network & security infrastructures to ensure these systems (both hardware and software applications) are of high availability and reliability.
• Participates in the design and technical enhancements on mission-critical Energy Management Systems (EMS) such as integrating renewables such as solar, energy storage and electricity imports into EMS to meet operational business requirements. This also includes fine tuning of power system applications to support real-time operations such as power system studies (e.g. Contingency Analysis, Transmission Network Analysis, Short Circuit Analysis), Automatic Generation Control, load forecast, solar PV forecast, telemetry, State Estimator, and the Dispatcher Training Simulator.
• Coordinate with Licenseses' to facilitate connection of new generation facilities, transmission network equipment (both electricity and gas systems) including performing updates and validate of EMS databases with field equipment and market operation.

Cyber Security Monitoring for Power Sector
• Provide first-level technical support for Cyber Security Operation Centre (CSOC) to manage cyber incident that may cause severe impact to Power System Operation and Power Sector's Critical Information Infrastructures (CIIs). Job responsibilities include analysing security alerts, identifying anomalies, report findings to stakeholders. Perform daily triage of the security cases and following up with CII Operators and resolution of incidents reported.

Cybersecurity Risk Assessment & Management
• Develops technical solutions, including cyber security mitigation measures and/or configuration changes to meet regulatory requirements such as Cybersecurity Act and CCoP.
• Coordinate security reviews risk assessments, security audits that can effectively pre-empt and identify significant security loopholes or weaknesses. This include carrying out documentation reviews, testing and implementing recommendations by the auditors, and performing system patching.

In addition, the department also maintain other critical supporting infrastructure such as Uninterruptible Power Supply, fire protection system, security access system etc to ensure reliable operation of the EMS system and the operation centres.

Requirements:

• Keen interest in the field of OT cybersecurity, power system engineering and serving in public service.
• Competency in computer programming, technical hardware architecture, Linux/Unix/Windows Operating System. Familiar with basic networking commands and understanding of basic networking protocol and security concepts. Good understanding of information security practices related to ISO 27001, Risk Assessment, Application and Network Security.
• Good understanding of Power System Engineering, Control Centers Operations, electricity substation/gas facility environments and devices would be added advantage.

Agncy: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
Jobdesc: GeoSpace-Sea is Singapore’s inter-agency National Marine Spatial Data Infrastructure (MSDI) initiative which develops and implements an integrated, data-rich infrastructure for Singapore’s marine space, for the key purpose of inter-agency sea space management and planning. As Manager, you will be involved in the development, implementation and maintenance of the Geo-Space Sea as well as build and strengthen partnerships with and among other agencies and stakeholders such as Institutes of Higher Learning, public and industry users of the data.
Jobres:
• Understanding business needs and processes to propose Geographic Information System (GIS) solutions;

  • Prototype GIS related solutions by studying requirements, systems flow, data usage and work processes;

  • Support application software configuration, programming, enhancement and testing based on changing business requirements;

  • Provide timely support to users to resolve issues surfaced, and recommend solutions that are effective and optimal; and

  • Exploring new technologies and propose innovative technology solutions to meet business needs.
Jobreq:
• Good knowledge and experience with hands-on development in scripting and/or developer languages such as JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, .Net framework, JavaScript framework, web mapping framework, web services etc.;

  • Knowledge and experience with GIS technologies and products;

  • Knowledge and/or experience with geospatial data analytics and/or advanced geoprocessing is desirable;

  • Knowledge and/or experience in any of the following area(s) will be an added advantage:

    • Cloud services;

    • Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) tools; and

    • 3D modelling.

  • Able to work independently and as a team, highly motivated and passionate about prototyping, developing geospatial web applications and using geospatial technologies to improve work processes; and

  • Effective presentation, communication and writing skills.

Jobdesc: Engage and work with the Social Service Agencies (SSAs) in the respective sub-sectors, namely (i) Family, Youth and Children cluster (ii) Disability, Eldercare and Residential cluster and (iii) Mental Health and Community cluster, to drive and support their capability development journey in digitalisation, people and volunteer management.
Jobres:
• Engage SSAs within the assigned cluster to identify, evaluate and support the adoption and implementation of various capability development initiatives/applications in digitalisation, people and volunteer management.
  • Ensure that the SSA capability development plans are in place and documented, and that sectoral resources produced are used by majority of SSAs within the cluster.
  • Guide and support the use of various frameworks and evaluation tools (Employee Engagement Survey, Data Acceleration Index, Voluntary Management Matrix, Organisational Health Index etc) and ensure compliance with specific sector requirements.
  • Monitor the progress of implementation and provide timely intervention to ensure the initiatives are on track.
  • Review and process funding applications from SSAs in OurSG Grants portal.
  • Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to advance the SSAs’ capability development, aligned with National Level initiatives.
  • Involve in organising and implementing capability development programmes/events.
Jobreq:
Personal Competencies:

  • Strong communication and empathy skills
  • Self-motivated and results-oriented with a high level of initiative
  • Strong analytical and conceptual abilities
  • Adaptable in a dynamic environment
  • Able to work independently and in a team

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Knowledge of the social service sector
  • Able to navigate within the sector and between the government and the sector
  • Stakeholder management skills

Experience:

At least 2 years (Manager) / 7 years (Senior Manager) experience in stakeholder management related work, preferably in the public/ social service sector.

Special Certification(s):

Project management related certification is an added advantage.

Jobtitle: Senior / Assistant Director, Social Resilience, Project Office, ACE Group
Jobdesc:
The Assurance, Care and Engagement Group (ACE), a permanent division under the Ministry of Manpower, improves the well-being of migrant workers by enhancing the healthcare, housing and social aspects of the migrant worker landscape. 

As a Senior/Assistant Director in the Project office, You will lead and oversee the development/re-development of migrant workers recreation centres (RC) and recreation hubs (RH), so as to improve recreational facilities for migrant workers, de-densify community hotspots and minimize public dis-amenities. The role contributes to ACE’s objectives by providing adequate care to the migrant workers and engaging them via various events and programmes to achieve better mutual understanding and trust.
Jobres:
•	Lead a team of officers to translate concepts and user requirements on the integrated services that can be offered in a RH, including distilling insights from various stakeholder groups and applying innovation for the new RH concept and the revitalised RC concept.

•	Lead a team of officers to engage stakeholders and agencies and forge strategic partnerships in order to develop and subsequently operate the RH and RC in a sustainable and feasible manner in order to incorporate new concepts and service offerings within the new RCs and RHs.  This would include working closely with the Design Advisory Panel comprising members from private-public sectors, as well as running key engagement platforms to ensure the success of the RCs/RHs. 

•	Steer the large-scale multi-year RH and RC development project, from design consultancy stage, to getting the necessary approvals and policies in place.

•	Oversee a team of officers to plan, monitor and coordinate timelines and resources for the redevelopment of existing RCs, development of new RCs and RHs.  

•	Oversee and monitor the budget utilisation, resourcing support and overall project contract and financing management framework.

•	Operationalise sustainable funding and financing approaches and incentives, where government works with partners to run operations and programmes at the RCs/RHs.

•	Develop and implement corresponding SOPs to facilitate new funding model
Jobreq:
•	At least 5 years of experience in a supervisory role, with working experience in business strategy, operations policy, project management and stakeholder management.	
•	Excellent written and spoken skills.
•	Comfortable with making presentations to different stakeholders at short notice.
•	Good interpersonal skills to liaise and negotiate with internal and external stakeholders at different levels.
•	Possess critical thinking skills to analyse complex and multi-factorial issues. 
•	Able to work independently or as a team, and adaptable to complex changes.
•	Keen interest in and versatile in tackling policy and operational challenges.

Jobdesc: As the authoritative source of Singapore’s real estate statistics, we are the dynamic team of property data analysts, economists and statisticians responsible for maintaining a transparent, stable and sustainable property market in Singapore. We are currently looking for a new hire to provide statistical, research and administrative support to the Property Research Department.
Jobres: The candidate will be involved in the conduct of market surveys, compilation of property market statistics, management of data portals, as well as liaison with IT vendors on data systems. In addition, the candidate will also help implement new processes to improve efficiency in data collection.
Jobreq:
· Diploma preferably in statistics, real estate, business administration, finance or other relevant fields
· Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, Power BI or other similar database management software
. Working experience in organisations that deal with data collection, publication and research will be advantageous
· Good interpersonal and communication skills
· Ability to work independently as well as in a team
· Ability to work quickly and meet tight deadlines
· Innovative and resourceful

Jobtitle: Manager/ Senior Manager, Growth & Partnerships (1 yr contract)
Jobdesc:
Looking for a job that actually makes a difference?

Join us at the Forefront of Shaping Healthier Lives

Overview
You will be a part of HPB’s School Health Outreach Division that is responsible for engaging key stakeholders such as parents, educational institutions to establish supportive health promoting environments and policies, implement programmes to ensure that children and youth in Singapore are in optimal health for holistic growth, learning and development.

Health areas of interest include nutrition, physical activity, mental wellness, tobacco control, management of screen use, sleep hygiene and communicable diseases prevention.

School Health Outreach Division is adopting agile approach to step up the use of technology to augment our outreach efforts. This is a new growth area of work that we have recently started to experiment. Besides operationalising these new initiatives to optimise health and well-being of children and youth, the staff (1 year contract) will play an instrumental role in translating the learnings from our innovations to transform the way we design our digital engagement for child and youth health promotion.

Scope

As a key member of Partnerships & Growth team, you will have to be comfortable to put on many hats as you will be part of a dynamic team where your primary areas of focus will include, but not limited to plan and operationalise the digitalisation plans and experiments in support of optimal health for young school going children. Your responsibilities will include providing project management and secretariat support to ensure that product development milestones are delivered as per timeline.

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Developing/ adopting agile approach, identify and test suitable (existing/new) digital features and platforms using time-bound experiments to test for proof of concept;

  • Using human centred design approach to curate library of “digital journeys and missions”;

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams, procure and manage appointed vendors, provide secretariat support to the workgroup in charge of C&Y digitalisation efforts; assist in project and budget management, tracking project timelines, monitoring progress, and ensuring timely delivery of committed milestones.

  • Gathering useful insights from student projects, research, feedback from focus group discussions and user testing and conduct Brown Bag sessions to refine the digitalisation plan for future iterations;

  • Translating learnings into applications – bridge the gap between technical insights gleaned from pilot experiments with applications to reinforce health initiative/ efforts;

  • Providing regular updates to internal and external stakeholders on project progress and identify potential risks and issues.

What an ideal candidate looks like

An ideal candidate will be a dynamic and self-motivated individual with at least at least 3 years working experience in managing family/parents/children related digitalisation projects. You will have strong stakeholder management, project management, problem solving, networking, and influencing skills.

The candidate should also possess:

  • Good analytical, inter-personal, persuasive writing and verbal communication skills and exhibiting strong political sensitivity.

  • Able to multi-task and handle concurrent projects; works well in a fast-paced environment effectively and independently as well as in team-based arrangements

  • Adaptable to changes, proactive, dynamic, resourceful, creative, collaborative, self-motivated and a strong desire to excel.

  • Identifying and cultivating strategic partnerships, with ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels.

  • Able to work independently, and to lead/participate in peer/matrix teams where required.
Executive, Accounts Receivable (2-year contract)
Jobres:
• Check incoming receipts via Nets, Cheque, GIRO, Credit Cards and ePayment.

  • Process receipts entries accordingly to receipt in nature

  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of various collection exercises and sub-systems’ collections / charges

  • Handle Cash vouchers , including requisition and distribution

  • Process student PSEA and Skills Future Submission

  • Bank in cheques  

  • Undertake other ad-hoc tasks assigned
Jobreq:
• At least 1 year of experience in Accounts Receivable is preferred

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint). Familiarity with financial system would be an advantage

  • Meticulous and be able to adapt to changes

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills

  • Good time management and be able to meet deadlines

Jobtitle: [Winter Internship] International approaches towards resourcing the Judiciary
Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Security & Resilience Programmes Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres: The intern will have the opportunity to engage in a research project regarding the approaches taken internationally to provide resourcing for the Judiciary.
Jobreq:
•	Interest in finance and policy-making
•	Willing to conduct independent research
•	Good writing and presentation skills in English
•	Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025

Jobtitle: [Winter Internship] Multilateral Development Banks – A Comparative Study
Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The International Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
The intern will be responsible for conducting a comparative study of:

1.	The key strategies and policies of selected MDBs (e.g. key differences, effectiveness, reach in the region and beyond); and  

2.	Their performance and effectiveness in delivering their objectives, specifically in the following areas:
•	Deal flows through Singapore and/or involving Singapore companies.
•	Projects related to climate financing, green transitions.

*MDBs refer to inter-governmental financial institutions such as the World Bank, Asian Development Bank, Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, Inter-American Development Bank.
Jobreq:
•	Interest in international issues.  
•	Interest or academic background in sustainability related initiatives.
•	Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025

Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Economic Programmes Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
•	Research and international scan of job redesign and workforce transformation efforts
•	Assist with stock-take of Singapore’s landscape of jobs and skills measures
•	Support and exposure via team’s engagements (e.g. with other agencies/ external parties)
Jobreq:
•	Strong writing and analytical skills
•	Interest in social and economic policy
•	Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025

Jobdesc:
Applications to internship projects for MOF's Winter Internship Programme are now open.

The Land & Infrastructure Programmes Directorate is looking for suitable undergraduates to take on their internship project.
Jobres:
The project supports LIP’s work with MSE and MOT in two areas, looking at food and tax resilience. The intern will deliver:
 
1. A summary of research on global biofuel standards and related taxation policies, with a deep dive on selected jurisdictions to inform how Singapore can adapt as the world transits to greener fuels. 
 
2. Research on the potential and implications of insects and other alternative proteins as food for Singapore and provide some policy recommendations in terms of funding and resourcing needs for scaling up and mainstreaming.
Jobreq:
Experience doing research papers and using relevant tools (e.g. Google Scholar)

Able to commit for 4-5 weeks between Dec 2024 to Jan 2025.

Agncy: Ministry of Digital Development and Information
Jobtitle: Assistant Director / Senior Manager / Manager (Digital Economy Office)
Jobdesc:
The Ministry of Digital Development and Information’s (MDDI) mission is to create the conditions for a thriving digital future for businesses and citizens. At the Digital Economy Office (DEO), we carry out this mandate through policies and funding that enable innovative and sustainable growth in the digital economy, to benefit businesses and the workforce. Infrastructure and regulations are also levers to enable opportunity and ensure a fair and resilient playing field, so that we fully and safely harness the potential of emerging technologies. 

We are looking for dynamic, purpose-driven individuals with a passion for technology, and who appreciate how Government is an advocate and enabler for long-term growth. We want people who have a vision for what technology can do and can effectively communicate this both verbally and in writing. We are also looking for collaborative problem solvers that thrive in complex and fast-moving environments. 

In addition to industry partners – such as innovators, investors, tech companies and key associations – we work closely with the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), Cybersecurity Agency (CSA), Smart Nation and Digital Government Office (SNDGO), Government Technology Agency (GovTech), the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI), and Digital Industries Singapore (DISG) as well as other Whole-of-Government stakeholders.

You will be responsible for formulating and implementing policies to improve the retirement adequacy of Singaporeans through the CPF (Central Provident Fund) system, which includes exercising the Ministry’s oversight of the CPF Board.
Jobres:
• Drive and organize the national retirement adequacy agenda, which includes policy development and reviews in the following areas: 
i) Retirement adequacy goals
ii) CPF contribution rates
iii) Collection and withdrawal of CPF savings 
iv) Schemes to grow CPF savings
v) Retirement payouts through CPF LIFE
• Partner with MOF, MND and MOH and other stakeholders to balance the use of CPF for retirement, housing and healthcare needs. 
• Oversee the smooth implementation of CPF policies to achieve the policy intent and ensure that the right messages are publicly communicated.
• Engage decision-makers and key stakeholders to maintain a strong national narrative on the importance of retirement adequacy.
• Consult industry unions and the public in the course of policy development and implementation.
• Proactively engage in public communications through media platforms and third-party multipliers to promote awareness and understanding of CPF policies.
• Maintain oversight of how policies are executed through the CPF system, and ensure that the legal, financial and reputational risks to the Government are properly managed.
Jobreq:
• At least 15 years of experience, preferably in policy-related work in the public sector with supervisory experience 
• Be meticulous, precise and organised
• Good political and financial acumen and possess understanding of financial instruments
• Strong analytical and communication skills
• Able to build good rapport with various partners and stakeholders and discuss issues with confidence directly and independently with Minister and other top management on a regular basis

Jobdesc:
As Assistant Director / Lead Operations of the Communicable Diseases Agency set up by the Ministry of Health (MOH), you will support Dy Heads in the development and management of the operational functions of the Communicable Diseases Agency (CDA).

The CDA is a new government agency that is being established by the Ministry of Health (MOH) to oversee Singapore’s communicable disease preparedness, prevention and control, surveillance, risk assessment and outbreak response. The CDA PO’s role is to plan and execute the setup of the CDA, which will consolidate and build on the public health functions under MOH, the National Centre for Infectious Diseases, and the Health Promotion Board.   

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that will require you to manage multiple stakeholders and priorities concurrently.
Jobres:
You will play a key role in the Operations team in CDA. Your key responsibilities include the following:

Job responsibilities

Ops Planning, Resources and Capability Development:  
o	Lead in the design, development and coordination of operational drawer plans with internal and external stakeholders, as part of surge and activation under CDA. This includes working with stakeholders to derive the operational considerations and planning parameters for CDA operations.
o	Lead in the development of strategic operational resources and budgetary considerations, as well as ensuring that logistical planning is carefully considered with respect to operational plans. This includes vendor, resource, procurement and contract management.
o	Lead in the development of CDA operational capabilities framework and plans (resources, system, training, personnel, and equipping) in response to crisis and business continuity requirements. This includes performing capability gaps analysis, operationalizing knowledge management and developing key performance indicators to measure operational effectiveness.  

Ops Readiness, Response and Monitoring:
o	Lead in the development of overall operational readiness plans in terms of resource, personnel and activities during an outbreak/ crisis response. This includes developing metrics to assess the CDA operational readiness, developing training objectives and developing business continuity plans. 
o	Lead in the development, operationalisation and review of CDA incident management and reporting framework. This includes monitoring and sense making through dashboards, activating agency level meetings to manage incidents, and performing ops-tech integration to support decision making.  
o	Lead in the development, operationalisation and review of plans on the mobilisation of resources for ops response to support CDA operations. This includes working with stakeholders on Border Health operations, operationalising ground response plans, and act as the lead for disease outbreak at the agency level. 

Administration: 
o	Lead and manage secretariat functions for meetings. 
o	Lead in the administration and monitoring of budgetary votes for Operations Division. 
o	On rotation to supervise 24/7 duty officers on phone calls for urgent disease/ incident notifications and management.
Jobreq:
Job Requirements
•	Minimum tertiary qualifications in business administration, management or a related field.
•	Minimum 5 years work experience in Public Health / Operations / Civil Service would be an advantage. 
•	Proven leadership skills and ability to inspire others.
•	Demonstrated experience to work effectively in a team, lead cross-functional teams and drive initiatives.
•	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to frame issues, translate data and insights into operational plans and ground actions.
•	Proficient in integrating operational planning/ management with public health requirements.
•	Ability to work under pressure and simultaneously on different projects/ tasks.
•	Strong stakeholder management, inter-personal and communication skills.
•	Willing to continuous learn and keep up-to-date on new developments in the operational/ communicable diseases field.
•	Willing to work beyond office hours, including weekends and public holidays, if necessary.
As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobdesc: Scientist (Centre for Urban Sustainability)
Jobres:
We are looking for a highly motivated and results-oriented candidate to take on the position of Scientist to initiate novel and ground-breaking research in advanced materials for the built environment. The areas of research include and are not limited to:

• 3D printable green cementitious composites
• Sustainable and strategic building materials from recycled materials
• Carbon capture, utilization and storage (CCUS) in advanced low-carbon building materials.

Responsibilities:

• Perform applied research and development (R&D) work in the area of material synthesis, characterization and evaluation.
• Apply scientific principles in laboratory experiments, tests; undertake data collection to ensure data integrity, quality control and protocol compliance.
• Work closely with team lead and members to apply good engineering practices; develop industry-leading technologies to ensure project deliverables are dutifully achieved.
• Assist in conducting workshops, seminars, and events involving internal parties as well as external parties such as small and medium-sized enterprises, aligned with required project deliverables and key performance indicators.
• Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to conceptualise, design and prepare strategic research proposals within CUS’ focus area for national and/or industrial grant applications.
• Perform administrative and procurement job-related duties as assigned.
• Co-supervise and support students working on industry, community and and/or consultancy projects.
Jobreq:
• Qualification in Materials Science, Chemical, Civil, Environmental and Mechanical Engineering or related disciplines.
• 3 or more years of working experience in Science, Engineering or discipline related to technology management.
• Strong analytical, interpersonal, communication and consensus-building skills across different disciplines, cultures and organisational levels.
• Proven track record and capability in development, management and successful completion of projects within stipulated timelines.
• Ability to work in a team to meet tight schedules.
• Possess passion and genuine interest in sustainable material development and additive manufacturing technologies (e.g. 3D printing by gantry printer, automation & robotic arms).
• Good command of English Language; strong interpersonal, written and communication skills; confident in collaborative works with industry partner.
• Demonstrate good problem-solving, evaluative and judgment skills based on sound analysis and application of technical knowledge and skills through gained experience.

Jobdesc: Lecturer (Veterinary Technology)
Jobres:
The successful candidate will primarily be responsible for the development and delivering of Continuing Education and Training (CET) and Pre-Employment Training (PET) programmes in the areas of animal care, and veterinary technology.

• Develop and conduct lectures, tutorials, and practicals in full-time and part-time courses
• Manage and perform day-to-day operations at TP Animal Clinic and Wellness (TPACW) on a rotating schedule (note: on-the-job training will be provided to new hires without clinical training with companion animals)
• Train and supervise student trainees at TPACW
• Conduct and facilitate student-industry collaboration projects
• Carry out administrative duties to support academic and clinic operations
• Able to work at least 1 evening/week for CET night classes during semester time
• Mentor students in character development and career readiness
• Provide pastoral care for students
Jobreq:
• Qualification in Biomedical Science/ Life Sciences/ Veterinary Technology/ Veterinary Nursing or its equivalent from recognised institution
• At least 3-5 years of relevant industrial experience in a veterinary related industry (e.g. animal research facilities, animal clinics/ hospitals)
• Have a passion for developing talents, and genuine interest to share knowledge and interact with youths and adult learners
• Keen to be involved in applied research/industry projects
• Resourceful and able to work independently to meet deadlines and perform well under pressure
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Demonstrated capacity to work within a team

Jobdesc: Manager/Senior Manager (Centre for Transcultural Studies)
Jobres:
• Oversee all academic operations for all subjects under IR/CTS
• Represent and coordinate with schools, academic centres and Academic Affairs Department on operational matters
• Prepare data, projections, reports and recommendations for Head/CTS or D/IR
• Oversee TPFUN subject Sustainability & Climate Action, subject leaders and teaching team
• Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to fulfill the Sustainability Interest Group’s mission (SUSTIG) to develop students as sustainability leaders
• Establish academic and industry network in the area of sustainability and collaborate on projects. Projects include industry research and project, overseas trip, students’ competition, conference.
• Set employees’ workplan, performance and development goals and conduct performance reviews
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification or experience in sustainability
• At least 10 years of experience as an educator in an Institute of Higher Learning
• Experience in leadership position managing a team of educators

Jobtitle: Manager / Senior Manager, Marketing & Audience Development
Jobdesc:
NAC's Marketing & Audience Development department advocates and amplifies the value and importance of the arts through various communications efforts. You will work closely with the whole of the Council and its parent Ministry to provide strategic counsel and support in the areas of marketing communications, to highlight the Council’s role as champion of the arts. You will also work with departments within the Council, and with external stakeholders to initiate, implement and manage marketing communications initiatives which are aligned with NAC’s mission, vision and strategic thrusts.

Principal Accountabilities:

  • Lead integrated marketing campaigns to support NAC’s branding, marketing, and audience development objectives.

  • Lead the day-to-day management of NAC digital touchpoints such as its social media channels, corporate website and EDM platforms. Analyse digital marketing metrics to identify trends and insights required to formulate a robust content calendar.

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners to optimise NAC’s social media platforms with the objectives to expand reach and deepen engagement across various audiences.  This includes the tailoring, planning and implementation of social plans to meet NAC's strategic needs. 

  • Partner with NAC’s Technology and Innovation team to ensure that NAC’s corporate website is compliant to IM8 and aligned to Government’s Digital Service Standards.

Requirement

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, digital media or a related field

  • 2 to 6 years of relevant work experience in marketing or digital marketing.  Hands-on experience and/or expertise in the latest digital technologies and techniques managing websites and content management systems (CMS) is desirable

  • Functional knowledge of HTML, CSS, or JavaScript is advantageous to effectively manage NAC corporate website and EDM platforms

  • Proven success with SEO, social media, and email marketing strategies.

  • Excellent data and metric analysis abilities.

  • Strong interpersonal skills and a good team player

  • Knowledgeable and passionate about local arts and culture

  • Strong organisational, project management and management skills

  • Applicants who require work passes need not apply

Jobtitle: Deputy Director/Assistant Director, Consumer Issues Division (contract)
Jobdesc:
[What the role is]
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.

[What you will working on]

The role will involve consumer engagement work including financial education and complaints handling.

For financial education, you will be running initiatives for MoneySense, Singapore’s national financial education programme. This entails collaborating with industry partners and other government agencies to develop and implement financial education initiatives and communication strategies. Responsibilities include running campaigns and events such as webinars/seminars for the public, and content development for website and social media channels. You will also provide secretariat support to inter-agency committees on financial education initiatives.   

On complaints handling, you will engage consumers on their complaints or feedback on financial institutions and practices in the financial industry. Besides identifying key issues raised by consumers, you will work with supervisory departments to craft clear and empathetic replies that addresses consumer concerns. You will also liaise with financial institutions to ensure that they review and reply to consumers’ feedback, and submit timely updates to MAS.


 

[What we are looking for]

  • Good analytical skills and understanding of consumer engagement and financial behaviour

  • Good knowledge of or keen interest in financial products and services

  • Experience in financial education (e.g. running outreach events and educational campaigns) or content development and managing of website and social media channels (e.g Instagram and TikTok) 

  • Keen interest in public service

  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communications skills

  • Self-motivated, resourceful and able to work independently

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. This is a Contract position.

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: Deputy Director, Community and Partnerships for Learning
Jobdesc:
The Deputy Director, Community and Partnerships for Learning leads a team in planning, strategizing, identifying and implementing learning provisions such as courses via analysis of sector needs and supply, leading to partnership work, collaborations, client leads as well as marketing to promote uptake. The overall mandate is to improve the capability and capacity of social service professionals in serving the needs of the sector, while keeping SSI continually relevant and responsive.

You will seek out and work closely with external stakeholders on three fronts:
- Government bodies (e.g. Ministries, SkillsFuture Singapore)
- Social Service Agencies – to find suitable partners, and to promote SSI’s learning provisions
- Training Providers – to find suitable partners to fill the training needs of the sector

You will also work closely with the following internal stakeholders:
- SSI’s Learning and Professional Development team - to align development of new learning provisions, based on sector training needs and supply data
- SSI’s Programme and Learning Services team – to guide operations for launching of courses
- SSI’s Quality Assurance and Evaluation team – to review learner and organisational feedback to ensure high-quality collaborations and partnerships
- NCSS Divisions – to support capability development initiatives in areas such as digitalisation, people practice and volunteer management
Jobres:
• Develop partnership strategy for SSI to meet existing and emerging training needs of social service professionals (SSPs)
• Develop and maintain Analysis framework (based on the ADDIE model) for SSI, ensuring its learning provisions are relevant
• Business development and marketing efforts of SSI’s courses
• Stakeholder management, community outreach and working across teams, within NCSS, across MSF and the sector at large, and with other training providers
• Lead and guide a team of 8 to 9 staff across different functions such as business development, account servicing, contracting, social learning, data analytics and marketing
• Plan, manage and monitor manpower resources, project timelines and budget utilisation for the team
• Report team progress and KPIs at SSI management meetings every quarter
Jobreq:
Personal Competencies:
• Good interpersonal and communication skills
• Networking and collaboration skills
• Good writing and presentation skills
• Negotiation and persuasion skills
• Attention to detail
• Research and strategic analysis
• People management skills
• Outcome-focused

Skills & Knowledge:
• Training business models and operations
• Training business intelligence and strategy
• Relationship management
• Business Model and Pricing
• Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially Microsoft Excel and preferably Microsoft Power BI
• Data analysis skills
• Planning and project management skills
• SSI product knowledge

Experience:
• Possesses social service sector knowledge and/or experience
• Extensive networks in the social service and/or training spaces
• Has prior experience in or familiarity with CET landscape
• Managed a large team well for at least 5 years

Special Certification(s)
Advanced Certificate in Learning and Performance will be a bonus


Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) is the lead agency driving Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and public sector digital transformation. As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Smart City Technology, Digital Infrastructure, and Cybersecurity.

At GovTech, we offer you a purposeful career to make lives better. We empower our people to master their craft through continuous and robust learning and development opportunities all year round. Our GovTechies embody our Agile, Bold and Collaborative values to deliver impactful solutions.

GovTech aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do.

Play a part in Singapore’s vision to build a Smart Nation and embark on your meaningful journey to build tech for public good. Join us to advance our mission and shape your future with us today!

Learn more about GovTech at tech.gov.sg.

Who we are
The Responsible AI team, part of GovTech's Artificial Intelligence Tech Practice, seeks to develop technical capabilities to ensure AI systems are safe, trustworthy, and ethical. We aim to be at the forefront of the AI safety and responsible AI space through learning, experimentation, and iteration.

Our specific focus areas are (1) conducting safety testing of LLM/MLM systems and fairness assessments of high-impact AI systems, and (2) developing safety guardrails for government LLM/MLM systems, and (3) improving understanding of responsible AI across the public sector. We work closely with AI product teams to enable them to meet AI safety and responsible AI standards with ease.

What you will be working on

Data scientists in the Responsible AI team will focus on reading up on the latest developments in the AI safety and/or algorithmic fairness space, and experiment with new open-source tools or methods to raise the level of AI safety and fairness in the government’s AI systems. For algorithmic fairness specifically, you will conduct fairness assessments of high-impact government AI systems and propose how best to mitigate bias if any. Where necessary, you will also have the opportunity to finetune new models for safety alignment to support internal safety needs.

In addition, you will work closely with AI product teams and other public officers to help them understand responsible AI at a deeper level, and to help them adopt safety testing and guardrails into their own products.

To do this well, we collaborate with many technical partners, including the private sector, academic institutions, and international players. We also aim to share our expertise with the wider community, so you will have the chance to present our work and show how we are leading the way in LLM safety testing, guardrails, and fairness assessments.

Who we are looking for

  • Demonstrated experience with end-to-end data science projects, from scoping, development, deployment, and monitoring
  • Strong technical understanding of LLMs, especially how they work, how to do prompt engineering effectively, and how to build apps with them
  • Good understanding of key AI safety and/or algorithmic fairness concepts, especially in how to operationalise and apply them to AI systems
  • Competent in Python programming, with some familiarity of cloud deployments for ML models and LLMs
  • Strong interest in AI safety or responsible AI, especially given the need to read up independently on these areas and continuously explore and experiment
  • Self-motivated, thinks proactively and creatively about how to solve challenges
  • Desire to build tech for the public good

We also have a strong preference for any applicant with informal or formal experience with any of the work below:

  • Conducting LLM safety testing, including jailbreaking or prompt injections
  • Developing guardrails for LLMs or using equivalent tools (eg NeMo, LLM-Guard)
  • Developing fairness assessments for AI systems

Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. These include leave benefits to meet your work-life needs and employee wellness programmes. 

  

We champion flexible work arrangements (subject to your job role) and trust that you will manage your own time to deliver your best, wherever you are, and whatever works best for you. 

Learn more about life inside GovTech at go.gov.sg/GovTechCareers.

Stay connected with us on social media at go.gov.sg/ConnectWithGovTech.
