As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Smart City Technology, Digital Infrastructure, and Cybersecurity.

At GovTech, we offer you a purposeful career to make lives better. We empower our people to master their craft through continuous and robust learning and development opportunities all year round. Our GovTechies embody our Agile, Bold and Collaborative values to deliver impactful solutions.

GovTech aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do.

Play a part in Singapore’s vision to build a Smart Nation and embark on your meaningful journey to build tech for public good. Join us to advance our mission and shape your future with us today!

Learn more about GovTech at tech.gov.sg.

Who we are
The Responsible AI team, part of GovTech's Artificial Intelligence Tech Practice, seeks to develop technical capabilities to ensure AI systems are safe, trustworthy, and ethical. We aim to be at the forefront of the AI safety and responsible AI space through learning, experimentation, and iteration.

Our specific focus areas are (1) conducting safety testing of LLM/MLM systems and fairness assessments of high-impact AI systems, and (2) developing safety guardrails for government LLM/MLM systems, and (3) improving understanding of responsible AI across the public sector. We work closely with AI product teams to enable them to meet AI safety and responsible AI standards with ease.

What you will be working on:

AI Engineers in the Responsible AI team will focus on executing safety testing of LLM systems and to develop the corresponding safety guardrails. You will experiment with the latest open-source tools, develop your own, and apply them to real LLM products launched across the government. Where nece ssary, you will also have the opportunity to finetune new models for safety alignment to support internal safety needs.

In addition, you will work closely with AI product teams and other public officers to help them understand responsible AI at a deeper level, and to help them adopt safety testing and guardrails into their own products.

To do this well, we collaborate with many technical partners, including the private sector, academic institutions, and international players. We also aim to share our expertise with the wider community, so you will have the chance to present our work and show how we are leading the way in LLM safety testing and guardrails.

Who we are looking for

  • Strong backend programming skills in Python, especially in API development and ML performance optimisation
  • Demonstrated experience with cloud deployments, especially on AWS
  • Strong technical understanding of LLMs, especially how they work, how to do prompt engineering effectively, and how to build apps with them
  • Strong interest in AI safety or responsible AI, especially given the need to read up independently on these areas and continuously explore and experiment
  • Self-motivated, thinks proactively and creatively about how to solve challenges
  • Desire to build tech for the public good

We also have a strong preference for any applicant with informal or formal experience with any of the work below:

  • Conducting LLM safety testing, including jailbreaking or prompt injections
  • Developing guardrails for LLMs or using equivalent tools (eg NeMo, LLM-Guard)
  • Building and deploying performant LLM-based applications

Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. These include leave benefits to meet your work-life needs and employee wellness programmes. 

  

We champion flexible work arrangements (subject to your job role) and trust that you will manage your own time to deliver your best, wherever you are, and whatever works best for you. 

Learn more about life inside GovTech at go.gov.sg/GovTechCareers.

Stay connected with us on social media at go.gov.sg/ConnectWithGovTech.

The mission of Housing & Development Board (HDB) is to provide affordable, quality housing and a great living environment where communities thrive. To achieve its mission, HDB aims to be data-driven to the core and adopt evidence-based decision making in developing better housing policies service, improving service delivery and optimising operations.
Jobres:
As a data engineer, you will play a key part in helping HDB begin its journey to be data-driven to the core. In this role, you will assume the following responsibilities:
•	Create and maintain data architectures that meets the needs of HDB.
•	Build and maintain data platforms required for storage, extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
•	Improve discoverability and distribution of analytical data to data analysts and data scientists.
•	Implement best practices in data security throughout the lifecycle of analytical data.
Jobreq:
•	Background in Information Systems (IS), Computer Science or related field in a reputed institution.
•	3 years relevant experience in designing and maintaining data platforms such as data lakes, data warehouses and the associated data pipelines is preferred.
•	Proficient in creating and maintaining complex data pipelines using tools such as Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
•	Knowledge of data platforms such as Spark, Flink, Kafka, SQL and NoSQL databases, Airflow
•	Knowledge of the latest developments in data engineering and best practices in data management.
•	Knowledge of analytical tools is an advantage e.g., SAS Viya, Tableau, PowerBI, Amazon SageMaker, ArcGIS Pro
•	Knowledge in cloud computing, design and development is an advantage e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP
•	Knowledge of cloud technologies in data platforms is a plus e.g. Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse.
•	Strong project management and organization skills.
•	Possess an eagerness to learn and impart new skills.
•	Be a good team player.

Good to Have:
-	Great Attitude to bring the best out our team
-	Team Player; we work together as a team
-	Possess an eagerness to learn and impart new skills 
-	Autonomous & Take ownership

Fresh graduates are welcomed.

Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract in the first instance. Conversion to perm is dependent on good performance.

Find out more about a career with HDB at www.hdb.gov.sg/cs/infoweb/about-us/careers


All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: Intern - Data Analysis and Business Process Re-engineering
Jobdesc: Under the internship programme, you will be attached to the Lease Administration & Management Department (LAMD) in HDB’s Housing Management Group.
Jobres:
During your internship, you will be involved in streamlining the service delivery and operational efficiency of our products and services. Your tasks include the following:

(1) Identify and analyse transactions with high volume and develop targeted measures to reduce the volume; and

(2) Re-engineer business processes by:
- identifying operational risks/gaps and processes with similar workflows/services 
- work with relevant stakeholders to plan a framework to develop common IT services or resources that can be catered to the needs of the processes to improve operational productivity.

You may need to shadow and/or interview process owners and operational staff of identified transactions to better understand the workflows and pain points of staff or customers. 

The project may require a lot of data mining and cleaning up in order to be able to analyse the data critically and meaningfully. Having programming knowledge in R and being well-versed to deal with data will be an added advantage.
Jobreq:
Students pursuing degrees in Business Analytics and Data Analytics will be considered. Students who are willing to continue the internship on a part-time basis after school reopens (i.e. beyond Jan 2025) are preferred.

Please submit your resume, transcript and cover letter together with your application. We regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Jobdesc: As a Systems Analyst you are part of HDB’s IT Group to drive digital transformation. You will be part of an application development team that will leverage on innovation and technology to enable business excellence. You will have the opportunity to work closely with various stakeholders in HDB to manage, design and develop systems that support HDB’s wide spectrum of business domains.
Jobres: We will provide a career, not only a job.  Your total development as an ICT professional is our focus rather than just getting a job done. There will be ample opportunities to build on your competencies with the training and exposure that we have available in the many technical platforms and range of digitalization projects we have.
Jobreq:
- Understand HDB’s business processes and work with users to design and develop an end-to-end solution 
- Provide advice and assistance to business users in the effective use of application system and information technology 
- Manage the development of the application system and ensure the project is implemented within budget and according to schedule  
- Design solutions that are of quality and functional to ensure a good user experience 
- Monitors the performance of the application and work with relevant stakeholders to troubleshoot any issues surfaced in the production environment 
- Work closely with various technical, solution and information architects to ensure the application developed is robust and align with the Enterprise Architecture 
- Produce technical documentation for application systems. 
- Have a keen interest in IT / programming / system designs  
- Good understanding of SDLC  
- Experience in application development using the following technologies and programming languages such as Mobile, web, object-oriented programming, SQL, Java, JavaScript etc 

Good to Have:
-	Experience/knowledge in Scrum /DevOps concepts 
-	Experience/knowledge in the various technologies supporting CI/CD such as Git, Maven, Jenkins, etc 
-	Experience/Knowledge in Cloud, microservices architecture and container technologies such Docker, Kubernetes, etc  
-	Experience/Knowledge in Java, Javascript, SQL
-	Great Attitude to bring the best out our team, driven and motivated
-	Team Player; we work together as a team 
-	Autonomous & Take ownership


Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract in the first instance. Conversion to perm is dependent on good performance.

Jobdesc:
Overview of MOM:
At the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), we strive to build a Great Workforce and a Great Workplace. We work to achieve a globally competitive workforce and great workplace, for a cohesive society and a secure economic future for all Singaporeans. Our work transcends the boundaries of our desks – it takes us to real workplaces all over Singapore. We are continually on the lookout for individuals who want to make a difference and impact lives in the core areas of our work.
What the role is:
•
The role involves supporting and guiding departments with their procurement transactions. This includes managing the department’s stakeholders and undertaking early and close partnership of the end-to-end procurement process including contract management. In addition, the job holder is required to undertake work improvement projects and initiatives to strengthen risk governance.
Jobres:
What you will be working on:
•
Guide department users in Procurement with end-to-end solutions based on established guidelines and procedures.
•
Develop, revise and improve on work processes to improve overall efficiency of Procurement functions.
•
Ensure that the departments under her/his charge administer all procurement processes and procedures in accordance with the Instruction Manual on Procurement.
•
Work closely as a strategic business partner with project teams to prepare the necessary documents, provide guidance for the evaluation process and partner contract owners to monitor awarded vendor and contract performance.
•
Partner departments for holistic solutioning, including adopting and adapting to new technologies such as data analytics, artificial intelligence, etc.
•
Equip with effective stakeholder engagement, data-mining and strategic thinking skills, in addition to Procurement proficiency.
•
Any other tasks assigned by supervisor.
Jobreq:
What we are looking for:
•
Possess at least 3 years of relevant experience with handling construction related project tenders and/or revenue contracting would be an added advantage.
•
Possess tertiary qualifications in Procurement or Business Management preferred.
•
Possess a depth of knowledge and relevant experience in handling complex procurement matters.
•
A good knowledge of IM on Procurement and GeBIZ would be advantage.
•
Able to handle end users professionally, work independently and be efficient with a strong customer service mindset.
•
Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to multi-task to meet tight deadlines.
•
Possess an inquisitive mind, meticulous in details and a good team player.
•
Good written, communication, presentation and IT skills are essential.

Jobdesc: The mission of Housing & Development Board (HDB) is to provide affordable, quality housing and a great living environment where communities thrive. To achieve its mission, HDB aims to be data-driven to the core and adopt evidence-based decision making in developing better housing policies service, improving service delivery and optimising operations.
Jobres:
•	Engage business users to gather and evaluate requirements and use cases 
•	Turn requirements and use cases into system architectures and designs 
•	Assist user to translate requirements into functional and technical specifications 
•	Perform risk assessment with business users and provide guidance in terms of cybersecurity and sensor connectivity 
•	Lead the project alongside business users and vendors to ensure project delivery and sustainability. 
•	Develop and implement process to ensure smooth operation and security of IoT/OT devices and systems 
•	Perform system administration duties to manage and support highly available ICT infrastructure environment and related operations, which includes monitoring, configuration, maintenance, troubleshooting, system recoveries and periodic updates and patches of servers 
•	Provide technical leadership through innovation, research and evaluation of IoT technologies and solutions 

You are also required to keep abreast of the latest industry IT and IoT/OT trend, security practices and technologies as well as emerging threats and vulnerabilities and recommend appropriate controls for implementation to improve security.
Jobreq:
Recognised qualification in Computer Science or a relevant discipline. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. 
Preferably with knowledge and experience in some of the following areas: 
•	Connectivity such as 4G/5G, WiFi, LoRa, NB-IoT, Zigbee and Bluetooth 
•	IoT/OT protocols such as MQTT, Modbus, EtherNet/IP
•	IoT/OT device management 
•	IoT/OT security
•	Industrial Control Systems (ICS) & Supervisory Control, Data Acquisition (SCADA) Systems, Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) & Distributed Control Systems (DCS)
•	Operating systems such as Windows Server and Linux 
•	Networking technologies such as LAN,WAN, DNS and DHCP 
•	Cloud hosting environment in Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure 
•	Database schema design/development/management (SQL or NoSQL Database such as MongoDB 
•	IT security principles and IT/IoT/OT controls as well as industry best practices and frameworks

Good to Have:
-	Great Attitude to bring the best out our team
-	Team Player; we work together as a team 
-	Autonomous
-	Take ownership

Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract in the first instance. Conversion to perm is dependent on good performance.

Jobdesc: The Housing and Development Board (HDB) has been at the forefront of the Public Service Transformation effort, iteratively building towards the successful delivery of HDB’s services to our customers digitally. The Information Services Group in HDB champions this effort, developing customised IT solutions that affords HDB the flexibility and efficiency in serving its missions.
Jobres:
You will be in a pioneer team in HDB’s Information Services Group that seeks to embrace DevSecOps culture and practices for application development. With the goal of creating cross-functional teams that would be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of IT services, we aim to adopt a you-code-it, you-run-it approach to software product development and maintenance. The success of our endeavour will form the blueprint upon which all subsequent in-house DevSecOps teams can be modelled after.  

As a software engineer on this team, you will work with fellow developers, your Technical Lead, Product Owner and ScrumMaster in iteratively delivering IT solutions for both internal and external stakeholders of HDB. You will have the opportunity to be exposed to different aspects of software delivery, including solution design, CI/CD pipeline configurations, frontend and backend development, and test automation.
Jobreq:
-	2+ years frontend and/or backend software engineering experience in building scalable products, with a demonstrated ability in designing and building well-structured enterprise applications on commercial cloud:
o	Skilled in modern web application technology stack, such as React.js, FastAPI, Django, Spring, Amazon DynamoDB, PostgreSQL
o	Experienced in development and deployment on commercial cloud such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Microsoft Azure 
o	Experienced in containerisation technologies, such as Docker, AWS ECS and Kubernetes 
o	Has exposure to infrastructure provision tools, such as Terraform and Ansible 
o	Embraces the concept of DevSecOps and CI/CD, with experience in relevant CI technologies such as Git, Gitlab, and Jenkins
o	Understands the concept of Secure-By-Design Lifecycle for Agile and the utilisation of technologies for SAST and DAST
o	Practised Test-Driven Development with the utilisation of automated testing 

Good to Have:
-	Adaptability and thrives in dealing with uncertainties 
-	Can articulate software problems and proposed solutions clearly 
-	Thrives in working as a team, and embraces a team-first mentality 
-	Takes initiative, pride and ownership in work
-	Growth mindset

Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract in the first instance. Conversion to perm is dependent on good performance.

Find out more about a career with HDB at www.hdb.gov.sg/cs/infoweb/about-us/careers

Entry level applicants are welcomed to apply.

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: Senior Manager / Manager (Infrastructure Planning and Policy)
Jobdesc:
You will play a critical role in planning and formulating policies for developing public healthcare facilities, developing and implementing cost effective infrastructure solutions, managing budgetary projections and allocation to ensure quality public healthcare infrastructure in meeting Singapore’s healthcare needs. 

You will be working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.
Jobres:
You will be working with MOH Divisions and stakeholders to identify current and long-term healthcare needs, and work with other government agencies to plan and secure the necessary resources to develop public healthcare facilities to meet these needs. 

In this role, you will be involved in conceptualisation and planning of new public healthcare facilities, engaging stakeholders, and ensuring that resources are utilised effectively and efficiently.

In addition, you will drive budgeting, financial reporting and monitoring of budget utilisation for the division.
Jobreq:
Key Competencies Required:
•	Thinking Clearly & Making Sound Judgements – Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities to support the crafting of sound policy recommendations; ability to grasp timelines, operating context and ground realities.
•	Learning & Putting Skills into Action - Possesses the drive and curiosity to learn and apply new skills, knowledge and new ways of working. 
•	Improving & Innovating – Ability to seek continual improvements, and to innovate and experiment while managing the risks involved. 
•	Working Effectively with Stakeholders – Ability to mobilise and rally partners and stakeholders towards a collective purpose.
•	Positive, self-motivated, and high standard of integrity, able to work independently as well as in a team

•	Strong analytical, writing and interpersonal skills 
•	At least 2 years of working experience, prior working experience in the healthcare industry would be an added advantage

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, candidates may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Jobdesc: You are responsible for ensuring the effectiveness of safety systems for a formation by analysing the safety performance of all units.
Jobres: In addition, you will conduct audits on these units. Your challenge lies in working with and managing different stakeholders.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, with at least 6 years' relevant working experience in safety related fields. Possession of good communication skills is essential.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobdesc: You oversee the governance of defence exports and technology security which covers the strategy, policy and systems.
Jobres: You also drive the compliance plans and processes to safeguard MINDEF/SAF’s defence technology. Your challenge lies in maintaining effective and efficient controls amidst an evolving Tech-Sensitivity and geopolitical landscape while having a strategic view of Singapore’s export controls regime in order to position Singapore's defence industries to meet MINDEF/SAF requirements. You must be able to work with a diverse range of stakeholders and balance their views and input in the formulation of policy options for mutual benefits and interests.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, preferably in Engineering or in a Technical field, with at least 10 years’ work experience in the area of export controls and/or defence technology systems. Possession of good interpersonal and communication skills is required. You must also have strong analytical and planning abilities.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: [2025 H1 Term-time & Summer Term-time Internship] Low Code Software-as-a-Service
Jobdesc:
At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 

We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success. 

Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results. 

Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.

At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 

Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.
Jobres:
The Business Incubator and Accelerator Department supports the generation of innovative product concepts and business strategies through proficient cross-functional teams. The team also introduces essential components into the technology framework, enabling seamless operation and scalability for existing products and business models. Additionally, the team conducts enterprise upskilling initiatives to enhance operational intelligence and efficiency of the systems in CPF Board.

In this role, you will:  
• Collaborate on the development of Low Code Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solutions.
• Create Programming bots by designing, building, testing, and configuring automation workflows.
• Develop AI fabrics, prototypes, and proof of concepts to enhance intelligent process automation.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse skills and perspectives that each intern brings. While you may not need to meet every requirement fully, having some familiarity or budding expertise in the following areas will help you make the most of this opportunity and succeed with our team. 
• Demonstrate enthusiasm for intelligent process automation and eagerness to contribute to innovative solutions.
• Willingness to learn and engage in the complete software development life cycle, from concept to deployment.
• Strong analytical skills and flexibility to adapt to evolving project requirements and technological changes.

Position is on a full-time internship basis from Jan to Aug 2025. 

What you can expect
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding internship in a workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you during your internship with CPF Board:   
• Learning Opportunities: Engage in impactful projects that allow you to apply theoretical concepts to real-world challenges, helping you gain valuable insights and practical experience along the way.
• Mentorship Guidance:  Boost your internship experience with guidance from experienced mentors and supportive peers committed to fostering your growth and helping you thrive.
• Gain Dynamic Exposure: Gain dynamic exposure, drive innovative solutions, and advance your career through involvement in strategic national projects.
• Expand Your Network: Forge meaningful relationships and expand your professional circle within the public service sector through curated intern activities and networking events.

Jobdesc: Customer Service Executive - You work in a call centre environment.
Jobres:
•	Handle enquiries from the public through the Branch Service Line (HDB’s hotline) with professionalism. The enquiries can be on lease administration, housing maintenance, finance and car park matters.
•	Promote, educate and guide callers on the use of HDB’s e-Services 
•	Provide case-specific advice and quality customer service to customers over the phone
•	Keep abreast with latest policies and procedures so as to provide accurate information to customers
•	Resolve customer’s queries effectively and escalate problems promptly
•	Work as a team to ensure that call centre service KPIs are met
•	Any other tasks assigned
Jobreq:
You should 
•	Possess effective telecommunication & strong customer service skills
•	Have a passion to deliver customer-centric service 
•	Proficient in English and another language
•	Can size up customers’ enquiries accurately and document them quickly in the system 
•	Can handle stressful situations appropriately 
•	Be meticulous and independent
•	Experience in customer service or call centre will have an added advantage 

Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract. 

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc:
The Information Programme Centre at DSTA develops cutting-edge software solutions to harness information that empower the SAF to fight smarter and faster on the battlefield.

We are seeking motivated and innovative individuals to join our team in developing data driven applications in the military intelligence domain. As a key member of the team, you will be responsible for building advanced image and signals analysis applications that provide early warning and real-time threat detection.
Jobres:
•	Solution Design: Translate complex use cases into robust solution designs and detailed technical specifications. 
•	Application Development: Develop and optimise applications for advanced image and signals analysis.
•	Continuous Improvement: Enhance and evolve software applications to provide a seamless user experience and support in achieving mission-critical objectives.
•	Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including those from the areas of infrastructure and cybersecurity, to ensure successful project delivery.
Jobreq:
Minimum Requirements
•	Degree in Computer Science or a related technical field such as Electrical Engineering.
•	Proficiency in software engineering with experience in Java, C++ or other object-oriented languages.
•	Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a team-oriented mindset.

Preferred Technical Skills
•	Proficiency in GIT source code management. 
•	Expertise in software design principles, including code modularity and maintainability. 
•	Experience in one or more of the following:
        -   Scripting languages (e.g. PowerShell)
        -   Containerisation technologies (e.g. Docker)
        -   Microservices architecture
        -   Stream processing technologies (e.g. Kafka)
        -   Geospatial technologies (e.g. Luciad and ESRI) 
        -   Applied Machine Learning for Computer Vision and/or Signal Processing

Why join us?

As a Software Engineer for Intelligence Analysis applications, you will have the creative freedom and technical autonomy to develop technologies that address real-world challenges. You will have the opportunity to take on the challenge of building algorithms that will help us understand potential adversaries to Singapore. The software that you develop will have a lasting impact on Singapore’s long term defence and security. At DSTA, you will work with modern tech stacks and benefit from the guidance of experienced mentors within the Information community, continuously growing your technical expertise.

Jobtitle: Careers & Leadership Development Executive (Competency & Leadership Developmen
Jobdesc:
ISD confronts and addresses threats to Singapore’s internal security and stability. For over 75 years, ISD and its predecessor organisations have played a central role in countering threats such as those posed by foreign subversive elements, spies, racial and religious extremists, and terrorists. A fulfilling and rewarding career awaits those who want to join in ISD’s critical mission of keeping Singapore safe, secure and sovereign for all Singaporeans.

As a Careers & Leadership Development Executive, you will help to drive, maintain and staff the competency development initiatives to ensure ISD has a skilled and competent workforce. You will also work with stakeholders to ensure competencies stay relevant.
Jobres: #NAME?
Jobreq:
- Degree in any discipline or equivalent competencies
- Minimum 3 years in HR work is preferred
- Experience in working with data
- Good written and verbal communication skills
- Good interpersonal skills
- Good team player
- Only Singaporeans need apply

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Jobtitle: Assistant Director, Youth Preventive Dental Service (Admin)
Jobdesc:
Looking for a job that actually makes a difference?
Join us at the Forefront of Shaping Healthier Lives

Overview
The Health Promotion Board’s vision is to make Singapore a nation of healthier people.
Come be a part of this journey if you’re passionate about creating boundary-pushing work that drives behavioral change.

You will be a part of HPB’s Youth Preventive Dental Service to support the Heads of Department of Student Dental Centre (SDC) and School Dental Service (SDS). He / She oversees the smooth functioning of the operations of School Dental Centre and the off-site school and mobile dental clinics, takes the lead to strengthen processes and procedures in key areas such as administration, finance, procurement, vendor management and customer service to achieve the delivery of effective, efficient and quality oral health care services to the school children.

What You Can Expect

As a key member of HPB’s Youth Preventive Dental Service, the key responsibilities include:

Operations Function

  • Ensure the licensing of SDC and 200 school and mobile dental clinics. Act as the liaison officer with the Ministry of Health regarding regulatory issues related to clinic licensing.
  • Lead initiatives in the strengthening of internal controls at SDC to ensure quality assurance
  • Identify and implement approaches to resolve operational inefficiencies to achieve greater productivity
  • Work closely with Strategic Operations team and other departments in YPS to drive alignment and consistency in approaches to optimise operation resources
  • Supervise clinic manager in the efficient daily operations of the SDC, to ensure quality service and customer satisfaction
  • Oversee the daily handling of clinic enquiries and feedbacks, manage or escalate complex cases to HOD
  • Drive the design and set up of the new SDC at Elective Care Centre (ECC)
  • Be the liaison officer with MOHH and the Architects and prepare funding papers to MOH to equip the new Centre
  • Assist HOD on staffing & operational needs
  • Assist Director in the planning, directing and co-ordinating of human resource issues

Administration & Procurement Functions

Manage YPDS Asset Management Portfolio

  • Oversee the Youth Preventive Dental Service’s Business Asset Tracking Specialists (BATS) to ensure assets are tracked and managed in a timely manner to ensure efficient operations at over 200 static and mobile dental clinics and the Student Dental Centre.
  • Review and implement appropriate system to track movement of assets and conduct periodic asset review
  • Co-ordinate with Strategic Operations team to ensure regular inventory audit of assets

Manage YPDS Procurement Portfolio

  • Prepare development papers for the upgrade or replacement of equipment, as well as for the implementation of new programmes in dental clinics.
  • Through adequate research and understanding of landscape, craft convincing proposals which includes funding and procurement to meet operational needs

Finance and Budget Management

  • Manage the Division’s budget paying close attention to capital and operating expenses
  • Perform the role of a Budget Manager:
    • Prepare annual budget and forecast expenditure for SDC and SDS
    • Prepare monthly financial reports of Division and the Departments
    • Be analytical and follow up on Budget failures
    • Initiate online budget amendment request
  • Perform the role of GR Officer:
    • Create receipt for assigned Cost Centre
    • Perform Goods Receipt in Workday for system to match the invoice against PO and Goods received for efficient payment
    • Run and view standard reports for assigned cost centres
    • Oversee the Department Workday Account Payable Data Entry Specialist (APDES)
  • Supervise and guide team in tracking and monitoring POs
  • Prepare Proposal Papers to review and revise the ‘Fees Table
  • Liaise with HPB Finance for its submission to MOH
  • Answer to queries from management and MOH in consultation with HOD of SDC

Team Management

  • Supervise about 3 administrative executives to provide effective and timely support to the daily function of SDC and SDS
  • Coach and develop direct reports and manage the team for continuous improvement and monitor progress
  • Identify and nurture potential team leaders

Be Part of the Team

Join us if you are a self-motivated individual with a strong desire to excel and has at least 12 years of working experience, preferably in operations management, finance and administration in a healthcare institution/agency. You should also possess:

  • A recognised degree qualification
  • Good analytical and strategic thinking skills
  • Good communication skills, verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Firm and decisive
Assistant Manager, Statistics and Analytics
Jobres: You will explore and manage rich data sets pertaining to the vehicle-related statistics in Singapore. You will leverage on digital tools and use data intelligently to analyse/deliver meaningful statistics to various stakeholders. These data-sets could be used to enhance business processes, provide insights for policy-making, and value-add via the publications/reports posted at LTA and OneMotoring websites. You will work closely with the leadership team and internal/external stakeholders to create value from quantitative datasets and analyse emerging trends. Managing a team, you will be responsible for the provision of accurate vehicle-related statistics and reports, managing raw statistics in optimal data generation, extraction and storage from a variety of data sources.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in any discipline, preferably in Economics. Mathematics, Data Science/Analytics, Business
• At least 2 years hands-on experience working on both relational and non-relational databases
• Possesses strong analytical skills, meticulous with ability to deep dive into datasets and analytics
• Good communicator with interpersonal skills to explain data representation and work with different internal business units and external stakeholders
• Proficient in Microsoft Office software suite, data management/presentation tools such as Hyperion, Power BI, IBM Query Management Facility and Tableau.
• Experience with robotic process automation tools such as UIPath will be an advantage.
• Self-directed learner with passion for continuous learning and improvement
• Able to work independently, manage team members and thrive in a fast-paced work environment

Jobtitle: [LTA-HR] MANAGER / DEPUTY MANAGER, HUMAN RESOURCE (BUSINESS PARTNER)
Jobdesc:
[What the role is]

MANAGER / DEPUTY MANAGER, HUMAN RESOURCE (BUSINESS PARTNER)

[What you will be working on]

You will be part of the team of HR business partners supporting specific business groups to develop and implement human resource programmes and services that are critical towards achieving the organisation's vision, mission and strategic thrusts. This position requires you to understand business needs and partner with the different group management staff to lead the overall HR strategy and provide strategic advisory services and solutions to support the business. Working together with the senior line management staff, you will implement HR initiatives and best practices that align with the business strategy; engaging them in the areas of recruitment, performance management, compensation, rewards and talent management and development. In addition, you may be assigned to other Centre of Excellence portfolio such as review of code of conduct matters including handling disciplinary cases as well as partnership with Union on management of industrial-relations matters.

[What you will be looking for]

• Tertiary qualification in any discipline, preferably with at least 4 years of HR business partnering experience
• Demonstrated skills in writing, communication and interpersonal relationships
• Demonstrated skills in analysis and critical thinking
• Demonstrated initiative, resourcefulness and drive to excel
• Independent, able to work in a team and highly self-motivated
• Those with more years of experience will be considered for more senior roles

Ranked top 20 most attractive employers in Singapore - The Straits Times Singapore's Best Employers 2024.

The role of an academic at the Singapore Maritime Academy is both challenging and deeply rewarding. We are seeking individuals who not only possess comprehensive knowledge and practical experience in the maritime industry but also demonstrate a genuine passion for nurturing and guiding students. As a lecturer, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of the maritime sector by developing curriculum, introducing new courses, and engaging in consultancy and applied research projects. Administrative duties related to teaching and contributing to strategic initiatives of the School/Institution are integral aspects of this role. Successful candidates will be expected to be resourceful, innovative, and possess excellent communication skills.

The candidate is expected to develop and teach for students from Diploma in Marine Engineering as well as students who are undergoing training to achieve Certificate of Competency.

[What you will be working on]

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct, review, and develop teaching and assessment materials, and facilitate learning for Pre-Employment Training (PET) and Continuing Education and Training (CET) students.
  • Ensure that new/existing teaching curriculum modules are aligned with the Standards of Training, Certification, and Watch-keeping (STCW) Convention and the practices of the maritime industry.
  • Collaborate with industry to enhance students’ learning through activities such as industry field trips, student-industry projects, internship programs, and overseas programs.
  • Serve as an advisory role to the Technical Executives to ensure equipment and training facilities are updated and operationally-ready for practical training sessions.
  • Serve as a consultant/expert/specialist in critical maritime domains and provide guidance and train staff in technical domain job scope.
  • Participate in Internal and External Quality Maritime Education and Training (QMET) audits to maintain and improve the quality of education.
  • Support polytechnic and school events, including education counselling, guidance, and outreach activities.

[What we are looking for]

Requirements

  • Holds the Marine Engineering Officer Class 1 Certificate of Competency issued by MPA or relevant authorities.
  • At least 6 years of working experience within the maritime industry.
  • Self-driven, independent, and possess readiness to work as a team.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment.
  • Passionate about education and possess a strong interest in teaching and mentoring students.
  • Demonstrates leadership and supervisory skills.
  • People-oriented individual with good interpersonal, written, and communication skills.

If you meet the above requirements and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply with your CV and cover letter.

Successful applicant will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

Closing Date: 1 October 2024

If you are shortlisted for the position, you should hear from us within 30 days of the closing date of the advertisement.

IMDA is seeking a creative and dynamic Manager to join our Strategic Communications and Branding team. In this role, you will need to demonstrate strong skills in writing, editing, presentation, listening, and storytelling, as well as creativity, strategic thinking, problem-solving, and project management. You will also need to be able to adapt to changing situations and audiences and collaborate with different departments and teams to ensure consistent and coherent messaging across the organisation.

Responsibilities

Corporate Communication:

  • Develop and execute strategic communication and narratives, including IMDA's Message House, to convey key messages across all communication touchpoints.
  • Oversee all aspects of media relations and engagement to position IMDA as the Architect of Singapore's Digital Future.
  • Develop and manage C-Suite communication channels to grow mindshare of IMDA initiatives, programmes and policies on a daily basis, including management of third-party agencies as needed.
  • Provide support in the Crisis Management Strategy and immediate response plans to mitigate reputational risks.
  • Collaborate with various teams to harmonise plans and messaging with intended audiences from strategic lens  
  • Coordinate efforts with other agencies, ministries, where required

Brand Strategy and Management:

  • Manage Brand Research initiatives and utilise findings to develop brand strategy and architecture for IMDA's main and sub-brands.
  • Translate brand strategy into compelling narratives, visuals, and employer branding plans.
  • Ensure consistent application of brand strategy across all touchpoints to present a unified and compelling brand presence.

Requirements

  • 5-8 years of relevant experience in Public Relations/Government Comms/Public Affairs/Journalism.
  • Strong creative writing and presentation skills; adept at managing senior stakeholders for public engagements.
  • Ability to understand business units’ needs and translate them into impactful strategic communications plans.
  • Proficiency in managing third-party agencies/vendors/suppliers.
  • Prior experience working with and pitching to journalists across media channels would be an advantage.

#LI-IT2
Manager, Corporate Finance
Jobres:
You will be part of the Corporate Finance (CF) Division in LTA Finance Group which ensures provision of sound credit evaluation and other relevant financial analyses to LTA’s users and management for decision making, optimisation of returns on LTA’s cash balances and surplus funds, effective management of foreign exchange risks and issuance of bonds to meet LTA’s financing objectives.

Your main role will be to lead one of the Treasury teams on the essential operations that drive our key functions encompassing aspects such as cash management, foreign exchange hedging and investment operations.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

a) Lead the team in delivering the implementation and periodic review of the investment approach for LTA’s reserves to optimise risk-adjusted returns.
b) Establish effective governance and processes in the management of LTA’s liquidity needs.
c) Oversee LTA’s exposures to foreign exchange risks to limit the variability of the Singapore Dollar equivalent cost of foreign currencies denominated contractual payments.
d) Contribute to the development and implementation of effective governance through instituting effective financial policies and internal controls.
e) Work closely with the relevant stakeholders on continuous improvement projects, which may include whole-of-government systems or workstreams initiated by MOF/AGD.
f) Guide the team in financial reporting activities and audit matters related to CF-Treasury.
g) Plan for and nurture staff development and instil team pride in the delivery of outcomes.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in Accountancy (or member of a recognized body of professional accountants with relevant professional accounting qualification), Business, Finance, Economics or other relevant discipline.
• At least 7 years of relevant working experience (preferably with 2 years in supervisory role).
• Strong problem-solving skills, independent and resourceful.
• Meticulous and proficient in minimally Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word.
• Keen and/or experience in adopting tools to automate, digitise or improve processes.
• Possess good knowledge of public sector finance policies and procedures, Statutory Board - Financial Reporting Standards and hands-on experience in SAP financial system will be advantageous.
• Good interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to interact across different stakeholder groups and seniority levels.

Jobtitle: [LTA-IDE] PRINCIPAL/ SENIOR ENGINEER, ROAD DESIGN & INFRA ANALYTICS (CIVIL)
Jobdesc: PRINCIPAL/ SENIOR ENGINEER, ROAD DESIGN & INFRASTRUCTURE ANALYTICS (CIVIL)
Jobres:
Many opportunities and challenges await you if you are keen on an exciting career to realise our commitment to envision and implement an integrated transport system.

You will be part of a multi-disciplinary team that spearheads the planning and design development of road and commuter infrastructure projects to enhance the travel experience of commuters, motorists, cyclists and active mobility users. To achieve our vision of a car-lite nation and support the national economy, you will have the opportunity to redefine our users’ travel experience through the design development and implementation of road infrastructure projects including transit priority corridors.

You will interact with various agencies while conducting feasibility studies and hone your creativity and design thinking skills when conceptualising and designing user-centric road and commuter infrastructure schemes using 3D software and state-of-the-art technology. You will be involved in preparing tender drawings and specifications as well as providing technical design support during the project implementation stage. Opportunities to develop infra data analytics skills and review engineering standards and design guidelines also await you.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in civil & structural engineering or equivalent
• At least 5 years of relevant working experience in civil engineering projects
• Experience in planning, design, coordination and management of transport infrastructure projects will be preferred
• Experience in coordination of utilities laying and diversion will be viewed favourably
• Team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
• Candidates with strong relevant years of experience in road infrastructure projects will be considered for more senior role

Jobdesc:
[What the role is]

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) is the lead agency driving Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and public sector digital transformation. As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Smart City Technology, Digital Infrastructure, and Cybersecurity.

At GovTech, we offer you a purposeful career to make lives better. We empower our people to master their craft through continuous and robust learning and development opportunities all year round. Our GovTechies embody our Agile, Bold and Collaborative values to deliver impactful solutions.

GovTech aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do.

Play a part in Singapore’s vision to build a Smart Nation and embark on your meaningful journey to build tech for public good. Join us to advance our mission and shape your future with us today!

Learn more about GovTech at tech.gov.sg.

Digital transformation within the public sector is at the heart of what GovTech (Government Technology Agency of Singapore) does. We harness the best info-communications technologies to make a difference to the everyday lives of people in Singapore (about GovTech) 

GovTech is seeking an engineering manager to work on technically challenging problems in an environment running like a modern product company, solving important underserved problems in the public sector. Some of the problems are related to different programs including healthcare, manpower transformation, trade facilitation and national development. 

What you will be working on: 

As an Engineering Manager / Lead Software Engineer, you will be responsible for technical direction and processes in one (or more) teams. Additionally, you will drive the design, implementation & delivery of one or more products owned by your team. 

Your responsibilities will include: 

  • Defining your team’s engineering vision, strategy, and directions that align with the organization’s overall vision and goals. 

  • Partnering with stakeholders and agencies to prioritize and manage roadmaps for delivering towards product vision incrementally and efficiently. 

  • Creating a long-term technical plan and roadmap for the assigned team, and for other teams as needed. Update the roadmap regularly to meet future product/business needs and infrastructure requirements. 

  • Work regularly with engineers to engage in conversations regarding their performance, professional growth, offering constructive feedback, mentoring, and guidance as needed. 

  • Working with cross-functional partners to develop quality, reliability, and security strategies within your team. 

  • Proactively identifying and initiating worthwhile engineering initiatives to maximize our impact on the public good. 

  • Establishing practices and tools to encourage a strong engineering culture and maximize engineering effectiveness and impact. 

  • Helping with recruitment, particularly for more senior hires. 

 

What we are looking for: 

  • Experience working on reasonably large, high-availability software systems that have operated at scale. 

  • Experience in modern full-stack web application technologies; experience in modern front-end engineering like Next.Js/React.js and Java/TypeScript on the backend is preferred. 

  • Have a strong sense of what it means to be a technical leader, particularly as it relates to the suite of soft skills beyond just your technical chops. 

  • Passion towards engineering excellence; you deeply understand that software engineering is a team sport, and you take pride in the craftsmanship aspect of software engineering. 

  • Passion towards working for public good with interest. 

  • The ability to guide a team to achieve important goals together. 

  • 2+ years of experience coaching developers; helping them enhance their performance and grow their careers. 

What we offer you: 

GovTech is an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive workplace that values diverse voices and perspectives, as we believe that diversity is the foundation to innovation.   Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. These include leave benefits to meet your work-life needs and employee wellness programs.  

We champion flexible work arrangements (subject to your job role) and trust that you will manage your own time to deliver your best, wherever you are, and whatever works best for you.  

Learn more about life inside GovTech at go.gov.sg/GovTechCareers. 

Stay connected with us on social media at go.gov.sg/ConnectWithGovTech.

Jobtitle: Assistant Director, Professional Services Programme Office
Jobdesc:
About the Professional Services Programme Office (PSPO):

The PSPO is an inter-agency office set up by the Ministry of Law (MinLaw), Economic Development Board (EDB), Ministry of Finance (MOF) and Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). This team is charged with the following mandate: 

a)	Developing the industry strategies for the professional services sector, with specific focus on uncovering opportunities in the more niche and/or high-growth areas within the legal, accounting and financial services sub-sectors (e.g. sustainability, Web 3.0, Mergers & Acquisitions (“M&A”), etc). 

b)	Supporting efforts to position Singapore as the leading international legal services hub. As an industry-facing team, PSPO regularly engages and works with law firms and other industry stakeholders to support their growth within the local and regional ecosystem, and also co-shapes policies to help sharpen Singapore’s competitiveness as the legal services hub.
Jobres:
As part of an inter-agency office, you will be exposed to a diverse range of work and have the opportunity to work with various internal (government agencies, such as EDB, MinLaw, MOF, MAS, EnterpriseSG, ACRA, etc) and external (firms) stakeholders. At PSPO, you will be immersed in a fast-paced work environment, and are expected to be resourceful and independent in undertaking the following types of work: 

a)	Industry engagement & strategy development. Develop the house view and/or industry strategy playbook for the specific growth area(s), which can be at the professional services sector-level or sub-sector level (e.g. legal). Depending on the growth area, your work may involve: consulting with various internal and external stakeholders to elicit feedback and suggestions, conducting gap and data analysis, and using that to inform government interventions that may be required to address the gaps. 

b)	Securing mindshare through presentations. You may be required to present your research, analysis and recommendations at various governmental platforms to secure mindshare from senior management, and/or at external platforms where necessary. You may also be required to work with the relevant government agencies to translate such strategy into downstream initiatives and action. In addition, there will be opportunity to partner and co-develop industry-level solutions with industry and/or other government agency stakeholders to address transformation and capability development needs of the professional services sectors.

c)	Support for events and meetings attended by senior management / political office holders. You will have the opportunity to support specific events attended by senior management or POHs that are relevant to PSPO’s work. 

The PSPO team is based in the EDB office, and the team undertakes a hybrid work model.
Jobreq:
*Key Competencies*

•	[Systems Thinking]: Connect issues with larger system and identify inter-dependencies across issues/ domains/ agencies
•	[Deep Critical Thinking]: Distil critical issues and sense-make from a wide range of information, arriving at effective policy solutions
•	[Clear and Concise Writing]: Crystalise core issues via clear and concise writing


*Work Experience/Personal Traits*

•	At least 5 years of working experience in the professional services sector or held roles involving industry, strategy and policy development
•	Strong written and oral communication and analytical skills 
•	Ability to conduct in-depth analysis of complex issues and put forth actionable solutions
•	Self-starter and positive attitude, excellent work ethic and a team player
•	Prior consulting experience and an understanding of the professional and financial services sectors would be an advantage


We regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.




#LI-SW1

Jobdesc:
The CDA is a new government agency that is being established by the Ministry of Health (MOH) to oversee Singapore’s communicable disease preparedness, prevention and control, surveillance, risk assessment and outbreak response. It will consolidate and build on the public health functions under MOH, the National Centre for Infectious Diseases, and the Health Promotion Board. 

 As Assistant Director in Strategic Planning Division (SPD), you will support Head and Deputy Head SPD in the development of our strategic planning approach and organisational strategy; and implement the organisational strategy to achieve its mission and outcomes. He / She will support the senior management in actualising the organisational goals and priorities, including implementation of processes, optimising resources and measuring the organisation’s performance to achieve desired goals. The job holder is required to work closely with multiple internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment of CDA’s direction and intent.
Jobres:
Responsibilities 

- Drive the development of actionable plans to achieve strategic objectives and monitor progress towards goals. 

- Collaborate with senior leadership to define strategic priorities and initiatives and measure Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure progress. 

- Provide strategic guidance and support to other division leads in aligning their initiatives with the overall organisational strategy. 

- Oversee the maintenance of a robust performance management framework to track and report on strategic initiatives. 

- Working with the Board of Directors (BOD) to leverage their expertise for governance in the areas of Human Resources, Finance, and Risk Management and other areas that would accelerate the development and growth of CDA.  

- Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to inform strategic decision-making.
Jobreq:
Qualifications 

- Bachelor's degree in business administration, management, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Tertiary qualification in public health would be appreciated. 

- Proven track record of at least 5 years in strategic planning, organisational strategy, or a related field, with at least 3 years in a leadership role. 

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data and insights into actionable strategies. 

- Demonstrated experience in leading cross-functional teams. 

- Proficiency in strategic planning tools and methodologies. 

- Familiarity with performance management and measurement techniques. 

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels. 

- Experience in working with an organisation’s Board of Directors preferred.

Jobtitle: [2025 H1 Term-time + Summer Internship] HR Information Systems Intern
Jobdesc:
At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 

We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success. 

Collaboration is our way of life. We believe in the power of effective partnerships and seamless communications across teams. Together, we amplify each other’s strengths and achieve remarkable results. 

Our learning never stops. We encourage your inquisitiveness and courage to embrace new challenges head-on. Your agility, readiness to challenge conventions, embrace of data-driven strategies, dedication to learning and applying new skills fuels our innovation and progress.

At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 

Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.
Jobres:
The HR Employee Services and Digitalisation team is responsible for HR IT transformation projects, HR processes modernisation, HR digitalisation and automation to better CPFB employee experience and HR delivery efficiency. 

In this role, you will: 
• Learn to work within a project management framework, including settling timelines, coordinating tasks and ensuring deliverables meet deadlines
• Develop understanding of HR systems and how they function, including employee data management, payroll systems etc.
• Gan experience in transitioning HR systems from on-premise to cloud-based platforms, learning about cloud service management, data migration strategies, system testing and resolution
• Experience the process of managing organizational change, including user training, communication strategies   
• Learn to work in a multidisciplinary team including IT, HR and external vendors.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse skills and perspectives that each intern brings. While you may not need to meet every requirement fully, having some familiarity or budding expertise in the following areas will help you make the most of this opportunity and succeed with our team. 
• Strong Organizational and project management skills
• Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, ability to analyze complex data sets and able to handle sensitive data with confidentiality
• Possesses strong Microsoft Excel skills (Vlookup, pivots, databases)
• Good written and verbal communication skills with ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders
• Ability to work effectively within a team, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic project environment
• Self-motivated and has the eagerness to learn and take initiative, with proactive approach to tasks and challenges
• Pursuing a diploma/degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
• Understanding of cloud computing concepts, databases and HR systems will be an added advantage

Position is on a full-time internship basis from Jan – Aug 2025. 

What you can expect
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding internship in a workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you during your internship with CPF Board:   
• Learning Opportunities: Engage in impactful projects that allow you to apply theoretical concepts to real-world challenges, helping you gain valuable insights and practical experience along the way.
• Mentorship Guidance:  Boost your internship experience with guidance from experienced mentors and supportive peers committed to fostering your growth and helping you thrive.
• Gain Dynamic Exposure: Gain dynamic exposure, drive innovative solutions, and advance your career through involvement in strategic national projects.
• Expand Your Network: Forge meaningful relationships and expand your professional circle within the public service sector through curated intern activities and networking events.

Jobtitle: [2025 H1 Term-time Internship] CPFB Innovation Intern
Jobdesc:
At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties. 

We thrive on sharp minds and insightful decisions. Your ability to analyse and think critically isn't just valued; it's essential. Every choice you make contributes to our collective success.
