our innovation and progress.

At the core of everything we do lies a genuine desire to make a difference. We serve our community and support each other with compassion, empathy, and unwavering dedications. Every action we take is guided by a deep sense of purpose and a commitment to those we serve. 

Join us at #TeamCPF! Together, let's redefine possibilities and leave a legacy that echoes for generations.
Jobres:
The Business Incubator and Accelerator Team propels the development of new product ideas and business models by small competent cross-functional teams. We drive CPFB’s innovation framework, including supporting the idea-to-solution journey, enhancing knowledge diffusion and evangelising technology adoption. This includes cultivating a culture of curiosity and proactive involvement among staff through a range of initiatives centred on innovation.

In this role, you will:  
• Conduct market research to identify suitable emerging technologies that would be beneficial for CPFB staff (e.g. tools that improve productivity). 
• Apply suitable change management principles and engage relevant stakeholders to get support for the implementation of innovative solutions. 
• Utilise design skills to create collaterals and visual materials to support innovation initiatives, including event materials and promotional content. 
• Assist in event management activities related to innovation initiatives, including planning, coordination, and execution.
• Engage in presenting and facilitating discussions to support innovation initiatives, including conveying ideas, leading discussions, and facilitating workshops to drive innovative solutions within the organisation
Jobreq:
We value the diverse skills and perspectives that each intern brings. While you may not need to meet every requirement fully, having some familiarity or budding expertise in the following areas will help you make the most of this opportunity and succeed with our team. 

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
• Collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively within a team. 
• Willingness to adapt and learn in a fast-paced environment. 
• Proactive and self-motivated with a desire to take on new challenges. 
• A strong interest in technology. 
• Recommend having some familiarity with change management principles. 
• No restrictions on areas of study, but a background in Business, Communications, or a related field may be advantageous.

Position is on a full-time internship basis from Jan – June 2025. 

What you can expect
Being part of #TeamCPF means embarking on a challenging and rewarding internship in a workplace that values productivity and growth. Here’s what awaits you during your internship with CPF Board:   
• Learning Opportunities: Engage in impactful projects that allow you to apply theoretical concepts to real-world challenges, helping you gain valuable insights and practical experience along the way.
• Mentorship Guidance:  Boost your internship experience with guidance from experienced mentors and supportive peers committed to fostering your growth and helping you thrive.
• Gain Dynamic Exposure: Gain dynamic exposure, drive innovative solutions, and advance your career through involvement in strategic national projects.
• Expand Your Network: Forge meaningful relationships and expand your professional circle within the public service sector through curated intern activities and networking events

Jobres:
As a CRC Team Leader, you will be involved in the following:

•	Responding to consular calls and emails from Singaporeans and their families who reached out to MFA for assistance and keeping relevant MFA Overseas Missions and HQ departments informed.

•	Ensuring that requests from the public are responded to, properly e-logged for records and follow-up.

•	Maintaining and ensuring the smooth and effective functioning of the MFA CRC and its transformation to a Crisis Management Centre (CMC) during crises.

•	Monitoring and reporting breaking news on world events (disasters and emergencies) to MFA's Consular Directorate and working with relevant Overseas Missions and HQ departments to reach out to overseas Singaporeans in the affected area(s).

•	Regularly reviewing and updating CRC's SOPs and ensuring its implementation, and managing communication with other domestic agencies e.g. MHA.

•	Supervising the proper handover of duties between the outgoing shift and incoming shift of CRC teams.
Jobreq:
•	Singaporeans with strong communication, planning and administrative skills who are committed to serve in the Public Service.

•	Able to work a rostered shift schedule, including overnight shifts, weekends, and public holidays.

•	Able to work independently and remain calm, patient, and polite when responding to members of the public in distress.

•	4-5 years of experience in similar capacity with supervisory functions in managing rostered teams and members of the public would be preferred.

You will be working in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time.

Find Out More/Contact Us
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. If you wish to find out more or hear from our officers, please visit our website at www.mfa.gov.sg/career. If you have any queries, please contact us at mfa_career@mfa.gov.sg.

Jobdesc: Full-time Trained Teacher
Jobres: As teachers, you build the foundation of education. You equip students with essential skills and sound values to prepare them for life. Anticipate a career of lifelong learning, as you grow alongside your students.
Jobreq:
If you have a professional teaching qualification (such as the Postgraduate Diploma in Education and the Diploma in Education from the National Institute of Education), relevant content knowledge, and are keen to teach at our MOE schools, we welcome you to join us!

We also welcome former MOE-trained teachers who continue to have a passion for education to return to the teaching fraternity on a full-time basis.

The application window is open from 3 Sep 2024 to 30 Sep 2024. If you would like to be considered for a trained teaching position, you are required to:

To apply, please click "Apply Now" to complete the FormSG application form. Kindly specify your subject proficiencies and preferred teaching subjects, and remember to attach all your educational transcripts with your application. Please note that only applications submitted via the FormSG application form will be considered.

You will need to submit your application by 30 Sep 2024, 11.00 PM. Only applications received via the FormSG application form will be considered.

For applicants who are unable to attend the interview in Singapore, your application may be processed outside of the application windows.

Key Personnel (KP)
Former KPs may be considered for reappointment as a KP. Please note that if there is no suitable KP position available, we will consider your application for a classroom teaching position instead.

Applicants can expect to receive an update from us within 4 to 6 weeks of the application window closing.

Should you encounter any difficulty in submitting your application, please contact us at moe_ru_trained_appt@moe.gov.sg for assistance.

Jobtitle: Project Officer, Talent Attraction, HROD (1+1 year contract)
Jobdesc:
The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation, and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore.

For more information on EDB, please visit www.edb.gov.sg

About HROD – Talent Attraction

The HROD Division supports EDB through the attraction, development and retention of talent, in achieving its business outcomes. Within HROD, the Talent Attraction (TA) team drives the branding, selection and sourcing strategies that position and promote EDB as an employer of choice, and develops organisational competence in assessment and selection frameworks. We are in the business of building a strong talent pipeline and securing capable talent critical for EDB’s success.
Jobres:
As Project Officer with the HROD division, your key roles and responsibilities are, but not limited to:

  • Carry out assigned responsibilities for selected initiatives/ programmes. This includes data preparation and launching of workflows/ processes in systems, providing first-level responses to stakeholders, creation of videos/slides and administrative/ logistical support

  • Provide prompt support to the talent attraction team in recruitment and management, including scheduling and coordinating interview arrangements with the relevant stakeholders, and attending to onboarding requests, across talent programme hires and experienced hires

  • Engage with new hires and employees for onboarding matters

  • Undertake recruitment of temporary or support staff to meet the organisation’s needs

  • Administer HR processes, organise and/or prepare reports and resources, and maintain HR systems to ensure smooth operations, and payment processing for procured services 

  • Administering processes to facilitate record keeping and maintenance of personnel files and data entry into HR systems

  • Maintaining division databases for tracking of hiring data
Jobreq:
The successful candidate should have/be:

  • At least 2-3 years’ experience in a related field/ role in HR, Marketing or related disciplines

  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills

  • Meticulous and adept at handling data

  • Organised and thorough in follow-through

  • Resourceful and possess good initiative in proposing new ideas/solutions

  • Results oriented, efficient and effective in managing multiple priorities

  • Good understanding of recruitment best practices, and/or HR information systems like Workday will be an advantage

  • Singaporean

We review applications and interview on a rolling basis. Applicants can expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date.

Jobdesc: You lead and provide guidance to staff under your purview in the Command regarding Human Resource (HR), welfare and engagement matters.
Jobres: On this, you ensure optimal manpower staffing and resource planning for all servicemen in the Command. In addition, you anchor the performance management and career management for all regulars as well as manage and monitor all disciplinary cases in the Command. You cover the duties of Head Manpower (Hd MP) in the absence of Hd MP. Your challenges lie in keeping abreast of HR initiatives to stay relevant and ensure service delivery to stakeholders, routinely reviewing work processes to sync with prevailing policies, working closely with various entities on posting matters within the Command, and interacting with all regulars on their posting preferences whilst striking a balance between personal preferences and organisational needs.
Jobreq:
You must have a tertiary qualification, with at least 6 years' HR experience. Possession of good communication, time management, and public relations skills, coupled with strong leadership traits and good planning abilities, is essential. You must be meticulous, able to multi-task and work under stressful environments.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Agncy: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Jobdesc:
HTX is the world’s first Science and Technology agency that integrates a diverse range of scientific and engineering capabilities to innovate and deliver transformative and operationally-ready solutions for homeland security. As a statutory board of the Ministry of Home Affairs and integral to the Home Team, HTX works at the forefront of science and technology to empower Singapore’s frontline of security. Our shared mission is to amplify, augment and accelerate the Home Team’s advantage and secure Singapore as the safest place on planet earth. 
 
Lead/Engineer assists the Deputy Director/Head to manage and deliver projects in areas such as enterprise ICT infrastructures, platforms, systems and applications, cybersecurity measures and data ops management.
Jobres:
The job-holder will be responsible for the following: 
•	Support Deputy Director/Head to obtain approval of Approval of Requirements papers for projects, and ensure timely delivery of projects within the committed schedule and budget, ensuring project issues are timely resolved or escalated to management for attention. 
•	Provide regular updates to MHA/HTX management on the project progress, highlighting project milestones, issues and expenditure. 
•	Ensure projects are implemented based on the approved project plan that meets all identified operational needs, within agreed parameters of cost, duration and quality. 
•	Identify potential project risks early and assess its implications to the organisation and project, and to recommend mitigating measures to manage the risks and minimise project delay. Risk Assessment 
•	Effectively engage and manage all relevant stakeholders to deliver system. 
•	Ensure proper integration and testing of all hardware and software components so the system is delivered according to contractual requirements. 
•	Prepare technical documents such as technical specifications (for tenders), system design documents, technical interface agreements, various test plans (factory acceptance, on site acceptance, etc.) and test reports, if required.  
•	Work with external agencies and/or Home Team Departments (HTDs) to bring in the necessary systems and data through proper technical interface agreements.
Jobreq:
•	Tertiary qualification in Engineering/ Computer Science/ Information Technology or relevant disciplines 
•	Preferably more than 3-5 years of relevant working experience. 
•	Strong interest in technologies and innovation, especially in the areas of Cloud technology and set up. 

All new hires are appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance and will be assessed and considered for permanent tenure over time, based on performance.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

#LI-JW1

Jobdesc: To manage Human Resource Management functions in the areas of talent attraction and management, such as recruitment and outreach, scholarships, HR ops/administration, and exit management.
Jobres:
Responsibilities: 

•	Manage the recruitment and selection process for all positions in AGO including scholarships and internships. 

•	Implement initiatives, in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, to strengthen the organisation’s employer brand by participating in recruitment and scholarship outreach events. 

•	Review HR policies, processes or programmes (e.g., Onboarding, exit process) affecting the employee experience.

•	Engaging Head of Departments and/or Group Directors on manpower planning, and execute career deployment exercises to match talent to groups/departments.  

•	Recommend, implement, and review initiatives to promote employee wellbeing. Manage staff welfare initiatives such as overseeing the purchase of get-well hampers, baby gifts and wreaths to employees. 

•	Address business units’ HR queries and challenges, and propose effective solutions to resolve them, when needed. Anticipate potential concerns from the business units on HR policies and processes; and propose alternative solutions to address them.

•	Oversee process improvements projects (E.g., automating HR processes such as shortlisting and preparation of interview folder using Robotic Process Automation (RPA)), when needed. 

•	Supervise a team of executives in delivering HR KPIs. 

•	Assist with ad-hoc projects as assigned by Director, Corporate Development and/or Head of Department.
Jobreq:
Job Requirements: 

•	Degree in related/relevant discipline in HR; or post-graduate Diploma in HR

•	Other relevant HR accreditations, such as IHRP-CP would be advantageous. 

•	At least 5 to 8 years’ of experience in human resource management with experience in leading teams, preferably in public sector HR. 

•	Familiar with Public Sector HR guidelines and rules, e.g. Government Instruction Manuals, Public Service Division Circulars, etc.    

•	Possess problem-solving and analytical skills to analyse complex issues/information, and make good judgement, including proposing solutions for consideration. 

•	Possess excellent inter-personal and communication (verbal and written) skills to work and build collaborative partnerships with stakeholders and external agencies. 

•	Able to work in a fast-paced environment.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

At #TeamCPF, you’re not just joining a team; you are embracing a culture of excellence, collaboration, and meaningful impact. You will play a pivotal role in empowering over 4 million members to secure their retirement, healthcare, housing needs and better navigate life’s uncertainties.

Jobres:
As a member of the Investment Management Department (IMD), you will play a key role in overseeing and optimising the Board's investment strategies. 

In this role, you will:
•	Conduct detailed bottom-up credit research of issuers of SGD-denominated bonds and USD-denominated bonds.
•	Identify securities that offer relative valuation and alpha generation for portfolio mandate.
•	Conduct trade execution, performance attribution, cashflow monitoring as well as monitoring for adherence to guidelines.
•	Support the Fixed Income team in negotiating and documenting the International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) agreement.
•	Assist the department in automating work functions to enhance operational efficiency, ensuring the smooth operation of the Fixed Income team during a period of increased demand and transition.
Jobreq:
We value the diverse talents and experiences that each individual brings to the table. While mastery of every requirement may not be necessary, familiarity and expertise in some of the following areas will position you for success within this team.

•	Demonstrated hands-on experience in Asia credit research, with a strong track record of conducting comprehensive assessments of regional corporates and financial institutions.
•	Preferably a CFA charter holder or completed CFA Level I, II, or III exams.
•	Background in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or a related numerical discipline.
•	Knowledge of FX markets is a plus, with the ability to optimise hedging techniques in line with overall investment guidelines and objectives.
•	Proficiency in financial software and tools such as Bloomberg, along with advanced Excel skills.
•	Ability to work independently while being an effective team player. 
•	Demonstrates positive attitude, strong analytical capabilities, and adaptability.
The seniority of appointment and actual corporate job title will commensurate with individual work experiences.
Position is on a 1-year full-time contract directly under the payroll of CPF Board.

What you can expect
Being Part Of #TeamCPF Means Embarking On a Challenging And Rewarding Career In a Progressive Workplace That Values Productivity And Growth. Here’s What Awaits You
•	Opportunities to engage in a mix of formal and informal training, keeping your skills sharp in our ever-evolving technological landscape.
•	Promotion opportunities based on your capability and on-the-job performance.
•	A vibrant community of like-minded and friendly colleagues, where collaboration and creativity thrive.
•	A hybrid work model that offers flexibility for remote work, subject to exigencies of service.
•	Flexible dress code that empowers you to choose your appropriate outfit for the day.
•	A comprehensive rewards package that includes annual leave, pro-family leave, medical and dental benefits, and access to recreational activities.

Agncy: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Jobtitle: Sr/Procurement Specialist, Building & Infrastructure, Central Procurement Office
Jobdesc:
The Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX) is a statutory board under the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) which aims to pioneer innovation solutions and develop world class science and technology capabilities to transform and empower the Home Team in delivering safety and security for Singapore.  

The successful job holder will need to procure building and construction related projects goods and services in accordance with the BCA’s Price Quality Method and Quality Fee Method,  Government Instruction Manual on Procurement, Finance Circulars and existing rules and regulations as laid out by the Central Procurement Authority, Ministry of Home Affairs (CPA). He/She will also need to manage the procurement function cum maintaining high standards of procurement performance in the Ministry and across all Home Team Departments (HTDs).
Jobres:
•	Work closely with the Home Team Departments (HTDs) and Ministry HQ (MHQ) Divisions in developing appropriate procurement strategies / approaches to achieve effective procurement in supporting the departments’ operation
•	Prepare construction and building maintenance tender documents and manage the tendering process using electronic procurement system (GeBIZ) and monitor progress of procurement activities to ensure timeliness of procurement and contract implementation
•	Formulate procurement strategies for better management of procurement and to achieve strategy-based procurement for effective procurement
•	Capture lessons learnt as case studies including good practices and irregularities and present at procurement Community of Practice forums and / or in-house courses for sharing and learning
•	Maintain close surveillance on related market trends and development, cost and performance and its application to HTDs and MHQ Divisions
•	Other ad-hoc initiatives and projects may be assigned
Jobreq:
•	Possess a building or facilities management related degree, preferably with at least 5 years’ of building and infrastructure procurement experience in the Public Sector and knowledgeable on procurement procedures, standards and guidelines specified in the BCA and Government Instruction Manual on Procurement, Finance Circulars and existing rules and regulations and well versed in GeBiz applications
•	Keen interest in developing knowledge and enhancing competency in the procurement functions
•	Able to manage workload and focus on priorities
•	Good organisational, analytical and leadership skills 
•	Good written and communication skills
•	Proactive, impactful and reliable individual with the ability to work and deliver in a fast paced environment

All new hires are appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance and will be assessed and considered for permanent tenure over time, based on performance.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

#LI-CW1

Agncy: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Jobdesc:
HTX is the world’s first Science and Technology agency that integrates a diverse range of scientific and engineering capabilities to innovate and deliver transformative and operationally ready solutions for homeland security. As a statutory board of the Ministry of Home Affairs and integral to the Home Team, HTX works at the forefront of science and technology to empower Singapore’s frontline of security. Our shared mission is to amplify, augment and accelerate the Home Team’s advantage and secure Singapore as the safest place on planet earth.

The jobholder will be part of the Data Engineering for xData within the Enterprise Group. The team is dedicated to building robust systems that support critical operations which team thrives on innovation, collaboration, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

As the Lead Data Engineer at xData, you will be at the forefront of designing, developing, and optimizing data architectures and pipelines that support AI and machine learning projects. You will lead/learn a team of data engineers, ensuring the effective integration, processing, and management of data from various sources. Your role is crucial for enabling the development of solutions that can handle complex, confidential, and large-scale datasets.

We are looking for highly technical individuals who are passionate about tech, love to solve problems, must be able to code and have a sound engineering mind. The ideal candidate is one who dares to innovate, takes ownership, a great team player, inspires excellence, is a skilled learner and one who embraces failures.
Jobres:
Work with external agencies and/or Home Team Departments (HTDs) to bring in the necessary data through proper technical interface agreements. 
Build and manage data ingestion and processing pipelines to collect, clean, harmonise, merge and consolidate data sources for analysis, machine learning and visualisation purposes. 
Build scalable and data-driven products and assist with data-related technical issues 
Participate in the application of machine learning/AI techniques to various problem statements. 
Keep abreast of technological advances in Big Data Technologies, database designs & architecture and government policies & recommendations.
Jobreq:
Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in STEM disciplines. 
Applicants with system architecture design and product deployment experience will be considered for more senior positions. 
Strong understanding in one or more of the following areas: 

Proficiency in the following technologies: 
Database design and operations (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) 
Big Data technologies (e.g., Apache Hadoop, Spark, Kafka) 
ETL and orchestration tools (e.g., Apache NiFi, Talend, Airflow) 
Cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure) 
Version Control (e.g., Git, GitHub, GitLab) 

Knowledge on data repository concepts (e.g., Data Mart, Data Warehouse, Data Lake) 
Data modelling and schema design 
Familiar with one of more of these languages: Python, Scala and Java 
Understand clean code practices and application of appropriate software design pattern

**** All new hires are appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance and will be assessed and considered for permanent tenure over time, based on performance. 
As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. 
All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

Jobdesc: The Adjunct Information and Communications Technology (ICT) Associate/ Manager supports the school management team in promoting, planning, and executing the school's ICT strategies to foster an innovative and engaging learning environment. This role also offers the opportunity to collaborate with MOE's Information Technology Division to introduce new ICT initiatives that align with the school's curriculum needs and enhance our students' learning experiences.
Jobres:
•	Collaborate with the Head of Department ICT and HQ-based ICT Partners to facilitate digital transformation, recommending appropriate ICT tools and applications for integration into the school's ICT plans.
•	Manage ICT administration, asset procurement, and implementation of HQ-driven ICT projects within the school, ensuring essential ICT and data security measures are in place.
•	Mentor teachers in adopting effective ICT practices, tools, and applications for teaching and learning enhancement.
•	Monitor ICT funding usage and provide the HOD ICT with solutions for efficient utilization tracking.
Jobreq:
•	Commitment for one year
•	Passion for ICT, with an innovative spirit to drive digital transformation
•	A collaborative team player with good interpersonal skills
•	Good organisational skills and able to multi-task
•	Customer-centric, analytical and strong problem-solving skills
•	Preferably with at least 3 years of relevant experience in an Information Technology-related environment

Shortlisted candidates will be included in a central registry for an 8-week duration, during which schools may invite them for an interview. If chosen, their application will undergo further processing. Applicants not contacted within this period can consider their application unsuccessful. Interviewed candidates will be informed about the result of their application in due course.

In general, applicants can expect to hear from us within 3 weeks of the close of the application window. In the event where we receive a high number of applications, applicants will receive an update on their status within 5 weeks of the close of the window. 

As part of the processing of your application, you may be required to undergo a medical examination that will be fully paid by MOE. You will be provided with instructions regarding the medical examination. 

Note: The medical examination is part of the selection process and does not indicate that you have been offered the appointment.

If you are facing issues submitting your application through the Careers@Gov portal, please contact us at Careers.gov.technicalhelp@psd.gov.sg for assistance.

Agncy: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
Jobdesc:
What the role is
The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) aims to develop and promote Singapore as a premier global hub and an international maritime centre, and to advance and safeguard Singapore's strategic maritime interests.

Join our Financial Accounting department and play a crucial role in accurate and timely reporting of financial transactions, while maintaining strong vendor/billing parties and internal stakeholder relationships.

You will be reporting to the Senior Manager/Assistant Director(Financial Accounting).

What you will be working on:

  • Perform daily Account Payables (AP)/Account Receivables (AR) operations

  • Perform month-end closing activities

  • Ensure compliance with policies and reporting (e.g. Audit, GST and management reports)

  • Collaborate with vendors/billing parties and internal teams for payment/billing and accounting matters

  • Support Finance-related projects for automation initiatives, continual process improvements and data analytics

  • Assist with ad-hoc duties assigned by the supervisor.

What we are looking for:

  • 1 to 3 years of experience in AP/AR is preferred

  • Proficient in accounting software and MS Office, especially Excel

  • Familiarity with ERP systems, especially Workday Financials is a plus

  • Excellent attention to detail and time management skills

  • Strong communication and problem-solving abilities.

  • High integrity and commitment to confidentiality
MANAGER, STRATEGY & PROJECTS
Jobres:
You will be part of the Point-to-Point (P2P) Transport division overseeing the street-hail and ride-hail industry. The P2P sector complements our Public Transport through the provision of a safe and reliable means of point-to-point service and supports our car-lite vision by reducing the need for car ownership.

You will manage a team that conducts policy reviews related to the taxi, private hire car and carsharing sector. In addition to conducting regular industry scans of the P2P industries locally and abroad to develop think-pieces and presentations to discuss with management, you will be responsible for generating statistical data, and performing analyses to track the health and performance of the dynamic P2P sector. You will also be involved in sharing best practices and building network with local stakeholders, other Government agencies and regulators. Beyond writing policy and position papers, ground situational awareness and stakeholder management skills will be key in succeeding in this role.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in any discipline, preferably with a discipline in
engineering, statistics, data management or IT-related
• At least 8 years of relevant working experience, with at least 5 years in
policy reviews and data analysis, preferably with public policy experience
• Experience with Python, Tableau, Excel data visualisation, geospatial data
analysis, database management will be an advantage
• Competent in managing teams to synthesize information, build strong
narrative and distil ideas and concepts into concrete plans
• Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills
• Strong ability to work effectively in an environment that is fluid and fast-
paced
• The critical skills to be an effective advocate and influencer is essential, as
well as the ability to develop positive working relationships across all levels
and functions with both internal and external stakeholders, amidst a fast-
paced and fluid environment.
• Strong command of English as well as good critical thinking, writing and
presentation skills.

Jobdesc:
Looking for a job that makes a difference?

Join us at the Forefront of Shaping Healthier Lives

The Health Promotion Board’s vision is to make Singapore a nation of healthier people.  Be a part of this journey if you’re passionate about creating boundary-pushing work that drives behavioral change.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT

As a key member of Rewards Department, you will be part of a team to manage a board-wide rewards programme and platform services to facilitate sustained engagements with all stakeholders within its rewards ecosystem and to support national-level initiatives for the benefit of Singaporeans.  


1. As the EPIC Rewards Product Lead, you are to provide leadership in driving the Rewards EPIC product development for the benefit of Healthy 365 app users by incorporating human-centric design elements and implement projects which are in line with the Rewards strategic roadmap; lead the engagement in strategic discussions with internal stakeholders and other public agencies to explore business or integration solutioning options which would enable them to leverage on Healthpoint system or rewards platform; and lead the platform design discussions to enhance the capability of the rewards platform to manage and award non-monetary rewards. 

2. As the Product Lead of Rewards Management System (RMS), you will manage the vendor relationship and take the lead to conduct need-gap analysis and drive enhancement initiatives to progressively strengthen the robustness of the system.  You will lead the prioritization of features development process, including resourcing and project delivery timelines with our tech team and vendor and other affected internal stakeholders to ensure project deliverables are achieved on-time and on-budget.  You will also oversee RMS’ operational effectiveness and ensure system scalability to support H365 app traffic requirements (e.g., allocate resources for system load testing, establish effective and meaningful system and process metrics, provide periodic product knowledge training & support to the CS team).

3. As the overall Rewards Platform Lead, you will be providing leadership to front any business or tech integration collaboration with 3rd party partners’ systems for specific business requirements or use-cases (e.g., ActiveSG eWallet, GovWallet, SimplyGo).  You will also be working closely with internal tech teams and system vendors to (i) facilitate periodic review of system to ensure seamless and efficient data exchange between various systems in the rewards platform; (ii) facilitate the sharing of the latest  data and network security policy updates to ensure that the tech vendors of the respective systems fully understand and comply with the updated policies; and (iii) address identified audit gaps by working with relevant internal stakeholders to timely update the risk registers and execute plans to mitigate operations, hardware, software and network breaches.

BE PART OF THE TEAM

Join us if you are a dynamic and self-motivated individual who has at least 8-10 years of relevant working experience (5 – 8 years for SM level) in rewards or loyalty programme environment, product or programme design/development, operations management, insights driven data analytics, project management (preferably in a tech environment), and enjoys working in a highly matrixed, fluid and fast-paced environment.

You should also possess:

  • Good understanding or knowledge of related CRM/IT systems, and comfortable in engaging tech stakeholders (including 3rd party vendors), with proven track record in successfully developing, implementing and executing vendor management initiatives

  • Good leadership and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to interact effectively with all levels of an organisation and navigate complex stakeholder relationships

  • Strategic, analytical and critical thinking mind-set; resourceful in seeking solutions and able to streamline processes able and produce desired outcomes

  • Strong verbal, written and presentation skills coupled with strong influencing skills, proficient in MS Office suite of apps.
You will play a key role in supporting the jobs and skills pillar under the Industry Transformation Map (ITM) for the sector under your purview. This includes:
Jobres:
Stakeholder Engagement and Management

  • Outreach to companies to promote the adoption of WSG programmes and progressive human resource practices to address their manpower needs.

  • Engage companies from business development perspective, with a growth strategy of outreaching and onboarding new companies to add on to the list of account managed companies.

  • Establish and maintain effective relationships with strategic partners and stakeholders.

  • Engage strategic company accounts to diagnose gaps and identify opportunities.

  • Collaborate with industry stakeholders including government agencies, associations, tripartite partners, programme partners to develop and implement relevant manpower interventions to address industry manpower issues.

  • Consult with employers to promote adoption of WSG programmes and progressive human resource practices to address their manpower needs.

​

Strategic Manpower Planning

  • Identify and assess key industry, manpower challenges and skills needs.

  • Manage and collaborate with strategic partners and engage companies to diagnose gaps and identify opportunities.

  • Recommend the design of appropriate strategic human capital solutions based on industry or companies’ business and manpower needs.

  • Support the Industry Transformation Map (ITM) – Jobs and Skills Pillar, and Jobs Transformation Map (JTM).

Project Management

  • Plan and review budget requirements and ensure compliance to policies and processes.

  • Organise or support outreach and marketing events, career events and industry engagements.

  • Track programmes’ progress and analyse industry related information to evaluate and make recommendations for management decision making.
Jobreq:
- At least two (2) years of working experience in industry engagement/ business development/account management is preferred.
- Salary will commensurate with experience.
 

You should possess the following skill sets:

  • Industry Engagement and Business Development: Capable of developing and maintaining strong engagement and relationships within the industry of various profiles (from C-suites to grassroots) and utilizing trend analysis and government initiatives to drive business strategies and growth.

  • Negotiation: Able to strategize negotiation, formulate gameplan and engage in complex discussion to drive collaboration and implementation with stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes.

  • Communication: Proficient in writing clear submissions and reports, and able to frame appropriate narratives to effectively engage diverse audiences, and also skilled in public speaking.

  • Personal effectiveness: Able to manage multiple tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and work both independently and in teams.

  • Critical thinking: Able to compile, analyse, and interpret data to recommend data backed decisions and program monitoring.

  • Consulting Advisory and Innovative Solutioning: Capable of diagnosing gaps and identify opportunities for businesses and innovative solutions to enhance business processes.

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc:
You will report to the Lead of RPD’s Grants Policy team that oversees WSG’s funding policies and guidelines. As an RPD officer, you will contribute to the development and review of funding policies and facilitate central oversight of WSG’s grants design and implementation effectiveness through policy and programme reviews and enhancements

Responsibilities

a) Policy Development and Review        

·       Develop and review WSG’s funding policies and principles to support its mission and strategies

·       Review and update WSG-wide funding agreement templates and guidelines to ensure relevance and fit for purpose

·       Advise divisions on WSG’s funding principles and policies to facilitate grants design and implementation

·       Assess divisions’ requests for exceptions to prevailing policies and guidelines

·       Work with divisions on programme reviews and enhancements

b) Grants Governance and Management

·       Implement the Grants Governance Framework to strengthen WSG’s grants management and oversight, such as the introduction of risk mitigating measures and operating guidelines

·       Drive the agenda and perform secretariat duties for WSG’s Governance and Risk Forums

c) Stakeholder Engagement

·       Work with Ministries and Sector Lead agencies to ensure compliance for WSG funding policies and principles with Whole-of-Government guidelines on grants design and management

·       Liaise and engage stakeholders to drive change and facilitate grants design and implementation

Requirements

·       Preferably at least 3 years of public sector experience in relevant fields such as policy development, programme evaluation and grants governance/management.

Knowledge/Skills

·       Possess good communication, writing and presentation skills 

·       Possess strong analytical, critical thinking and numerical skills

·       Possess good project management and problem-solving skills

·       Understand public governance and its principles

·       Organised, meticulous and detail oriented

  • Able to engage stakeholders well to drive change

You will be part of Workforce Singapore (WSG) management team to develop and implement initiatives and programmes relating to enterprise development. As a Deputy Director, you are expected to assume supervisory responsibilities by overseeing the day-to-day management and development of 4 to 5 teams of staff.
Jobres:
Reporting to the Director of the Division, you will manage 4 to 5 teams in carrying out the following:

  • Develop sectoral capabilities by engaging industry partners, conceputalise new initiatives and interventions relating to enterprise and workforce development

  • Conceputalise pilots to test-bed new initiatives and interventions, and constantly iterate and refine the ideas

  • Drive adoption of cross-sectoral initiatives, as well as other national priority initiatives such as the Skillsfuture Career Health Initiative, through outreach platforms and media publicity

  • Formulate operations policy and engagement strategies and oversee strategic operations planning and processes

  • Lead and oversee the compliance and governance processes within the division

  • Deliver new and innovative ways to acquire new leads, drive partnerships and streamline current processes

  • Monitor and review performance of cross-sectoral initiatives against the performance objectives to ensure alignment to corporate KPIs

  • Manage related strategic linkages and cross-agency projects with government ministries/agencies, unions, industry/employer associations and provide strategic inputs for sectoral skills strategies and plans

  • Drive and implement innovation and special projects, which may be required under WOG/MOM HQ's guidance
Jobreq:
Requirements

  • About 10 years of experience in relevant fields, with about 5 years in management position

  • Operations Policy Design & Implementation - Ability to analyse and understand policies and their implications, and translate them into implementation

  • Manage strategic affairs - Demonstrate strategic thinking, able to define organisational performance measures

  • Communication - Deliver effective written and oral communication

  • Relationship management - Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills with internal and external stakeholders

  • People Management - Effectively manage self, and collaborate with individuals/teams internally and externally

Candidates without the relevant work experience but possess the required qualities are welcome to apply
 

Knowledge/Skills

Programme Implementation

  • Proven ability in formulating operations policy and guidelines and translating it for the delivering of relevant interventions to facilitate job placements for different worker segments

  • Previous hands-on experience in programme development including conducting market sensing and analysis, conceptualising and validating new construct and implementing and reviewing the outcomes

  • Demonstrated success in driving programme adoption with measurable outcomes

Partnership Engagement

  • Proven track record in delivering new and innovative ways to acquire new leads and partnerships

  • Possess a diverse network covering different industries 

  • Familiar with client and account management

  • Ability to drive team to execute engagement strategies to meet organisational goals

  • Good track record in partnership and stakeholders engagement

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc: You will be part of the Security Division (SD)'s Security Excellence Department who is responsible for the standard and quality of security implementation in JTC.
Jobres:
You are expected to:
1.	Work with the security operations team to address security operational challenges in the many JTC properties in Singapore. This can include the conduct of regular red teaming exercises to drill on security vendor’s readiness and assess on their competency.
2.	You will also work with the various security vendors and technical consultants to specify the technical specifications of the proposed security systems.
3.	Security scoping and advice on physical security measures and operational procedures for JTC new developments and projects. Involvement will be throughout the project lifecycle.
4.	Plan and implement the Quality Assurance framework for JTC properties. You will also need to ensure the identified gaps and areas for improvements are followed-up and rectified. The intent of the QA framework is to ensure the security measures and processes meet JTC’s operational objectives and requirements.
5.	From time to time, you may be asked to assist in other projects involving security advisory for external government agencies.
Jobreq:
•	At least 3 to 4 years of experience in security or security-related operations.
•	Experience working as security managers in Public or Government buildings/premises would be an advantage.
•	Experience in security technologies, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) would also be an advantage.
•	Possess the following personal qualities:
1.	Good written and spoken communication skills
2.	Exercise leadership to motivate, engage subordinates and fellow colleagues
3.	Good analytical skills to identify and analyse problems and recommend solutions
4.	Adaptable, self-motivated and meticulous
5.	Willing to engage and collaborate with different stakeholders within JTC and external parties
6.	Be comfortable conducting briefings to large group of audiences or industrial players on topics relevant to the security domain and contracting.

Jobdesc:
The Council for Estate Agencies (CEA) regulates and promotes the development of a professional and trusted real estate agency industry.  CEA’s key responsibilities are to license property agencies and agents, and equip consumers with the necessary knowledge to make informed decisions in property transactions.

Human Resource
You will be an integral part of the human resource team that partners line managers on the various HR areas (from manpower acquisition, learning and development, performance management, talent development to exit management), supports officers through the employee life cycle and works with Senior Management to develop HR strategies that support organisational goals.
Jobres:
Areas that you will be involved in are:

Performance Management and Career Development
•	Review and evaluate the performance management policies and processes.
•	Plan and execute performance management initiatives. 
•	Assist in managing the pipelines for succession of key jobs. 
•	Handle the talent management process. 

Organisation Development
•	Develop and implement interventions that improve organisation effectiveness and strengthen organization culture. 
•	Monitor organisation’s workforce health and engagement level. 
•	Organise agency-wide events such as employee engagement sessions, team-building etc.

Competency Framework Development and Application
•	Implement and refresh agency-specific competency frameworks to develop and manage organisation’s workforce.
•	Integrate identified competencies in the HR processes. 
•	Address gaps in the competencies at the organisational level. 

Other HR Roles
•	Follow up on Whole-of-Government compensation & benefits related policy changes. 
•	Ensure proper payment of salary components to staff
Jobreq:
Requirements
•	Minimum 4 years of relevant work experience, preferably in performance management, staff development, organisation development, payroll etc.
•	Able to work independently and as a team.
•	Able to multi-task.
•	Mature, resourceful with an eye for details.
•	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
•	Knowledge of IM as well as PSD's policies and guidelines will be an advantage.

Jobtitle: Assistant Registrar, Industrial Arbitration Court, LRWD
Jobdesc:
At the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), we strive to build a Great Workforce and a Great Workplace. We work to achieve a globally competitive workforce and great workplace, for a cohesive society and a secure economic future for all Singaporeans. Our work transcends the boundaries of our desks – it takes us to real workplaces all over Singapore. We are continually on the lookout for individuals who want to make a difference and impact lives in the core areas of our work. 

The Industrial Arbitration Court (IAC) was established under the Industrial Relations Act 1960 with the goal of promoting industrial harmony and maintaining fair labor practices. The court primarily handles disputes on employment terms, and the certification of collective agreements.

You will assist the Registrar in managing court operations, facilitating the resolution of industrial disputes, and timely certification of collective agreements registered with the court.
Jobres:
•	Vetting through collective agreements and variation applications to ensure that the terms therein comply with labour laws
•	Assisting in drafting and reviewing court documents or content (such as awards, orders, annual reports, IAC website)
•	Providing mediation to parties of a trade dispute 
•	Providing administrative support during hearings and proceedings
•	Supervising and working with a team of executives on the daily operations of the court, including revising existing SOPs 
•	Maintaining and safekeeping court records (such as awards, transcripts, statistical data) 
•	Liaising with government agencies and external parties when required
•	Continually looking for solutions for the court’s operational efficiency
•	Exploring and leveraging on technology (such as AI, data visualisation) to improve work processes, and collate/present data

Jobdesc:
At the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), we strive to build a Great Workforce and a Great Workplace. We work to achieve a globally competitive workforce and great workplace, for a cohesive society and a secure economic future for all Singaporeans. Our work transcends the boundaries of our desks – it takes us to real workplaces all over Singapore. We are continually on the lookout for individuals who want to make a difference and impact lives in the core areas of our work. 

The jobholder is responsible for leading the efforts in enhancing the operational efficiency of the Issue, Renewal, and Cancellation Group through the adoption of cutting-edge technologies, including data analytics, robotic process automation (RPA), and dashboard tools while upholding the integrity of the Work Pass system.
Jobres:
•	Develop and maintain RPA scripts using UI Path to automate routine tasks and enhance process efficiency. This can be done through adapting existing scripts or creating new ones to meet the demands of an evolving environment.
•	Create Tableau/PowerBI dashboards to monitor operational metrics and provide statistical reports to the management.
•	Analyze data to identify trends and patterns, offering insights and recommendations to support decision-making and policy formulation.
•	Work with IRC teams to streamline and improve operational processes by removing redundant tasks or introducing automation, aiming for manpower savings and improved productivity.
•	Leverage AI technologies to further refine operational procedures and customer engagements.
•	Coordinate with IT service providers on system design and execution to facilitate the introduction and adjustment of policies.
•	Work closely with operational teams to revise or establish work processes for the implementation of new policy measures or operational requirements.
•	Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure system modifications are ready for launch.
•	Coordinate with MOM departments to resolve enquiries escalated by the MOM Contact Centre, ensuring comprehensive and clear solutions are provided to the public.
Jobreq:
•	Tertiary qualification in a relevant field with a strong foundation in data analysis, RPA scripting, and dashboard creation.
•	Demonstrated proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent.
•	Experience in designing, developing, and implementing RPA solutions using UI Path.
•	Proven ability to manage and interpret large data sets, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
•	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to propose innovative solutions.
•	Excellent communication skills with the ability to develop clear and effective public communication materials.
•	A proactive learner with a willingness to keep abreast of technological advancements in data analytics and automation.
•	Fresh graduates are welcome to apply

*PWDs are welcome to apply.

Jobdesc:
MND is embarking on our Future Workplace Transformation, to create a stronger, more collaborative and joyful workplace.  We are redesigning our workplace experience, to shape a more attractive and empowering environment for our workforce, while building a culture of collaboration and innovation. 

The last major renovation for the MND Complex was conducted in 1991, and a comprehensive refresh of the building infrastructure is needed, to ensure that the MND Complex continues to be sustainable and relevant for its remaining lifespan, to our officers and tenants.  The enhancement works to the MND Complex will also contribute tangibly to broader planning and sustainability objectives, including enhancing connectivity and porosity within the surrounding neighbourhood, leveraging open spaces for greenery and activation and contribute towards sustainable development.
Jobres:
You will be part of the Transformation Team within MND’s Corporate Development Division and report to the Senior Assistant Director (Transformation).  

Specific Job Responsibilities 

You will: 
-	Work with a multi-disciplinary team of consultants and stakeholders to plan and execute asset enhancement works for the MND Complex, including the review of design proposals, management of tenancy strategy and upcoming renovation works. 
-	Distil user needs through stakeholder engagements and workplace improvement pilots to test new concepts and conduct data analysis to guide decision-making and/or assess effectiveness. 
-	Develop and execute a communications and engagement plan to inform and prepare MND officers for the upcoming renovations, while ensuring a seamless transition for officers to move to their upgraded offices.
Jobreq:
We are looking for individuals who are open to new ways of thinking and are passionate about creating a positive and enjoyable workplace experience.  

You should preferably possess: 
-	At least 2 to 4 years of work experience in workplace strategy or redesigning work spaces.  
-	Strong team player with the ability to analyse multiple sources of information to co-create user-centric solutions in partnership with stakeholders. 
-	Excellent writing and presentation skills, as well as the ability to manage both internal and external stakeholders across various levels.
-	Background in Project Management or Stakeholder Engagement would be an advantage.  

Competencies Required 
-	Ability to implement, monitor and ensure the execution of all aspects of a project, anticipate potential risks and put in place mitigation measures.  
-	Ability to strategise and solve design and project management issues, factoring in multi-disciplinary perspectives.
-	Ability to adapt and adjust engagement strategies to garner stakeholder support.

Jobdesc: ISD confronts and addresses threats to Singapore’s internal security and stability. For over 75 years, ISD and its predecessor organisations have played a central role in countering threats such as those posed by foreign subversive elements, spies, racial and religious extremists, and terrorists. A fulfilling and rewarding career awaits those who want to join in ISD’s critical mission of keeping Singapore safe, secure and sovereign for all Singaporeans.
Jobres:
As a HR Innovation Executive, you will be managing and coordinating delivery of HR transformation project deliverables with internal and external stakeholders, recommending business changes to refine system capabilities, enforcing governance of sensitive and confidential HR information repositories and systems.

The successful candidate will:
- Engage relevant stakeholders on requirements
- Formulate scope of projects, goals and deliverables
- Ensure compliances of requirements with prevailing civil service guidelines and regulations
- Communicate project status and progress to stakeholders and management
- Analyse and identify gaps in existing HR business processes or system workflows
- Plan and formulate guidelines and standards on data usage and integrity
- Any other administrative matters
Jobreq: #NAME?

Agncy: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Jobdesc:
HTX’s Plans & Strategy’s role is to prepare HTX for the future by ensuring that our strategic plans are informed by a comprehensive analysis of challenges, opportunities and priorities. The Resources Plans & Organisation under Plans & Strategy oversees the allocation and management of resources in Budget and Manpower, to effect these strategic plans. 

The job-holder has to understand Home Team’s operating context, challenges, constraints and harmonise efforts across all Home Team Departments and agencies. The Home Team is pushing ahead to grow our Science & Technology (S&T) capabilities. The work environment is constantly evolving as we continue to restructure and venture into new areas of work. 

Therefore, the job-holder must be adaptable, dynamic and have the tenacity to push through changes and transformation work.
Jobres:
1) Provide sound recommendations to HTX Senior Management in different resource areas by providing trade-off analysis when evaluating resource requests, streamlining fundamental working principles, ensuring clear and sound business proposals, centrally aggregating requests to form larger masterplans and developing an acumen for management assessment over time. This will involve arbitrating and/or leveraging resource requests amongst different internal and external stakeholders with divergent interests. 

2)Specific to budget requests, the job-holder has to review papers spanning a broad range of domains in the Home Team and make recommendations to HTX Senior Management. The papers can cover replacement of equipment, vehicles, weapons, ICT systems, hardware and software etc as well as building and infrastructure maintenance. 

3)The volume of budget papers is high and the team often has to deal with urgent requests or challenging stakeholders with an array of requests, given tight delivery timelines. The review will include ensuring key project planning parameters are taken into consideration including broader plans, cost-benefit analysis, project risks and maintenance plans. 

4) The job-holder also needs to collate and sense-make overall budget requests to optimise overall resource usage.

5) Comfortable working closely with Dir/DD to engage and understand the diverse needs of stakeholders at various levels of seniority. To this end, the job holder needs to be able to pull people together and hold his/her own, when engaging stakeholders with diverging viewpoints. 

6)The job holder also needs to be meticulous and pay close attention to detail while maintaining a broader strategic perspective and understanding the broader operating context.
Jobreq:
1) Tertiary qualification in Computer Engineering/ Computer Science/ Information Technology or relevant disciplines.

2) Minimum 2 to 3 years of ICT work experience. Prior experience in project management is helpful.

3) Exercise sound judgement to evaluate business proposals.

4) Have a good sense of perspective to understand and balance organisation needs vis-à-vis requirements from HTX sub-units.

5) Have the tenacity and rigor of mind to handle transformation work 

6) Be adaptable and dynamic as things evolve

7) Be a dependable team player/leader who is accommodating and can work with others, because the work scope is fluid and evolves rapidly  

All new hires are appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance and will be assessed and considered for permanent tenure over time, based on performance.

As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

#LI-CW1

Agncy: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Jobdesc:
The Child Development Department in ECDA spearheads a wide range of initiatives to support the development of young children with developmental needs and young children from low-income families, to ensure that they have a good start.

The Early Intervention (EI) branch in the department oversees a continuum of services for young children (aged 6 years and below) with developmental needs. The team oversees the planning and development of EI programmes in preschools and the community, drives capability development initiatives for early intervention and inclusive practices, conducts research and evaluation to improve programme design and practices, and ensures efficient and effective EI services.
Jobres:
The EI programmes are critical to ensure children with developmental needs can access services in a timely, effective and appropriate manner. You will be involved in driving the implementation and review of EI programmes. Responsibilities include:
Responsibilities include: 
1.	Review, develop and implement operational policies and processes to ensure that EI programmes are delivered efficiently and effectively, including reviewing and drafting the Inclusive Support Programme (InSP) service models. 
2.	Collaborate with divisions within ECDA and external partners for efficient service delivery. 
3.	Oversee analysis and monitoring of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and Monitoring Indicators (MIs) to identify and address implementation issues early to ensure quality of InSP programme delivery. 
4.	Any other related work as required
Jobreq:
•	Good communication (written and oral) and stakeholder engagement skills   
•	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an eye for details 
•	Takes initiative and is resourceful 
•	Good networking and/or negotiation skills 
•	Able to multi-task and work well in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
•	Able to work as part of a team and autonomously 
•	Resilient and positive 
•	Prior experience in programme implementation, review and evaluation preferred

Jobtitle: [LTA-P&P] TRANSPORT PLANNER (1 LOCAL PLANNING NORTH EAST)
Jobdesc: Transport Planner (1 Local Planning North East)
Jobres:
You will be part of a dynamic team of transport planners who plan the future transportation infrastructure for Singapore. You will be given the unique opportunity to shape the future transportation network of Singapore. This will include identifying, developing and evaluating of new road and rail infrastructure projects.

You will design and supervise data collection activities, analyse and interpret survey results, develop transport network improvements proposals, forecast travel demand, assess community benefits and determine economic performance. You will also work closely with other Government agencies to develop integrated transport-landuse plans and provide transportation planning advice on future land use development initiatives.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in any discipline, preferably in Civil Engineering, Town/Urban Planning, Geography or a related discipline
• At least 3 years of experience in road, rail and/or bus planning
• Experience in land use planning, transport planning and transport modeling simulation techniques
• Knowledge of modeling using EMME/2, VISSIM/VISUM and/or SIDRA or other similar transportation models will be an advantage
• Excellent communication and writing skills
• Candidates with relevant experience, good understanding of transport/town planning principles and strong analytical capabilities will be considered for senior roles
• Candidates without experience may apply

Jobdesc:
Join the team and lead the change in Organisational Excellence and Innovation!

We are looking for a dynamic member to join our family as an Associate of Organisation Excellence to support the excellence initiatives within the organisation by enabling the effective operation of its organisational goals and plans. In addition, there will be exciting opportunities to collaborate with different departments to support their transformation and innovation initiatives, as the Centre embarks on its journey towards the development of a New Science Centre.

Essential Job Functions

Responsibilities of the Associate of Organisation Excellence include the following duties:

(A) Corporate Planning and Strategic Management

1. Support the planning and documentation requirements for the following corporate planning areas: - Annual corporate planning cycle and management events.

- Organisational performance analysis and reporting.

- Organisation-wide Enterprise Risk Management reporting.

- Strategic communication and coordination of corporate events.

- Evaluation and Impact management.

(B) Transformation and Innovation

2. Coordinate transformation initiatives to enhance the organisation’s performance and growth.

2. Assist in the coordination of innovation related initiatives such as the management of innovation tools and engagement platforms to sustain innovative practices.

Requirements

The ideal candidate should have at least 1-2 years of relevant experience in supporting strategic planning and/or data analysis and corporate management.

Candidates must have the following skills, attitudes and behaviours.

  • Analytical skills in management of data analysis tools such as Qlik sense or similar tools.
  • Experience in supporting innovation projects and workshops.
  • Experience in the coordination of employee engagement initiatives.
  • Good understanding and application of innovation skills such as Design Thinking.
  • Passionate and has a strong drive for excellence and the desire to make a difference.
  • Meticulous, resourceful and proactive with good managerial and organisational skills.
  • Team player with the ability to collaborate and engage multiple stakeholders.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • Strong skills in workshop customisation and facilitation.
  • Ability to communicate ideas clearly and effectively through written and oral skills.
  • Adaptable to changes based on organisational needs and government policies.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The Digital Economy is a key driver of economic growth for Singapore. Along with the economic promise of digitalisation come domestic and global challenges. International collaboration and driving government-to-government cooperation to enable interoperability of digital systems and governance frameworks has become increasingly important.

You would be part of the International Relations, Policy & Strategy (IRPS) team under the International Group that oversees IMDA’s bilateral, regional, and multilateral government-to-government engagements to advance IMDA and Singapore’s interests, working with your team to build strategic partnerships and alliances. You would also be a key member of inter-agency processes driving Singapore’s digital interests in negotiations for Digital Economy Agreements and Free Trade Agreements, as well as bilateral digital dialogues and exchanges with diverse stakeholders including with major markets.

Responsibilities

  • Strategise and advocate for Singapore's positions at regional/international organisations
  • Develop and execute plans to build strategic partnerships with local and international partners
  • Assess and advance Singapore's positions in bilateral and multilateral agreements on digital matters
  • Organise bilateral visits as well as international events and projects, including coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, sourcing for vendors and preparing discussion points
  • Independently research and prepare briefing papers on countries and international organisations of strategic interest

Requirements

  • Background in Political Science/Economics/Law/History/Engineering/Computer Science or relevant areas of study
  • 4-8 years of relevant working experience, preferably with exposure to international relations and/or government policy formulation
  • Interest in international relations, infocomm technologies, media, and emerging technology trends
  • Project management skills (manage budgets, timelines, scopes, and work allocation) 
  • Communication skills (Good grasp of English, proficiency in a second language is a bonus) 
  • Other Skills: presentations, problem-solving, analytical, writing, negotiations, networking

Jobtitle: Student Development Executive - Student Development & Alumni Relations
Jobdesc: Management of program logistics and support operations for NYP Scholarship Program, Student Life Academy, including the monitoring and reporting of scholar progress, establishment of strategic partnerships, and the execution of marketing and outreach plans.
Jobres:
• Manage scholar monitoring, tracking, and reporting, including database maintenance and regular assessment of scholars' progress.

  • Establish and maintain strategic relationships with potential mentors, top companies, life skills development training institutes, and community beneficiary partners.

  • Collaborate with partners to integrate specialized training programs that enhance the holistic development of scholars.

  • Develop and execute comprehensive marketing and outreach plans to promote the scholarship program to potential candidates.

  • Organize outreach events and information sessions to engage with prospective candidates and provide insights into the scholarship program.

  • Support and organize Student Life Academy's programs and department's key events.

• Relevant qualifications in Business Administration, Marketing or Communications, Digital Media, Project Management, or a related field.

  • Proven experience in program management, business development, and partnership establishment.

  • Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and dashboard reporting.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for building and maintaining strategic relationships.

  • Demonstrated ability to develop and execute comprehensive marketing and outreach plans.

  • Knowledge of the education sector and scholarship programs is an advantage.

Jobtitle: Student Development Executive - Student Development & Alumni Relations
Jobdesc: Design, and implementation of targeted development programs for NYP Scholarship Program and Student Life Academy, including program refinement via a data-driven approach.
Jobres:
• Design and implement a targeted development program focused on essential skills for scholarship interviews and admissions processes, such as in critical thinking, leadership, and communication.

  • Organize workshops, mock interviews, and mentorship sessions with industry experts and alumni to enhance scholars' readiness for future challenges.

  • Coordinate with educational institutions and industry leaders to provide additional resources, including mentorship, real world project opportunities, preparatory courses, and certification programs, to better equip scholars for their academic and professional journey.

  • Utilize feedback and data to identify areas for improvement and propose enhancements to the Capstone Program.

  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the success of the program and make data-driven decisions for continuous improvement.

  • Support and organize Student Life Academy's programs and department's key events.
