  • Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis for program refinement.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for organizing workshops, mock interviews, and mentorship sessions.

  • Knowledge of scholarship interviews, admissions processes, and key performance indicators in educational programs is an advantage.

  • Experience in curriculum design, training program development, and educational resource coordination is an advantage.

Jobdesc: Lecturer / Senior Lecturer (Teaching & Learning Specialist)
Jobres:
• Lead and support curriculum enhancements (e.g., implementing interdisciplinary learning, flipped learning, etc.) in partnership with academic leaders and stakeholders across TP
• Manage and coordinate projects with partners from across the POLITE sector in various programmes (e.g. through the Joint-Poly Committee for Enhancing Teaching and Learning (JP-CETL) and the Joint Polytechnic Academy for Educators (JP-AcE))
• Conduct research in evidence-informed T&L practices using data and learning analytics
• Drive adoption of innovative pedagogies and technologies to enhance PET/CET delivery
• Deliver joint-polytechnic and TP-specific professional development programmes for the academic community
• Explore and implement emerging technologies and approaches to respond to educational problem statements
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualification in Education, Education Technology, Adult Education or equivalent
• At least 10 years of teaching experience in the polytechnic, and demonstrated competencies in curriculum design, facilitation of learning, assessment, technology-enhanced learning
• Experienced in mentoring lecturers in implementing innovative ways of teaching
• An agile team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
• Robust analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle complex T&L challenges
• Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask
• Must be self-driven, resourceful, and creative
• Must possess a tenacious attitude with a growth mindset

Jobdesc:
[What the role is]

Assistant/ Manager, Business Analyst

[What you will be working on]

  • Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, document, and prioritize business requirements for new projects or initiatives.

  • Business Process Re-engineering: Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains within the organization.

  • Support change management: To support business users when changing over to the new application

  • Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of business processes, requirements, and analysis findings.

  • Communication: Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

  • Functional testing: To perform functional testing individually and with business domain users on new feature / capabilities developed

  • Data entry for new features: During periods where there is a parallel run, to perform data entry into the new applications, while current start work with the existing application

  • Reporting: To perform comparison of data between existing application and new application to ensure data is captured correctly.

[Who we are looking for]

  • Background in IT or software product management or education in software engineer / IT / information systems

  • At least three years of experience as a business analyst

  • At least four years of experience in quality assurance / management

  • Background in real estate is a big plus

  • Certification in Design Thinking and Quality Management is a big plus

  • Ideally some knowledge of SLA’s land and titles management

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to interpret complex data and make informed recommendations.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

  • Proficiency in data analysis tools, such as Excel, and business intelligence software is a big plus.

  • Understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.

  • Basic project management skills to understand and recommend changes to project planning where applicable.

  • Strong documentation skills to create clear and comprehensive business requirement documents and analysis reports. Experience in creating approval flows, managing spaces and documenting processes in JIRA and CONFLUENCE a big plus.

What the role is
Supporting the accounts receivable operations

What you will be working on

•       Process billing, receipting, debt management and other related functions in the areas of Accounts Receivables and Continuous Education Training (CET) programmes

•       Perform account reconciliation and financial statement

•       Perform data analysis

•       Perform review of processes for streamlining and automation

•       Perform other ad-hoc duties as assigned

What we are looking for

•       Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

•       Meticulous, well-organised and analytical individuals would be preferred.

Jobtitle: Assistant Mgr/Mgr/Senior Mgr, Access and Community Engagement (3 years)
Jobdesc: NAC’s Access & Community Engagement Department creates opportunities for everyone living in Singapore to have meaningful encounters with the arts as an integral part of their lives, contributing to building a connected society and a distinctive city. You will be part of the team advocating the value of the arts as well as developing strategies and fostering partnerships with corporate, government and social agencies for arts-based initiatives to thrive in the community. Your role will include working on various initiatives such as ArtsEverywhere@CDC and Arts & Wellbeing, to promote impactful programme design, drive capability development and research to extend reach of the arts.
Jobres:
• Partnership management to encourage access to the arts across life stages through new community touchpoints and the domains of health and community care.

  • Drive adoption of the arts for social and wellbeing outcomes.

  • Drive excellence in programme design through commissions and collaborations.

  • Administration of NAC’s funding and grant schemes which includes monitoring and review of funded projects and programs to ensure delivery of outcomes.
Jobreq:
• Good University degree.

  • At least 3 years of working experience.

  • Experience in planning and process development.

  • Meticulous with data and capable of basic data analysis to support decision-making.

  • Able to engage independently with partners and stakeholders in a personable and professional manner.

  • Articulate and confident, write and present well.

  • Able to remain professional and manage demanding and high-pressure situations.

  • Please note that this is a Supernumerary position, up till 2027.

  • Applicants who require work passes need not apply.

Interested applicants are to submit resume and one-page write-up on your interest and involvement in the arts.

Jobdesc: As a Deputy Manager/IT Application you will be involved in the software development life cycle including application development, implementation, maintenance and post-implementation review.
Jobres:
- Liaising extensively with external vendors or internal stakeholders.

- Analysing customers business requirements.

- Translating customers’ requirements into requirements specifications.

- Identifying options for potential solutions and assessing them for both technical and business suitability.

- Drawing up specific proposals for new, modified or replacement systems.

- Hands-on individual and be able to work with vendor teams to deliver projects on the technical aspects.

The role requires you to be hands-on and you will be involved in providing user support such as issues investigation and troubleshooting.

Cycle and Problem Resolution methodologies

Jobdesc: As a Systems Analyst, you will manage and provide support for systems as well as design and develop new applications.

- You will evaluate and provide recommendations through fit gap analysis, identify alternative solutions and develop/enhance existing systems/subsystems.

This role requires you to be hands-on and you will be involved in providing user support such as issues investigation and troubleshooting
Jobreq:

- You should be self-motivated with a positive attitude, have good analytical, communication, presentation, writing, problem solving and interpersonal skills.

- You should also have experience in one or more of the following:

- Good knowledge in software architecture design and system integration;

- Good project management and vendor management skills;

- Experience in managing and deploying Software as a service (SaaS) will be an added advantage.

- Knowledge in HR, Finance, CRM, Academic domain preferred

- Experience in .Net, Sharepoint, Outsystem will be an added advantage

Applicants may check their application status at the end of 8 weeks from the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: Learning Support Specialist - Student Care [ITE College East]
Jobdesc: As a Learning Support Specialist in ITE, your challenge is to formulate, review and implement policies and processes in specific functional areas.
Jobres: You will provide case counselling/management support to Special Education Needs (SEN) students. You will be part of the professional team to coordinate and monitor the help provided to these SEN students and/or work with their families and relevant stakeholders within ITE/external agencies to render support to these SEN students.
Jobreq:
You are expected to provide case counselling/management support for SEN students and their families and implement intervention programme, which include the following:


- Case counselling/management support for SEN students

- Referring SEN students to relevant stakeholders within and outside ITE to render necessary support
- Implement programmes for SEN students’ mental wellness social-emotional development


Applicants may check their application status at the end of 8 weeks from the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER, CIVIL & STRUCTURES
Jobres: You will be involved in the planning and design development of road and rail projects. You will conduct feasibility and engineering studies, review design submissions or carry out detailed civil and structural design for road / rail projects. You will also be involved in management of design consultants, conducting project safety reviews and construction audits for major infrastructure projects, reviewing engineering standards as well as providing technical support to construction teams and other LTA technical divisions for project implementation.

• At least 3 years of relevant experience in Civil / Structural Engineering design with knowledge in structural design and construction of underground engineering works / bridges /rail
• Keen interest in land transport infrastructure projects
• Good analytical, communication and interpersonal skills

Jobdesc: You will be part of the Memorial Facilities & Planning Division, which oversees the planning of after-death facilities in Singapore.
Jobres:
Your job responsibilities include:

  • Develop and review strategies and policies for government-managed after-death facilities, particularly the cemetery, to meet long-term demand.

  • Manage data and information gathering and in-depth analyses for the reviews.

  • Review licensing and regulations related to after-death.

  • Project development for new government-managed after-death facilities and land-related matters, including establishing requirements, securing funding, procurement.

  • Project management, including monitoring funding utilisation, resource planning, contract management for external consultants and contractors.

  • Collaborate with the engineering and corporate divisions, and with external stakeholders for policy development and implementation, and project execution.
Jobreq:
Job Requirements:

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in relevant fields such as construction, engineering, project development and management, public sector finance, procurement.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication.

  • Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills with attention to details.

  • Keen interest in project management work.

  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time. 

  • Team player who is resourceful and able to work independently.

  • Self-motivated and always ready to strive for improvement.

  • Good interpersonal skills and enjoy working with both internal and external stakeholders.

Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobtitle: Manager / Senior Manager, Industry Engagement (Financial Services Sector) [CPSD]
Jobdesc: You will play a role in championing the workforce transformation and reskilling needs of enterprises in the Financial Services sector. We are seeking a candidate with strong business development or enterprise solutions experience, especially in engaging companies to identify how Workforce Singapore’s initiatives can support their business transformation and manpower needs.
Jobres:
Enable industry and enterprise capabilities through strategic manpower planning

  • Identify and assess key industry, manpower challenges and skills through data analysis and trend evaluation
  • Engage strategic accounts and companies to ascertain company’s manpower related and reskilling pain points and work with companies to implement strategies for workforce transformation
  • Recommend strategic human capital solutions aligning with industry or enterprises’ business and manpower needs
  • Support the Industry Transformation Map (ITM) and Jobs Transformation Map (JTM) to articulate key insights and trends, particularly the Jobs and Skills pillar
  • Implement pilot initiatives to identify proof points and use cases related to the national career health agenda

Forge impactful partnerships and collaborations through stakeholder engagement

  • Establish and maintain effective relationships with public agencies, strategic partners and stakeholders
  • Collaborate with industry stakeholders, trade associations, tripartite partners and programme partners to develop and implement relevant manpower interventions to address industry manpower issues
  • Consult with employers to promote adoption of WSG programmes and progressive human resource practices to address their manpower needs

Manage and review programmes to achieve positive outcomes

  • Guide and work with appointed programme partners to ensure compliance with policies and processes
  • Organise or support outreach and marketing events such as career events and industry engagements
  • Track programmes’ progress and analyse industry related information to evaluate and make recommendations for management decision making
Jobreq:
Knowledge/Skills

  • At least four years of working experience is preferred, although fresh university graduates who possess maturity, strong communication and interpersonal skills will be considered
  • Awareness of various government initiatives related to manpower and training would be advantageous including experience in handling business needs analysis and transformation projects
  • Strong engagement skills with experience in account/ project management and/or consultancy role
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills
  • Good persuasive and negotiation skills  
  • Strong data analytics skills would be advantageous
  • Able to synthesise information and data for decision making and outcome monitoring

Aptitudes/Abilities & Other Characteristics

  • Innovative, passionate, and driven
  • Possesses agility in problem-solving in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
  • Possesses strong time management skills
  • Able to work with converging timelines
  • Confident in and comfortable with public speaking
  • Ability to work both independently and in teams
  • Comfortable with data compilation and analysis
  • Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Embraces digital and technological solutions

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Jobdesc:
The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) champions the development of a future ready built environment for Singapore. Besides regulating building safety, we lead and transform the built environment sector in delivering a safe, high quality, sustainable and friendly built environment.

We are looking for resourceful, energetic and self-motivated individuals who are inspired to play an active role to make a difference to Singapore’s built environment.
Jobres:
The Deputy Director (Future Capabilities) will be responsible for developing and implementing the Data Analytics, AI and other emerging technologies. This role requires a leader who can align emerging technologies with the organisation’s overall business goals. You will lead a team of Data, AI and RPA engineers, to harness the power of technology, driving innovation and enabling data-driven decision-making across the organisation.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Strategy and Leadership
- Develop and execute a comprehensive Data and AI strategy that supports the company’s goals and objectives.
- Lead the design, development, and implementation of data governance, data architecture, and AI frameworks.

Data Infrastructure and Management
- Oversee the development and maintenance of scalable data infrastructure, ensuring that data pipelines, warehouses, and platforms meet the needs of the business.
- Ensure data quality, security, and compliance with regulatory standards.
- Collaborate with IT and engineering teams to ensure the proper integration of data systems with other business systems.

RPA, AI and Machine Learning Innovation
- Drive the development and deployment of AI and machine learning models to solve key business problems and improve decision-making.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest AI and data science trends, and incorporate new technologies where applicable.
- Lead research and development efforts to explore new applications of AI within the organization.

Analytics and Insights
- Oversee the creation of advanced analytics and reporting to provide actionable insights for business leaders.
- Develop predictive models to anticipate business trends and inform strategy.
- Ensure that data analytics efforts are aligned with business priorities and deliver measurable ROI.

Collaboration and Stakeholder Management
- Partner with various business units to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions.
- Work closely with product, marketing, operations, and finance teams to support data-driven initiatives.
- Present insights and data-driven recommendations to executive leadership.

Budget and Resource Management
- Manage the data and AI department’s budget, ensuring that resources are allocated efficiently and effectively.
- Oversee vendor relationships and third-party service agreements related to data and AI services.
Jobreq:
- Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or related fields.
- Experience in data analytics, AI, or related fields, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
- Proven experience developing and executing data and AI strategies at scale.
- Strong leadership and team management skills.

Agncy: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Jobtitle: Manager/ Senior Manager, Enterprise Risk Management
Jobdesc:
Reporting to the Deputy Director, STRMO, the jobholder will assist HTX Chief Risk Officer (CRO) and the Risk Management Committee in providing oversight and guidance on the management of risks faced by HTX.  
Operationally, this involves covering various aspects of the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) process including risk identification, assessments, analysis, mitigation and monitoring; defining the various risk owners’ roles and responsibilities; conducting risks training/workshops; providing stakeholders with advice on risk insights, risk culture; their risk mitigation plans; and preparing updates to stakeholders on the status of risk management in HTX.
Jobres:
The jobholder will be responsible for the following:
• Ensure that risk management policies, systems and processes remain relevant, effective and useful.
• Lead initiatives, such as risk management training programs, to cultivate a sustainable and effective Control and Risk Culture in HTX
• Prepare dashboards, risk reports for regular presentation and reporting to Senior Management.
• Engage HTX risks owners to identify, assess and prioritise their respective risks areas, and provide advice to the risk owners to formulate meaningful key risk indicators, appropriate risk response plans to manage their respective risks within the approved risk appetite and tolerance. 
• Analyse and rationalise key risk data together with the respective risk owners to identify potential emerging internal and external risk trends, for the necessary follow up by the risk owners. 
• Provide secretariat support to the HTX Risk Management Committee and other Management forums on all ERM matters.
• Connect with WOG agencies for best practices on ERM programme for government agencies.
Jobreq:
• Tertiary qualifications in business management, administration, finance. 
• Professional certification in risk management.
• Minimally 5 years’ relevant work experience in ERM, Risk Governance and Management.  
• Having relevant experience in data analytics would be advantageous.
• Being able to work independently, being analytical with excellent interpersonal, communication and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (powerpoint, excel) skills are required.
• Having digital infographics skill to create digital communication materials would be advantages.
• Able to build consensus across different functions and stakeholders, partner and advise the former on identification, analysis, mitigation, and monitoring of risks.
• Continuous learning mindset to keep abreast of emerging risk trend locally and internationally. 
• Team-player mindset is necessary, as the jobholder may be required to assist in other duties if needed.
